Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
SUMMARY:
Our mission is to utilize cutting edge technology to improve the healthcare services for millions of Americans. This Web Application Architect role will contribute to the ongoing build out and enhancement of our web-based analytics delivery platform in support of our internal customers within Enterprise Operations to help drive differentiated service, operational efficiency, and a positive customer experience. What you bring to the table is more than just your technical skills – your unique perspective, culture, and ideas will help us create better products and services!

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :
Enable the delivery of interactive, data-driven applications to enhance throughput, reduce cost, and improve quality within Enterprise Operations.
Select appropriate technologies and design web infrastructure and applications to support evolving business needs.
Proactively conduct root-cause analyses and identify and implement enhancement opportunities for our analytic platforms and their included applications.
Develop understanding of and ability to work within Agile software development practices.
Present results and/or recommendations to internal stakeholders as needed.
Create, communicate, and adhere to development timelines.
Balance and prioritize projects across a wide development portfolio.
Continuously develop skills in Python Flask, ReactJS, and other core elements of the team tech stack.
Attain and share subject matter expertise in the platform itself, the Information Technology infrastructure on which it depends, as well as the business processes and outcomes it seeks to improve.
Assist the team in opportunistically evolving and improving the overall technology stack.
Flexibility to work remotely anywhere within the US, however expected work hours will be 9-5 Eastern Time.


Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant discipline, OR 5+ years of professional software engineering experience preferred, OR completion of relevant Code Camps with Certification
Experience building user interfaces using ReactJS, Angular, Vue, Ember, or equivalent.
Experience with API endpoints using Python Flask, Java Spring, or equivalent.
Experience querying relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Hadoop Hive, or equivalent).
Experience with log tools such as Splunk, Kafka, New Relic, or equivalent a plus.
Experience with data visualization libraries/tools (D3, FusionCharts, HighCharts, Plotly, Tableau) a plus.
Experience with Agile methodology for software development strongly preferred.
Knowledgeable regarding popular trends and best practices in web application development.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to design solutions that are innovative, thorough, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.
Troubleshooting skills.
Analytical and detail-oriented in all work activities.
Customer-focused in all work activities.
Ability to communicate and present professionally and effectively.
Ability to mentor internal customers in use of software applications.
Demonstrated team collaboration experience.
Ability to handle/balance multiple projects or tasks at a time.
Ability to solve complex/difficult problems.
Ability to quickly learn how to use new libraries, API's, software applications, etc.
Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.
Familiarity with health care or PBM industry a plus.

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

Cigna is a leading health services company, with a global presence and 95+ million customers. The new Data & Analytics (DNA) group at Cigna is developing innovative technology to make healthcare simple, transparent, and more affordable. We are seeking full stack software / data engineers to join us and help modernize the healthcare industry.

Contribute as a Senior Software Engineer to a dynamic team developing a web application that identifies and tracks critical opportunities for market managers and contract negotiators at Cigna. The application provides end-users a pipeline of cost-saving opportunities and enables them to discuss/research them, review suggested actions on them and ultimately report savings generated. The Opportunity Detection application lives at the intersection of software engineering, data science and health insurance business operations.

KEY CHARACTERISTICS

A focus on DevOps and CICD pattern engineering

You will develop full stack applications that are scalable, robust, and thoughtfully designed. You are comfortable with all layers of the stack, from the database to the front-end.

You will be involved in the full software development lifecycle, from design to implementation.

You build components in modular, reusable fashion that makes it easy to re-use.

You will mentor junior developers and support their learning experience

You will ship production code to a large customer base, and will take full ownership of your work, including testing and deployments.

You will collaborate with other software engineers, domain experts, and end-users, to build the right solutions that address our business needs. You know how to navigate an organization to find the people and answers you need.

You know how to make engineering trade-offs and how to communicate them to others. You can prioritize many competing tasks on an aggressive timeline.

You are passionate about learning – about healthcare as well as technology.

You are entrepreneurial, business-minded, and are willing to take risks and advocate new ideas

REQUIREMENTS

2+ years being part of Agile teams – Scrum or Kanban

Typescript, Python, Java, C++, Go, etc.

Infrastructure as code experience - Terraform/Cloudformation/Jenkins

Cloud experience - AWS preferred

RDBMS knowledge (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.) and experience working with large data sets

Excellent troubleshooting skills

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Computer Science preferred or the equivalent in education and experience

BONUS POINTS FOR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING

Prior healthcare experience

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

The new Data & Analytics Engineering group at Cigna is developing innovative technology to make healthcare simple, transparent, and more affordable. We are seeking highly talented and innovative cloud solution engineers to join us and help modernize the healthcare industry.

This team develops applications that provide Cigna with the analytics to optimize affordability for its members. Our tools analyze historical data to identify insights, forecast trends, and recommend actionable items to improve total medical costs. We are also advancing workflows with embedded insights that leverage machine learning techniques. You will have the opportunity to support the design, development, and deployment of new applications and features that will directly impact Cigna's bottom line, to ultimately provide better and more affordable healthcare. Our team uses a variety of technologies, from big data to the latest web frameworks. You will get to build state-of-the-art technology that is scalable and robust, utilizing cloud infrastructure, and full automation.

Ideal Candidates for this role will possess a high-level working knowledge and experience with the relevant stack (Python, SQL, Angular, AWS, DevOps (Jenkins, Ansible etc.)), preferably within an enterprise environment. Ideal candidates will be able to translate business needs and processes into solid technical requirements, speak to applicable patterns that will best achieve desired functionality, and be able to continuously deliver value and new features to our user base. They would demonstrate solid individual performance in a team environment, mentor less experienced developers, and participate in leadership strategy discussions that impact the health and roadmap of our web application suite. They should approach problems in a self-directed and inventive manner and engage in ego-less and productive retrospectives and discussions with a mentality of inclusiveness, respect, experimentation, and improvement.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with Operations business partners and Strategic Analytics colleagues to evaluate complex user-requests/projects.

Works to develop skills, self-motivated, provides feedback to others, and oversees resolution technical issues and complexities.

Ensure that all functionality is comprehensively tested in an automated way (regression, performance, compliance) before rollout to production.

Collaborate with Developers to deliver products aligned with recommended architectural/design patterns and identify and evaluate new patterns as they emerge.

Ensures defects are quickly assessed and/or mitigated and resolved, whether in non-production or production.

Help to solidify objectives and functional requirements for new or enhanced application capabilities.

Help to determine/estimate feasibility, cost and time required, compatibility with current system.

Prepare project documentation when needed and review code work for accuracy and functionality.

Mentor less experienced developers.

Participate in off-hours releases when necessary to ensure smooth deployments of new functionality, while working towards reducing the necessity of off-hours participation.
REQUIREMENTS

7+ years of work experience in programming / software development.

5+ years’ experience with Python.

5+ years of full stack including front-end app experience, with at least 1 of those years being with Angular and TypeScript.

Tableau or other data visualization framework experience is a plus.

Cypress or other testing automation framework experience is a plus.

Experience in deploy using CICD, run and manage applications in AWS is a plus.

Advanced proficiency creating and implementing API endpoints.

Experienced with writing efficient and optimized SQL queries and stored procedures.

Experienced in data schema best practices, preferably with applicable experience with PostgreSQL

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Computer Science preferred or the equivalent in education and experience

Thorough knowledge of programming concepts, design, procedures and practices.

Adaptability and willingness to learn, preferably a strong desire to learn.

Advanced problem-solving skills, and a proven history of solving complex problems.

Ability to work collaboratively with other departments to resolve complex issues with innovative solutions.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and meet multiple project deadlines.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Must be extremely detail-oriented, but able to keep a big-picture perspective, applying details at the appropriate point in an iterative project.

Strong customer service focus.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Familiarity with the Health Care Industry a plus.

Committed to delivering high-quality software solutions.

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
Job Description
We are looking for developers who really enjoy writing code to help us design and build large-scale applications. The position requires hands-on development of service-based scalable applications. Our team is extremely collaborative. Interested candidates must love to write code, be self-motivated, willing to learn, and willing to share new ideas to improve our team and processes. Description
Candidates will need to have experience with medium-to-large-scale web development.
Ability to develop within “full” technology stack (backend, frontend).
Be part of a fast moving team, working with the latest tools and open source technologies
Design and develop our next generation of RESTful APIs and Event driven services in a distributed environment
Use advanced, distributed technologies to process, store, and quickly retrieve huge volumes of data
Work on a development team using agile methodologies

Requirements
3 plus years full stack development experience strongly preferred
Experience with scripting languages such as JavaScript, Ruby, or Python
Experience with Angular 2+ (preferred), React, or Ember.
Web application development experience with compiled languages such as Java, Groovy, C#, or Go
Solid understanding of OOP, Design Patterns, Data Structures and Web Standards

Strong understanding of parallel processing, concurrency and asynchronous concepts

Experience with Linux

Experience in writing native SQL queries

Experience with Angular 2+
Experience with Node
Experience in a startup
Experience in SSO (SAML, OPENID)
Knowledge of search solutions such as Lucene, Solr, or ElasticSearch
Experience in architecting and designing distributed systems that are highly available and security focused
Experience with designing event-based systems
Understanding Queue/Messaging services- JMS, Amazon SQS, MS MQ, etc.
Experience with single-page applications

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Java Services Engineer (internal title: Software Engineering Sr. Advisor) uses in-depth knowledge and experience to maintain and enhance a Spring driven, cloud based API. Creates detailed specifications, implement maintenance and enhancements, conduct quality assurance reviews of peer's application programming, and act as a resource for team members with less experience. Provides counsel and advice to top management on significant Application Development matters, often requiring coordination between organizations. Acts as the designer for complex major systems and their subsystems utilizing a thorough understanding of available technology, tools and existing designs. Provides comprehensive consultation to business unit and IT management and staff at the technical level on all phases of application programming and processes for diverse development platforms, computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server, software, hardware, technologies and tools, etc.). Works closely with client and IT management and staff to identify application development solutions, new or modified programs, reuse of existing code through the use of program development software alternatives, or integration of purchased solutions or a combination of the available alternatives.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Responsible for the delivery of a business need end-to-end starting from understanding the requirements to deploying the software into production. This role requires you to be fluent in some of the critical technologies with proficiency in others and have a hunger to learn on the job and add value to the business. Critical attributes of being a full-stack engineer among others is Ownership & Accountability.

In addition to Delivery, the advisor should have an automation first and continuous improvement mindset. He/she should drive the adoption of CI/CD tools and support the improvement of the tools sets/processes.

The candidate will need to have expertise in software engineering as well as data analysis. This person needs to understand the interrelationships between systems, and be able to write working software that will successfully integrate and interface these systems. From a system and design perspective this person will need to understand how different pieces work together and use library calls, REST APIs, database queries, etc.) In order to communicate with them. The candidate will play a technical role in an enterprise area responsible for driving innovative analytical methods to better align IT analytics with CIGNA’s short term and long-term goals, adding value by adopting software engineering best practices. The candidate must possess excellent analytical and technical skills coupled with the ability to quickly learn new technologies. The individual will be hands on with architecture and design to support various Cigna organizations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.

12+ years of experience in IT delivery

5+ years of experience in software development of enterprise Java web applications or API, preferably using Spring.

5+ years' experience being past of Agile teams and working in Agile methodology

Spring, SpringBoot, GIT, Maven, Jenkins, Splunk.

Experience with SQL and ability to check data

Experience working with databases like DB2, Oracle, MongoDB (desirable)

Experience working with Kafka, Attunity and MQ technologies is desirable

Thorough understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field.

Ability to provide and implement technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.

Experience creating solutions that are innovative, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.

Strong customer service focus.

Ability to lead discussions with all levels of the organization and provide balanced information of an idea or communication of an issue regardless of written or verbal.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry and a passion for driving positive patient outcomes

Familiar with working in a vendor partner model.

Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Strong mentoring skills.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Adaptability and willingness to lean new tools and applications.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across project teams.

Ability to learn new technology and technical products to increase technical skills and expertise.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

Do you have a passion for programming and find yourself asking “I wonder if I could do it this way…”? Our software engineering teams start with strategy and then create, test and deploy our client and patient applications. The result? Innovative, high-performing, scalable user-facing solutions relied on by millions every day. We work in an Agile environment, partnering with teams across the organization to craft exceptional applications – with the ultimate goal of improving health outcomes for the 100 million people we serve.

ABOUT CIGNA

At Cigna, we dare to imagine a better health care system, and we’re driven to make it happen. Where some see obstacles, we see possibilities. We’re challengers, difference-makers and opportunity-seekers, united with our partners in pursuit of a simpler, more sustainable system and better health for all.

We have always acted first to take on the toughest challenges. We uniquely partner across the health care ecosystem to uncover opportunities, take action, advance health care and deliver better outcomes – like no one else can. We believe health care can do more. We are Champions For Better. Express Scripts, part of Cigna Corporation, unlocks new value in pharmacy, medical and beyond to further total health for all.

Enable the delivery of interactive, data-driven applications to enhance throughput, reduce cost, and improve quality within Enterprise Operations.

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
Ux Engineer
We are looking for developers who really enjoy writing code to help us design and build large-scale applications. The position requires hands-on development of service-based scalable applications. Our team is extremely collaborative. Interested candidates must love to write code, be self-motivated, willing to learn, and willing to share new ideas to improve our team and processes.
Candidates will need to have experience with medium-to-large-scale web development. Ability to develop within "full" technology stack (back,middle,front end).
Be part of a fast moving team, working with the latest tools and open source technologies Design and develop our next generation of RESTful APIs and Event driven services in a distributed environment Use advanced, distributed technologies to process, store, and quickly retrieve huge volumes of data Work on a development team using agile methodologies

General Qualifications / Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline strongly preferred, diverse work experience in IT with a minimum of five years’ experience designing, developing, deploying, and supporting computing applications in a large-scale, complex environment.
Strong communication skills geared towards effective communication of concepts, design rationale and findings to the organization.
Track record of consistently driving projects to completion and taking accountability for work and results. Confronts tough issues and situations.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Ability to perform detailed analysis of business problems and technical environments.
Ability to think strategically and implement iteratively. Ability to estimate financial impact of design/architecture alternatives.
Proven track record of success in challenging the status quo, implementing new ideas and designs with a practical orientation.

Experience with scripting languages such as JavaScript, Ruby, or Python
Experience with Angular 2+ (preferred), React, or Ember.
Web application development experience with compiled languages such as Java, Groovy, C#, or Go
Solid understanding of OOP, Design Patterns, Data Structures and Web Standards Solid understanding of JavaScript, HTML and CSS Strong understanding of parallel processing, concurrency and asynchronous concepts
Experience with developing RESTful web services Experience in writing native SQL queries Relational Database - experience using Oracle, MySQL/MariaDB, Postgres, or SQLServer NoSql Database - DynamoDb, MongoDB, Cassandra
Caching - Redis, Memcached Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred)

Nice to Have / Skills
Experience with Angular 2+ Experience with Node Experience in a startup Experience in SSO (SAML, OPENID)
Knowledge of search solutions such as ElasticSearch Experience in architecting and designing distributed systems that are highly available and security focused Experience with single-page applications

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, Work from home, Evernorth
Job_Description:
Help us secure our future. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Do you have problem-solving or strategy experience? If so, prepare to innovate, create, and inspire. The Okta Senior Engineer (Information Protection Senior Advisor) is responsible for an exciting role on Cigna’s Customer Identity & Access Management (CIAM) team. The ideal candidate will have in-depth expertise and hands-on experience implementing large enterprise Okta CIAM deployments.

Responsibilities
Provide expert architecture, engineering, and project support for key Okta CIAM initiatives.
Regularly meet with application development teams throughout the enterprise to understand their specific Okta integration requirements and evaluate feasibility.
Interface with various stakeholders to scope and plan engineering efforts to ensure project and feature launch success.
Contribute to developing and executing a multi-year CIAM strategy and roadmap for enterprise stakeholders.
Drive proof of concepts to determine solution approach and scope.
Assist with Okta configuration and test data setup for applications.
Assist application teams with issue resolution.
Assist with the promotion of the application configuration to production Okta tenants.
Participate in vendor and tool selection in alignment with solution architecture.
Maintain a broad and deep technical understanding of the Okta product line and the underlying technologies and protocols.
Participate in compliance and security reviews as necessary, including working closely with internal teams to build security, reliability, and scalability practices into the OKTA platform.
Educate, evangelize, and share best practices, tool updates, and policy updates.
Report key performance metrics to stakeholders.

Qualifications
High School diploma; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Expert technical expertise with large-scale Okta CIAM deployments in an enterprise setting.
Previous experience in designing and architecting CIAM-enabling capabilities that delivered business objectives.
Expert knowledge and hands-on experience implementing applications with modern authentication and authorization protocols (OAuth, OIDC, SAML).
Experience with modern DevOps processes and an in-depth understanding of software engineering principles and practices.
Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively to resolve complex issues with innovative solutions.
Experience and expert knowledge of Identity as a Service and Federation technologies (Okta, ISAM, TFIM, etc.).
Strong interpersonal, team building, communication, leadership, negotiation, and motivational skills.
Demonstrated skill at creating technical documentation for complex processes and applications.
Experience with Splunk, ServiceNow, QRADAR, JIRA
Experience building web applications, incorporating both front and backend languages/frameworks is a plus.
Experience with leading architectural efforts for cloud services.
Self-motivated, adaptable, and able to prioritize and motivate others.

Job_Description:

Title: UX/UI Designer - MDLIVE
Job_Description:
The mission of the Enterprise Design Systems Team is to set the bar for design system disciplines and define the processes, work output, platforms and tools that will bring efficiency and quality to product delivery. This team incubates new design patterns, design systems that represent the evolution of the brand in the digital product environment, and innovative experiential concepts that push the expectations of users in the health-focused digital ecosystem. The design system is intended to deliver cohesive and consistent design standards to all the product lines associated with health plan and health services, and to expand to represent the voices of the direct customer, the client, and the provider.
Evernorth was founded in 2020 by Cigna Corporation in hopes to be an aggregator of our multi-brand products and services -- A new movement in Health care to innovate and evolve our Healthcare industry as we know it today.

Job Description
We’re seeking a UX Designer to help drive the evolution of visual language standards and guidelines across a multi-brand enterprise design system. Leveraging your knowledge of user-centric best practices and UI skillset, you will help the team to build a scalable system with dynamic theming to meet the needs across product lines, services, and brands. You will help to maintain and evolve current libraries and enable new branding and themes. You will collaborate closely with multiple design and engineering teams to implement solutions that create consistent, elevated experiences and accelerate delivery.

This position reports to the Enterprise Designs Systems Director


BS Degree with 3- 5 years of experience or equivalent work experience

Strong experience designing and shipping impactful experiences inclusive of design, strategy, and systems

Strong attention to detail with an eye for exceptional UX practices

Demonstrable experience leveraging and evolving design systems
and component libraries

Experience with accessibility, responsive design, and atomic design

Desire to learn and grow, as well as mentor others within a collaborative team environment

Experience working across primary platforms for desktop and mobile

Ability to communicate at various levels within large organizations

Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions

Familiarity with dynamic theming and design tokens a plus
Role responsibilities

Help to drive the evolution and visual language standards across a multi-brand enterprise design system

Design and define patterns through components, documentation, and prototypes

Identify brand elements to promote as reusable enterprise patterns and components

Ensure patterns meets standards and guidelines for accessibility

Collaborate with designers across teams to evolve and support contribution model

Help in creating documentation and training materials for design system adoption

Collaborate to test components and patterns as needed to ensure usability and consistency
Preferred

Highly proficient in current design tools (Figma preferred)

Please come join our innovative ever-growing company. You will gain experience in a diverse and exciting set of technologies and clients and have a real impact on Evernorth’s cultural passionate, and dynamic future.

Title: Sr Digital Product Manager - Evernorth (Work at Home)
Job_Description:
Job Summary:
The Senior Digital Product Manager is directly responsible for the Cigna Medicare digital experience for prospects, customers, and producers/brokers. The Senior Digital Product Manager’s role is to help drive innovation, definition and execution of digital experiences that help integrate Medicare customers and producers in a single ecosystem working in close collaboration with key stakeholders. Work closely with internal and external direct-to-consumer, sales and service operations teams, product managers, designers, developers, and architects to develop new product ideas and coordinate rapid, smooth, and successful product launches. Think through opportunities to use new technologies, and deliver awesome digital experiences.

Core Responsibilities:
Developing multi-year digital roadmap for Medicare products in conjunction with Cigna's digital strategy and roadmaps by partnering with Medicare business.
Enabling a differentiated shopping and enrollment guidance and human-centered support across the distinct stages of shopping journey for prospects.
Implementing robust self-service experience on web and mobile app for all Medicare customers starting with basic foundational capabilities to differentiated and transformative experiences.
Enabling integrated producer experience for Medicare across web and Sales CRM.
Owns and manages the digital experience for web and mobile applications inclusive of prospect, customer, and broker’s digital interactions with Cigna, as well as integration approach with enrollment systems to help scale and flex to meet business growth.
Manages business delivery components (e.g., requirements, content, Agile stories, etc.) in coordination with IT and Design delivery components.
Responsible for ensuring products delivered meet the constituents’ needs in a high quality manner through appropriate testing and UX rigor.
Drives solutions using fact-based metrics, measurements, and research.
Manages requirements delivery and traceability to capabilities and the business case.
Coordinates impact assessments across all major programs impacting the digital experience.
Effectively partners with Marketing for communication to constituents (internal and external).
Lives and breathes the voice of the customer.


Defines/prioritizes the scope based on business metrics aligned with the appropriate delivery budget and delivery sequence.
Partners with technology, design, and other business stakeholders/matrix partners for execution of multi-year strategy.
Accountable for defining voice of the customer capability requirements and prioritizing requirements for delivery based on customer, market, and business value.
Assesses key market factors, including competitive landscape, digital landscape, constituent insights, and unmet customer and provider needs to develop innovative products, services and programs.


Expert knowledge in digital product management and development, with demonstrated ability to own digital (web and mobile – iOS/Android) products.
Demonstrated deep knowledge of healthcare products, and Salesforce experience.
Strategic thinker, capable of thinking outside the healthcare box and focus on world-class experiences.
Ability to drive results, lead cross-functional teams, influence others, and foster collaboration.
Strong analytical capabilities, ability to define metrics that inform product decisions.
Comfort with diving into the technical details with systems analysts, developers and architects.
Experience with Medicare products is a plus
Requires a BA/BS degree (Computer Science/Engineering or Business preferred) and minimum 5 years of experience in digital product management and development.

Title: Sr Digital Product Manager - Evernorth (Work at Home)
Job_Description:
United States - Work From Home

JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Mobile Development Sr. Manager, Software Engineer, supports a team of Software Development Engineers. This position participates in the evaluation and prioritization of customer and user requests. Managing team activities, providing functional guidance and completing individual tasks as needed. Ensures the team follows Agile best practices as defined by Express Scripts. Participates in cross-departmental Technology initiatives. The Technology Manager has accountability for the work of all members of the team, and represents, strategizes, and promotes methodologies and processes and devises improvements to the current processes. The Sr. Manager is also responsible for providing timely feedback to their team members and assisting their leadership with year-end calibration and identification of high performers.

The Sr. manager is responsible in leading the mobile development team as a people leader, and scrum master, in the day-to-day activities that will serve the mobile teams. The sr. manager will support various team activities for the mobile client teams, participating story grooming sessions, assisting TPO with backlogs and project reviews. This may include sprint planning, sprint demos and retrospectives that assists the team to a continuous improvement culture. The sr. manager must possess high competence in communication, negotiation, listening, mitigate conflict, build alliances and achieve desired results using strong interpersonal and diplomacy skills.


Provides direction and manages mid-level professional employees, high-level non-exempts, and/or supervisors; may manage technical/business support or production/operation staff; Is accountable for the performance and results of a team within own discipline or function; Adapts departmental plans and priorities to address resources and operational changes; Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives.
Ability to lead high talent teams in local and remote locations; Previous supervisory experience in leading a technical team or managing a larger cross-functional team of non-direct reports; Ability to motivate employees, handle difficult employee relations issues and create a culture that supports high employee morale; Conceptual knowledge of IT concepts, procedures and practices; Advanced problem solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other departments to resolve complex issues with innovative solutions; Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines; Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions; Extremely detail oriented; Strong customer service focus; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Willingness to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines


Works to develop employee’s skills, evaluates performance, provides regular feedback, supports employee career path growth, and oversees resolution of employee relations issues.

Works with the architect and stake holders/partners to develop solutions in support of mobile development

Proactively manages cross-team relationships and expectations

Facilitates timely and routine communication in both directions between mobile teams and the upstream dependent teams.

Partners with TPO/architect to help prioritize backlogs based on business needs/compliance/client commitments/technology debts

Scales solutions to the client’s goals and budget

Serves as escalation point for the team’s critical issues

Communicates team status

Support activities in project initiation during conceptual stages through funding approval

Coordinates with cross project teams in planning & execution, resolves challenges around projects, priorities, & releases

Coordinates with cross-teams for necessary resources

Knows and understands key performance indicators for the team’s success

Participates in usual people leader duties that include regular 1X1s, career development, performance management, and meeting financial targets

Assists with the Budget planning and management for their department


Bachelor’s degree in related field and 8+ years relevant experience

Experienced with mobile development

Knowledge in mobile client standards and techniques for mobile applications

Understand mobile-specific performance & issues

Experience leading a team of mobile developers

Strong & proven analytical skills and knowledgeable in mobile tools (Splunk, Adobe Analytics is a plus)

Experienced with app store and in-app feedback

Scrum Master experience with various agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)

Excellent verbal and written communication and presentations skills

Experience working with cross teams and partners

Proven ability to meet deadlines and balance multiple deadlines

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Cigna Digital continues to enhance our customer facing digital assets to provide world class tools and customer experiences. The PM leads project level delivery of functional and technical priorities and managing project plans, facilitating process and execution of Cigna’s digital strategy across myCigna.com and well.evernorth.com web and mobile assets.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with Scrum Masters as they execute Scrum ceremonies such as Story Grooming, Sprint Planning, Release Planning, Sprint Retrospective, Sprint Demo, and Product Backlog Review.

Coordinate work and resources across scrum teams to develop end-to-end architectural diagrams, data flows, and test cases by sprint/release.

Define and implement structured release plan, including forecasting, tracking, and reporting.

Ensure that all test data needs to support project scope are identified and fulfilled at sprint/release level.

Actively engage in Sprint/Release Planning activities, driving the Scrum team and Business Stakeholders to collaboratively negotiate scope and delivery schedule.

Monitor work item setup for Sprint/Releases is accurately represented in Jira to allow concise status updates on delivery completion.

Many blocking issues will be beyond the team’s authority or will require support from other teams. This role actively addresses these issues so that the team can remain focused on achieving the objectives of the iteration.

Monitor daily issues impacting the team; facilitate resolutions and escalation as necessary

Ensures that Jira accurately reflects cross scrum team dependencies and scrum team progress

Provide servant leadership helping to remove any impediments to all Scrum team, follow through on and ensure that improvements identified during Sprint Retrospective are being executed.

Provide hands-on issue resolution and testing support to Scrum teams when end-to-end processes are executed.

Create and Maintain comprehensive project documentation.

Required Experience/Qualifications

3+ years of hands-on experience as a Scrum Master or Project Manager

2+ years of Continuous Improvement/ Process Management

Experience working with application development

Demonstrated history of seeing products from inception to launch

Ability to develop a working knowledge of the technical domain to effectively support technical risks that may arise

Experience with Agile development (SCRUM methodology) and demonstrated ability to lead teams towards high performance and continual improvement

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Capable of negotiating successful delivery with business leads

Comfortable negotiating and presenting to IT and business executives

Capable of driving alignment across the technology organization

Exceptional oral and written communication skills

Experience managing virtual and distributed teams across time zones

Desired Experience/Qualifications

JIRA working knowledge

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Agile Product Management Senior Manager
Global Intake Planning & Delivery (GIPD), Global Infrastructure & Operations

Role Summary/Key Objectives:
The Agile Product Management Senior Manager owns all aspects of their technical vertical, leading business value creation and managing overall product health. This senior manager applies specialized product knowledge and expertise to understand business and technology objectives, communicate the product vision and roadmap, prioritize and translate needs into requirements to ensure that expected outcomes are achieved.

Responsibilities:
Lead a team of Agile Product Managers (APMs) who are responsible for aligning work to strategy and communicating incremental value delivered to engineering leadership on a regular cadence
Facilitate product/service roadmap discussions and drive long term planning where possible (3mo. - 3yr.)
Partner with Global Intake to route requests through the process as efficiently and expeditiously as possible
Participate in PI planning events as needed and ensure alignment of priorities with engineering leadership in advance of each PI
Identify & manage cross-functional interdependencies to remove impediments to work
Regularly review agile metrics to derive insights and recommend actions that drive operational efficiency for engineering teams – socialize with engineering leadership
Continuously reinforce agile principles to help drive agile maturity across the team using agile maturity assessments, OKRs, and other KPIs
Continuously develop strong product/service knowledge and understand product/service business value
Manage escalations from team members and Engineering counterparts to ensure overall customer satisfaction from partner teams.


Experience supporting teams and working with multiple cross functional stakeholders
Passionate advocate, with the ability to identify, champion customer needs, and improve with agile principles in mind
Ability to work cross functionally with Business Stakeholders, Software Engineering, CIP, Infrastructure, etc.
Experience in agile tools (JIRA), collaboration tools (Confluence, SharePoint, HipChat, etc), Visio, reporting tools (Tableau), ticketing systems (ServiceNow, iService, etc) and Identity Governance Platforms (Savyint) preferred.
Proven skill at balancing infrastructure technical knowledge with business acumen
High degree of comfort in a fast-paced / ambiguous environment
Strong understanding of Service Design, experience with matrixed working relationships, and best practices of Agile methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, XP, etc
Strong problem-solving, communication, organizational and analytical skills
Understand and carry out written and oral instructions
Ability to work in a team with minimal supervision while under pressure and conducting several tasks at one time
Ability to plan, direct, coordinate work activities of others
Ability to use sound judgement
Experience working within a global, matrixed management organization
Healthcare, life sciences experience preferred but not required
Self-motivated, adaptable, able to prioritize and motivate others

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The Project Management Senior Advisor provides 3rd party Technology operational risk assessments and governance of strategic 3rd party Suppliers. This person will manage all Technology components within the scope of overall service delivery of Cloud\Hosted\Global Service Provider agreements to ensure business and Technology requirements are met. Responsible for creation of process, procedures, and standards to manage Technology services, including creating and tracking hardware and software inventory, determining contractual and financial exposure, negotiating contracts, and identifying and mitigating any production support risks. Acts as the business agent for the Technology organization to negotiate Service Level Agreements and determine contract terms and conditions.
To monitor and manage the performance of services provided by external service providers as agreed in relevant SLAs and contracts and ensure that the service levels are achieved and customer satisfaction is maintained.
To drive service improvement and customer satisfaction, based on requested and documented feedback.
As part of the ITSM Supplier Management process team, to manage the delivery of Technology related service to meet the requirements of the business.


Define IT Service Level Agreements (SLAs) related to contracted services.
Ensure IT SLAs are measured and achieved and client expectations are met (or exceeded).
Identify and lead service improvement and efficiency initiatives.
Build service relationships with internal customers and internal/external service providers through demonstrated organizational agility.
Ensure that systems, processes and methodologies as specified are followed to ensure effective monitoring, control and support of service delivery, with particular regard to regulatory compliance.
Provide reports at an agreed cadence (or on request), including management summary and detailed performance reports.
Produce contract negotiation output to include Supplier comparison documentation, Executive Summary, Technology Operational Readiness, etc.
Facilitate and document supplier and customer service review meetings.
Escalate service issues internally and with external providers to ensure customer satisfaction is maintained.
Coordinate external technical resources for infrastructure and support related change and project activity.
Negotiate and approve changes to the service delivery model, contracts or SLAs, drafting language as appropriate.
Manage the internal communication with the business including service performance, FAQs, process information and necessary forms.
Manage high priority incidents, conduct lessons learned and implement remediation plans.
Deliver a high level of Customer Service through a positive Customer focused attitude
Provide the Cigna ITSM interface into the ITIL Service disciplines delivered by Technology Suppliers, covering Incident, Problem and Change Management
Build effective internal and external relationships
Ongoing service improvements to meet ever increasing customer expectation
Transform the engagement of existing Technology Supplier relationships to establish a partnership approach to deliver a seamless Technology brand into Cigna


Bachelor’s Degree or work experience level equivalent to 5 - 10 years
ITIL service delivery qualification foundation level preferred but not mandated
ITIL Service delivery qualification practitioner level within service operations essential
ITIL Service delivery qualifications preferred
Strong understanding of core Cloud concepts with a focus on Cloud Technology SLAs, Disaster Recovery and functionality ownership. Cloud platform certification (AWS/Azure/etc.)
Good understanding of AI, RPA and Machine Learning
Previous experience working in an agile environment with working knowledge of CA Agile Central (Rally) or Jira Software.
Experience working in a Technology Service management capacity or related Technology role.
Demonstrable experience of managing suppliers in outsourcing contracts.
Good general understanding of Technology infrastructure.
Logical, methodical and structured approach with the ability to work effectively in a non-task oriented fashion.
Results orientated, deadline driven
Resilient. Responds positively to set-backs
Effective communication skills, both presentational and 1:1.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Senior Advisor – IT New Client Implementation Senior Advisor -- supports a portfolio of IT Projects in the Client Engagement & Technology Solutions organization. Primary responsibility is to lead and deliver IT projects, ensuring operational readiness in partnership with our Business New Client Implementation team. Responsible for leading high complexity projects for large cornerstone new client implementations. Establish trusted relationships directly with client technology teams to build a culture of co-ownership via consistent communication. Provide artifacts like Weekly Reports, Milestone Plans, and Test Plans to communicate all tech needs internally and externally.

Key Responsibilities:
Own Key Technology Relationships at Sr. Leadership level, both internally and with client & account teams. Keep Leadership informed of project status, milestones, deliverables, potential risks, financials, etc.

Represent ESI technology on all new cornerstone client steering committee meetings

Drive early client engagement to provide as much runway as possible for technology teams to deliver with the highest level of quality without reprioritization, backlog disruption or go live risk

Ensure new requests follow ESI project initiation processes to get the client requirements to our Technology teams. Actively engage in the project initiation processes so ESI Technology teams can deliver quality products and solutions within their strategic plans -- timely, cost effective, and standard as much as possible

Align with all readiness support teams prior to Go-Live through the support of creating Production go live and validation/cutover plans

In alignment with Account Management – Ensure smooth Go-live, transition to on-going state and clear plans on post go live technology plans.


Clients technology leadership team, ESI Sales and Implementation leadership, and ESI technology leadership team for key clients


Deliver updates consistently

Be curious -- Speak up, ask questions, do research on the clients and the key projects

Stay high level and crisp in communication as possible

Deal with ambiguity and act independently

Ask for help, be okay with telling the client you don’t know-- but commit to following up and providing a response.

Under promise, Over deliver mentality

Get to know the client’s culture and decision making processes. Speak the client’s language and avoid internal ESI jargon as much as possible.

Establish trusted relationships with a wide range leadership levels with both internal and external partners

Don’t take anything personally. Projects may need to go Yellow or Red to provide the necessary visibility to get things done. Bad news early is good news mentality.

Education/Work experience requirements – Some post-secondary education required. If no degree more than 10 years technology delivery experience required . If the candidate has post-secondary degree 5 years of technology delivery required.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The job profile for this position is IT Project Management Advisor which is a Band 4 Senior Contributor Career Track Role.
The Lean Governance Advisor will provide operational management and support for the Provider Technology Lean Agile Center of Excellence & Governance Office. This individual will manage and support the application of Provider Value Stream standards and processes and have responsibility to generate key operational and financial reporting to support key decision-making activities by leaders and key stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:
Supports the management of the Provider Technology Lean Agile Center of Excellence & Governance backlog in partnership and at the direction of the Product Owner Senior Manager.
Coordinates, generates and consolidates reporting and materials for Value Stream Monthly Operating Reviews (MORs).
Generates, communicates, and tracks management reporting in key domains such as agile performance, finances, and other areas as needed for leaders and other key stakeholders.
Implement agile maturity assessment schedules & generates roll up of maturation metrics.
Supports alignment and adoption of value stream processes in accordance with established standards and best practices.
Manage the hiring process for new Scrum Masters by triaging requests for new Scrum Masters, tracking hiring/alignment of Scrum Masters to requests, coordinating interviews and completing on-boarding / set up.
Create and maintain operational processes and tools to support value stream operations. Manage the Provider Value Stream Confluence and SharePoint sites.


3+ years’ experience within a large corporate setting working on agile teams, working closely with agile teams, or working within the project management or organizational design and process functions.
Strong working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Confluence, and SharePoint.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Ability to consistently meet tight deadlines and act with a sense of urgency.
Ability to effectively collaborate with others to achieve organizational goals.
Ability to build strong networks, both internally to the Provider Technology organization and externally with other technology stakeholders.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational, time management and planning skills.
Jira experience preferred.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Role Summary/Key Objectives:
The Infrastructure Project Management Senior Specialist is responsible to manage one or more projects or project work streams within a larger program. The primary focus of this role will be within the merger and acquisition space. This role is within the Global Intake and Program Delivery organization (GIPD). The objective of this role is to develop, manage, track and successfully deliver highly complex, cross domain technology capabilities supporting our M&A delivery objectives. Manage stakeholder expectations, communicate and drive risk/issues through resolution, maintain financial plan, drive schedule, and scope targets. Responsible for overall coordination, status reporting, stability and delivery of high quality work efforts.

Specific Areas of Responsibility:
Ensures projects are delivered on time and within budget, adhere to high quality standards, and meet stakeholder expectations
May manage and direct one or more project teams, establishes role expectations for all Global Infrastructure & Operations project team members, and provides performance feedback to project team members’ managers
Understands project objectives, business and customer impacts, and provides context to GI&O project team members to ensure alignment of priority and critical decisions throughout the project lifecycle
Applying industry standard project management processes and methodologies to track and report progress
Responsible for the quality and timely delivery of all project artifacts;
Tracks key project milestones and adjusts schedules and resources to meet project needs;
Manages work across teams in standard toolsets, manages budgets as needed; facilitates and keeps teams focused on critical path
Evaluates and effectively communicates project progress results, risks issues, and needs
Validates forecast and provides on-going reconciliation of resource plan
Closely collaborates with team members to successfully execute development initiatives using Agile practices and principles
Participates in large-scale development projects involving multiple areas outside of core team
Demonstrates value based decision making and Agile principles across teams
Shares knowledge and experience to contribute to growth of overall team capabilities
Participates in the deployment, change, configuration, management, administration and maintenance of deployment process and systems
Focuses on customer satisfaction


Successful candidates are strong planners, have solid facilitation skills, and an ability to build and maintain strong and positive relationships
Candidates are able to demonstrate ownership of their assignments, confidence in leading others, and ability to maintain focus of delivery from inception to successful implementation
Skills that are strongly needed are critical thinking, analytical and curious mindset, and technically savvy.
Solid written and verbal communication skills is a must; ability to present complex technical ideas to cross-functional audiences, business implications/priorities to technical teams, and can bring project challenges to management’s attention effectively
6+ years of related work experience as a project team member, including 2 or more years in a project leadership position with demonstrated experience within the M&A space.
2+ years Infrastructure engineering, operations, or application development experience
Project Management or Agile certifications a plus (PMP, ITIL, Six Sigma, Scrum, RTE)

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The individual will be responsible for managing large sized, multi-functional projects to delivery in an Agile and waterfall environments. Will be responsible for driving scope, schedule, and resources to deliver the required capabilities on time while appropriately ensuring the business is ready and risks are mitigated.

This individual must demonstrate strong project management behaviors, such as: Management of key stakeholders, strong proactive partnerships and collaboration with business partners, and the ability to monitor progress against goals, timely escalation and mitigation of barriers to success.

Responsible for leading large complexity projects/Program Epics or large components of complex projects impacting multiple business units or an operational unit.

Lead strategies for products designed to maximize profitable growth and membership targets. Strategies include customer insights, user story definition, and competitive assessment. Owns customer-driven team backlog.
Responsibilities
Partners with and independently navigates matrix partners/organizations to identify requirements/needs that will result in a positive Advocate/Customer/Member experience.
Serve as the business requirements expert, engaging and managing the work of subject matter experts from the business
Manage & Create project level plans related to schedule, scope and resources;
Work with business and IT delivery teams to identify and mitigate risks to include business operational risks;
Work with the business process owners to develop metrics to manage and track benefits, adoption and risks to operations;
Provided continual business guidance forth development and execution team(s);
Review, and when appropriate, accept and prioritize feedback and new requirements from stakeholders;
Escalate issues and develop recommendations for appropriate solutions.
Leads the team backlog prioritization process to ensure user stories are appropriately prioritized.
Supports team in the development and prioritization of enablers, and the identification non-functional requirements as they relate to owned user stories.
Defines clear and concise acceptance criteria by leading cross-functional experts from data evaluation through to sign-off.
Participates in the innovation process representing customer insights/needs, brainstorming/out of the box thinking to identify solutions, developing concepts and launching/monitoring pilots and results.
Provides product direction throughout the PI, and serves as the voice of the customer for the team.
Identifies and leads tactics to maximize product advantages bringing brand management mentality to owned user stories.
Embodies a product mindset to drive customer collaboration and software quality, and leads team and stakeholders in navigating change.
Represents the team to external stakeholders, teams, and suppliers.
Ensures stakeholders are knowledgeable of new and/or changes in priorities on a timely basis and equipped to deliver value proposition and key differentiating points.
Leads execution of and provides key messaging into user stories and other Advocate-facing materials.
Drives resolution of issues related to user story delivery, escalating when appropriate.
Provides guidance and mentorship to other Product Owners, and provides input into their stories as needed.
Supports Scrum Master in scope management, risk management, financial management, communication management, and Iteration Planning materials.
Manages team intake for supported products/solutions and creates/supports the creation of estimates when needed.
Supports Experience Owner/Experience Group Owner in defining minimally-marketable features to obtain commitment during PI Planning.
Supports product vision and product development strategies to drive membership and earnings growth for the Agile Release Train.
Fully understands customer needs (proposes, influences and shapes market research, can turn customer insights into action), external environmental influences, and competitive offerings and provides key input to the feature roadmap.
Independently manages and influences external relationships (e.g. vendors), as required for management of owned user stories.
Supports other related activities not specifically stated.

Skills/Technologies
Bachelor degree or 8-12 years of equivalent experience
Project Management experience highly preferred
PMP Preferred
Understanding/Experience of Lean principals and agile methodology.
Strategic and creative thinker with ability to think outside the box and translate strategies and customer insights into actions/user stories/implementation
Agile, flexible and dynamic
Demonstrated self-initiative.
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
Excellent project management skills with a strong understanding of business processes and operations
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, with demonstrated ability to influence internal and external resources.
Excellent communication skills with internal and external partners in various functional areas and at all levels of management.
Proven ability to develop strong working relationships and establish a high level of credibility across functional and lines of business
Proven ability to tie together complex issues and implement solutions to meet the needs of the global matrix
Proven ability to plan for and integrate multiple tasks concurrently as well as work independently.
Ability to identify and engage cross-functional teams in support of project completion, while obtaining needed buy-in from stakeholders.
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive results with strong sense of urgency
Proven ability to independently navigate areas and manage projects that are outside current area of expertise.
Team player with proven ability to foster and manage working relationships within a matrix environment
Persuasive, collaborative business acumen with the ability to drive the business strategically and influence others
Skilled in obtaining buy-in for ideas and driving implementation and culture
Excellent communication and negotiation skills to include written, oral and group presentation skills and ability to communicate with Strategic and creative thinker with ability to think outside the box and translate strategies and customer insights into actions/user stories/implementation
Ability to handle multiple priorities
Demonstrated ability to deliver against aggressive goals.
Strong influencing and presentation skills
Experience working in diverse disciplines within Cigna or equivalent healthcare industry experience
Proficient to Intermediate MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) skills required.
Understanding of the healthcare industry a plus.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $95,100 - $158,500, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The IT Project Management Senior Advisor will oversee highly complex IT Infrastructure initiatives that will deliver a successful business outcome that is measurable or if assigned to a specific Domain will oversee planning for components of IT initiatives that impact that domain. Responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned initiatives and provides a single point of contact to the business sponsors. Primary responsibility is in the delivery phase; Monitors, tracks, and analyzes strategic initiatives at a holistic view and communicates progress. Supports the portfolio across multiple initiatives; analyzing reports, collaborating with cross-functional teams, monitoring process, facilitating initiative / Program Epic level meetings.

Essential Functions:
Responsible for delivery and success of assigned strategic initiatives from a holistic view. Assess priorities against business value to ensure epic release schedule is aligned to business priorities. Optimize results within business and time constraints. If managing a Domain, supports the Domain cross initiatives in prioritization by creation of Domain Delivery plan. Analyzing data and creating reports, monitoring domain level processes, facilitating domain level meetings, and partnering with Eng. Manager/ Domain APM.
Collaborate and facilitate communication and meetings with APMs, BPO’s, Domain Owners, Engineers, Scrum Masters and other leaders to assure full alignment. Define schedules, identify dependences, solutions to business problems, and provide updates as priorities and schedules change.
Oversees the governance structure across the initiative teams or across multiple products within a domain. Manage risk mitigation and contingency plans. Drive activities to achieve aligned goals.
Develop detailed work plans, schedules, and status reports. Conduct necessary meetings and is responsible for schedule and status tracking. Conduct presentations regarding initiative or domain product status to cross functional IT teams and business/domain stakeholders.
Provide assistance to IT team members with issues needing technical expertise or complex systems knowledge. Mentor team to improve their understanding and skill and ensure they are familiar with resource materials available. Ensure adherence to project management process and project documentation standards.
Work on special initiatives as assigned.

Skills
8-12 years relevant experience, or Master’s degree and 6-10 years of relevant experience
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred
Extensive project management skills using various programs to prepare and execute business plans; Microsoft office applications; Strong verbal and written communication and organizational skills; eager to learn and adapt Domain knowledge and should be able to act as change agent
Knowledge of PBM, healthcare industry helpful; Advanced knowledge of project development, including process mapping, budgeting and timeline creation; Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward project completion; Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills; Advanced written and verbal communication skills are a must; Willingness to work a flexible schedule to accommodate business and some travel might be required

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

Overview:
Are you a passionate agile practitioner with experience as a Scrum Master and organizational change agent? Would you like to contribute creatively to a mission as meaningful as transforming healthcare? We are revolutionizing the way that caregivers across the country integrate information and make decisions. Can you help us? eviCore healthcare brings an unprecedented combination of scale, industry-leading technology and creative talent to change the way we experience healthcare. We are a company committed to advancing medical benefits management – and enabling better outcomes for patients, providers, and insurers. We have the size and scale to tackle the complexity of today’s and tomorrow’s healthcare system.
Want to join us?
As a Scrum Master, you will routinely wear the hats of facilitator, teacher, coach, and mentor to help enable your product team to develop customer-centric software products from idea to production. The candidate would be a servant leader to the team cultivating an environment of efficiency and coaching on scrum best practices, removing team impediments (including addressing root causes), and facilitating collaborative interactions and events aimed at delivering business value. Although they will care about the success of the product, they will care more about the health and success of their team. An ideal candidate will comfortably speak to the essence of the agile manifesto's 12 principles and will exemplify the scrum values of focus, courage, openness, commitment, and respect.


Teach the mechanics and value of the scrum framework, along with value-driven product development techniques.
Facilitate effective working sessions and team events as desired by the team. (e.g. vision, roadmap, release planning, sprint review, retrospective, sprint planning, story mapping...)
Train the team to conduct effective daily stand-up meetings focused on attaining the sprint goal.
Facilitate focused team retrospectives aimed at helping the team identify opportunities for improvement with a plan of action.
Coach product owners in best practices for managing stakeholder relationships, as well as maintaining and organizing an effective product backlog.
Teach and mentor organization in writing effective user stories.
Facilitate the definition of done negotiations that enable higher product quality through better extreme programming behaviors and DevOps practices (TDD/CI/CD).
Coach team members in agile estimation techniques aimed at generating effective team discussions and valuable, working software every sprint.
Coach team members on the daily application of the Agile Manifesto's 12 principles and provide guidance on correcting anti-patterns and issues made visible by the scrum framework.
Facilitate consensus-building activities and conflict resolution in order to improve team effectiveness.
Frequently assess the scrum maturity of the team and organization in order to coach the team and organization to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization.
Proactively conduct one-on-one conversations with team members focused on building trust, identifying coaching opportunities, and improving overall team cohesion and morale.
Proactively anticipate and prevent impediments that may impact the team
React with efficiency and tenacity to remove newly discovered impediments impacting the team, including elevating awareness of any organizational impediments discovered in the process. Ensure contributing causes, triggers, and knowledge gaps are effectively identified and addressed.
Partner with Agile thought-leaders to explore and become involved in opportunities for improvement across the scrum teams and company as a whole.


3 to 7 years as practicing ScrumMaster, exclusively as ScrumMaster and not an SM-Project Manager-hybrid
Multiple, advanced certifications beyond CSM or PSM-I (Candidate has obtained at least two of any of the following cert options: A-CSM, PSM-II, CSP-SM, PSM-III, ICP-ACC, ICP-ATF, CAL-I, CAL-II, CAL-E, CAL-O, CAL-T, ICP-APM, ICP-DAS)
Proven, demonstrable expertise in group decision making (e.g. Liberating Structures &/or Kaner’s Diamond of Participatory Decision Making)
Proven, demonstrable expertise in effective facilitation (e.g. visual/sketching techniques, graphic facilitation, &/or design thinking techniques)
Proven, demonstrable expertise in coaching models (e.g. G.R.O.W., Coaching Conversation Arc, 9 Coaching Roles, Powerful Questions)

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Help us support our future. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Do you have collaboration or problem-solving experience? If so, prepare to innovate, create, and inspire. The LTSS Operational Readiness Lead Analyst will be responsible for establishing and leading all IT Operational Readiness activities for various Legal Solution initiatives. Operational Readiness ensures that the people, process, and technology are in place and aligned to support all constituent activities. This role supports an enterprise-level portfolio delivery team and will interact with both IT and business resources to ensure production monitoring and contingency plans are in place to support successful implementation and effective and efficient issue handling. Additionally, this role will lead and support integrated releases specific to these projects.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with Enterprise Project Managers to ensure production monitoring plans are in place to measure the success of code deployments and establish efficient and effective contingency plans.

Manage all issues & communications during a project's warranty period.

Work closely with IT partners to ensure that Cigna’s technical operational areas are prepared for the changes that will be implemented as part of the LTSS programs.

Work closely with the Business Readiness lead(s) and Business Project Manager(s) to produce, manage, and report on an integrated Operational Readiness plan.

Provide consolidated monitoring and leadership status reporting for integrated releases specific to LTSS.

Ensure proper monitoring of all issues stemming from or impacting LTSS release activity

Act as Operational Readiness Lead for 2-3 projects at a time.

Evaluate and provide input on the selection of any key technologies within the contact center environment.

Works closely with the Business Readiness Leads to integrate training, P&P, Business Process Engineering/Management, organization change management, and staffing needs related to readiness, into an integrated readiness plan.

Works closely with key internal/external stakeholders to manage stakeholder readiness as needed.

Develops all pre and post-release artifacts, including Program level Contingency, Support Model documentation, Order of Activities, and detailed pre/post-release execution plans.

Support release activity for LTSS projects which includes monitoring integrated releases, attending release weekend implementation calls, logging and tracking release issues, and reporting a consolidated status to LTSS senior leadership.

Qualifications

High School diploma and/or business or related field; Bachelor’s degree preferred.

3-5 years experience in IT, business project management, supporting projects, and/or release management.

Experience with working independently and within a team setting.

Must be a quick learner with the ability to pivot between varying projects.

Excellent Customer relationship management skills and ability to interface and communicate with all levels.

Experience with navigating a highly matrixed organization effectively.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Excellent organizational and time management skills.

Experience to prioritize multiple obligations and meet aggressive timelines.

High sense of urgency and pride of ownership.

Intermediate experience using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.).

Agile knowledge & SaFe Certified preferred but not required.

Flexible to work weekend hours as business needs require. (Up to 3-4 hours).

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.
