Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
This Project Manager for Cigna Pharmacy provides end-to-end project management for Cigna Pharmacy project initiatives ensuring from inception, execution and implementation that project objectives are met. Aligning to project delivery best practices from ideation through implementation, including intake, technical solutions, governance and business readiness supporting all delivery methodologies; i.e. Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid. As Pharmacy products evolve the effort are becoming more and more complex with the need to address customer, client, and regulatory efforts. This individual directs the development of solution plans to optimize delivery of the Pharmacy Product portfolio as well as other Cigna Pharmacy initiatives, enabling the strategy prioritized by executive leadership. This will require leading the initiatives that drives the end to end detailed milestone-driven delivery for both large new initiatives and smaller pharmacy enhancements. Ensure financial responsibilities to the Project Financial Management best practices to ensure costs are coming in on budget. This Project Manager will be work with the IT organizations and external entities to ensure the quality of scope delivery and the on time implementation for Cigna Pharmacy projects.

This role works within the Cigna Pharmacy Operations organization, collaborating with Clinical, Product, Go-To-Market, Pricing, Finance, Evernorth, Marketing, Underwriting, Service Operations, Technology, Legal, Compliance etc. to deliver complex, cross-functional Cigna Pharmacy projects.

The ability to partner with peers in Cigna and Evernorth (Product, Sales, Technology, Clinical, Digital, Operations, Creative Services, Service Operations, and Analytics) organizations to ensure innovative, quality solutions is essential.

Primary Responsibilities
Lead Cigna Pharmacy Projects to optimize the end to end project management disciplines and workflows related to Cigna Pharmacy delivery. Partner with applicable cross-organizational areas in implementing multi-functional project initiatives. Provide leadership and management guidance to the team and across multiple areas.

Project Management Delivery
Responsible for delivering large scale project initiatives for the Cigna Pharmacy organization.
Lead a multi-functional team to provide end-to-end project management for Cigna Pharmacy project initiatives ensuring from inception, execution and implementation that project objectives are met. Utilizing and contributing to best practices and governance within the Project Delivery team.
Provide direction and leadership for Cigna Pharmacy delivery initiatives in order to deliver long-term improvements to the organization's performance; oversee a team to ensure the successful delivery.
Advance concurrent efforts and ensure project delivery meet requirements regarding quality, schedule and cost.
Direct team to execute and enable the project delivery solutions plan in alignment with strategy set by Cigna Pharmacy executive leadership so product development optimizes the impact of product portfolio.
Engage key matrix partners to define and build pharmacy products and services. Partners are within Pharmacy and across Cigna Enterprise organizations. Some key matrix partners include Technology, Clinical, Product, Sales Operations, Marketing, Legal, Underwriting, Pricing, Finance, Implementation, and Service Operations.
Own financial management of Project budgets.
Ensure from inception, execution and implementation of the project scope is realized.
Ensure business readiness components and operational structure are tracked within the scope of the deliverables.
Drive to market delivery timelines, while also adapting to dynamic work environment and setting priorities to best support organization performance and impact.

Qualifications/Functional Competencies
8+ years of project management experience leading large cross functional initiatives
Exemplary core project management skills including multiple aspects of the PMBOK and the Scaled Agile Framework (certification a plus)
Experienced people leader - Ability to lead, manage and influence teams
General understanding of PBM landscape
Process-oriented with quality mindset, strong organization and planning skills
Demonstrated ability to drive results required
Customer-orientation and customer insight/experience skills
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interpret and synthesize data, insights
Strong problem-solving skills; Innovation solution identification & development
Ability to create and implement contingency plans and solutions for problems that arise
Ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization
Strong collaboration & relationship building skills
High School Diploma or eqiuvalent required

Core Competencies
Personal Accountability
Decision Making & Collaboration Skills
Creative Problem Solving skills
Dealing with Ambiguity
Consumer engagement mindset
Influential leadership within matrix organization
Motivating Others

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Excited to grow your career?

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position, you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Must be a current contractor with Cigna, Express Scripts, or Evernorth. Evernorth is a new business within the Cigna Corporation.

Job Summary:
In this role you will collaborate with various product owners, transfer the requirements to the team, help them to define the right user stories, prioritize and overall manage the team by business priorities and business demands.


Work on multiple projects using a Scrum framework, and duties include mentoring lower-level scrum masters

Developing various product types and removing impediments.

Support the product owner, collaborate with their team, and lead by example.

Serves as the “servant leader” of the Scrum team by removing impediments and helping the team remain successful and on schedule.

Provides counsel and advice to top management on significant matters, often requiring coordination between organizations.

Focuses on providing thought leadership and technical expertise across multiple disciplines.

Recognized internally as “the go-to person” for the most complex assignments.


Must be a current contractor with Cigna, Express Scripts, or Evernorth. Evernorth is a new business within the Cigna Corporation.

High School diploma or GED required.

Scrum master certification.

Skills in technology and mentoring.

2-3 years of on-the-job experience with agile approaches.

Must have a sufficient understanding of technology to enable them to lead team members and help them overcome their development roadblocks.

Must also understand business strategy and objectives.

Ability to ensure that development work is prioritized by business value and results align with objectives.

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The Contact Center and Service Operations Technology (CCSOT) team is the primary partner of our Enterprise Operations business, servicing our stakeholders via agent guided and self-service communication channels. As we prepare for 2023, drive for better resiliency and continue to evolve our Contact Center & Service Operations organization, we are focusing on our access to care application areas ensuring the right model is in place to support these critical applications.
The Scrum Master’s primary focus is on helping to create an environment where the CCSOT teams can deliver high quality, valuable Knowledge Management capabilities with a “one team” approach. This role operates as the “servant leader” of the Scrum team by removing impediments and helping the team remain successful and on schedule. Must have a sufficient understanding of technology to lead team members and help them overcome their development roadblocks; they must also understand business strategy and objectives, and be able to ensure that development work is prioritized by business value and results align with objectives. The incumbent provides expert content/professional leadership on complex assignments/projects. Exercises considerable creativity, foresight, and judgment in conceiving, planning, and delivering initiatives. Uses deep professional knowledge and acumen to advise functional leaders. Focuses on providing thought leadership but works on broader projects, which require understanding of wider business. Recognized internally as a subject matter expert.
Key Responsibilities
Ensures projects are delivered on time and within budget, adhere to high quality standards, and meet stakeholder expectations
Creates and manages ongoing project plans, JIRA issues, SharePoint tracking, schedules, budgets, and oversees project team members’ artifacts to ensure consistency and quality
Agile Ceremonies – You will be responsible for ensuring that our agile delivery teams adheres to agile ceremonies and follows agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban…)
You will also assist with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and removing impediments and mitigating risks.
You will anticipate and manage the dependencies that can have a negative impact to the delivery capability of your teams. Therefore, you will be driving cross team planning, collaboration, and coordination.
Understanding the Accountability and Responsibility of all members of their teams and ensuring capacity is not exceeded.
Ensure the team´s continuous improvement by motivating, coaching, acting as change agent
Optimizing the flow of work within and across teams.
Support the product owner to make sure the product backlog is in good shape and ready for the next sprint
Provide regular and open communication across the program and stakeholders for transparency and awareness of progress and impediments
Agile Focus
Teach, mentor, and coach teams, on emerging Agile and Lean methods
Utilizes feedback and metrics (quality, delivery rate, etc.) to identify areas of opportunity and partners with Agile leadership and delivery experts to coach and continuously improve scrum team
Coach scrum team to improve collaboration and self-organization
Act as an Agile mentor/coach to any Agile role or stakeholder
Actively seek and lead a variety of learning opportunities such as Communities of Practice, conferences, classroom training, and independent study to further develop self and community
Product Focus
Jointly with the Product Owner, you will be responsible for understanding key business and technology objectives and strategy of the product can help their team drive towards executing these goals.
You will also lead the coordination of release planning with the Product Owner
Required Skills & Experience
A bachelor’s degree; Agile Certification (Kanban preferred) or related experience
3-5 years' experience as a Scrum Master working in an enterprise level organization
Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, conflict resolution and continuous improvement.
Excellent problem-solving and strategic thinking skills
Ability to Influence, mentoring and Focus on results
Ability to navigate a fast paced, highly matrixed organization effectively
Ability to remove barriers and enable teams to complete their objectives
Proven ability to present and communicate at all levels with clarity and precision both written and verbally
A proven ability to quickly earn the trust of sponsors and key stakeholders; mobilize and motivate teams; set direction and approach; resolve conflict; deliver tough messages with grace; execute with limited information and ambiguity
Scrum and SAFe certifications is a plus

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
This position leads business and operations management activities for one or more teams in the Enterprise Architecture organization and reports to either a Senior Director or Managing Director.

As a Senior Advisor focused on ensuring the Enterprise Architecture organization operates effectively, this role will be responsible for various functions in the areas of talent management, financial management, supplier management, communications management and project management. This includes working closely with Enterprise Architecture leaders and managers to build, execute, and report on core operational and business processes and deliverables.

This role will work regularly with Directors, Senior Directors, Managing Directors, Principals, Senior Principals, and Lead Principals, serving as “the glue” to ensure continuity in operations and maintain strong connectivity across the Enterprise Architecture organization overall.


Talent Management
Maintain team roster and track headcount
Maintain org chart(s)
Manage hiring controls process and create TBHs in Clarity when needed
Maintain job description library]
Facilitate recruiting in conjunction with HR when needed
Manage onboarding process (equipment, access, training, etc.)
Manage internal required training by sending reminders, tracking completion, etc.
Manage external training and conference attendance via training framework
Leads team building activities
Performs exit interviews upon request
Maintains a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team environment
Financial Management
Maintain Clarity allocations and work records when needed
Generate Clarity / Oracle reports to track spend
Ensure timesheet compliance
Forecast labor costs when needed
Perform capacity planning
Supplier Management
Coordinate with Sourcing to submit requests, track and report status, facilitate approvals, and maintain records
Meet periodically with Sourcing to advise them of EA supplier needs
Communications Management
Manage all recurring EA team meetings (EAXLT, Northwest, Town Halls, etc.) which includes scheduling, prepping content, facilitating when needed, moderating Q&A with Slido, and documenting notes/decisions/actions for follow up
Maintain communications calendars and schedules, working with EALT and other team members to identify topics
Create and distribute EA announcements (e.g., new hires, promotions, retirements, etc.)
Maintain operating effectiveness content in Confluence, SharePoint, and IRIS as needed
Communicate excellently both verbally and in written form with team members and stakeholders by adapting style and message to diverse audiences
Authors status reports for one or more teams
Creates schedules for skip levels and coordinated with Executive Assistants to schedule with SVP

Title: IT Infrastructure Project Management Sr. Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Reporting to the Enterprise Strategy and Enablement PMO Senior Manager, this position will be responsible for leading large complex projects and programs across multiple operational units or enterprise programs. This Senior Advisor role will be an integral leadership part of the Provider PMO team.

Projects can range in content including (but not limited to): Provider service model changes, organizational realignment, process improvements, enterprise compliance / regulatory, total medical cost initiatives, new product implementation, digital / provider portal improvements and new process / technology creation and rollout. This role will primarily support strategic projects across five main internal stakeholder groups: Provider Relations & Solutions Management, Network Solutions & Operations, Provider Experience & Insights, Provider Call and Claim Operations and Compliance / Regulatory.

This is a Project Management role that will require working closely with our stakeholders and partner business resources. The incumbent will be responsible to lead / program manage some mid- to large-sized projects, to understand and evaluate business-specific requirements, and to drive the development of solutions to address complex business needs. This role will require the ability to navigate cross-functionally across the entire Provider value stream.


Driving the overall Project Management of the various initiatives including coordinating and facilitating various governance meetings, rolling up status reporting, milestone tracking and planning
Utilizes established project and program methodology to develop a master project plan to support milestones and goals; where the methodology is not sufficient, create and augment with new processes and establish best practices
Ensures the timely and quality development and distribution of all deliverables for the project which could include a program charter, status reporting, issues / risk logs, dependency management, resource plan, etc.
Overall management and coordination of regularly scheduled organizational update meetings to provide status, discuss key issues/risks and upcoming milestones
Works closely with the program leadership team and sub-teams to organize and manage/resolve issues through escalation forums to address the following:
people, process and technology enablement issues
project plan risks and issues in achieving planned milestones
communications across sub-teams and the broader program
Evaluates project status and resource utilization and recommends and implements changes to improve the team's and project’s effectiveness
Effectively communicates with project/business participants and interested parties by adapting style and message to diverse audiences
Develops strong relationships with business leads and sponsors
Continually improve skills and competencies by proactively participating in various internal and external training opportunities and stretch assignments
Connect to the broader Enterprise Strategy and Enablement PMO team to utilize and build best practices, share innovative ideas and improvement opportunities, and grow professionally, while championing the organization's project management methodology, tools, and techniques
Takes ownership and responsibility in own tasks; Demonstrates dedication and passion towards department duty; Demonstrates confidence to lead mid-size teams with diversified members to success; Delegates project tasks properly based on skill-set and business requirement; States clearly what task's expectation is to project team members; Treats all team members with equal fairness; Ensures that credit for successes is spread throughout project team
Accountable for project team results and deliverables


5+ years of Project Management, Program Delivery or applicable experience
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required; MBA, PMP Certification, Agile Certification/Scrum Master/Product Owner training also valued
Detailed knowledge for driving result oriented work
Demonstrated project management skills and success, including cross-organizational initiatives
Experience in leading large, complex projects and/or programs
Demonstrated ability to drive strategic and tactical projects and programs
Fluent MS Office Skills – Powerpoint, MS project, Excel
Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle


Ability to foster collaboration, value others perspectives and gain support and buy-in for organizational proposals
Strong analytic and decision making abilities
Excellent oral, written presentation and communication skills
Ability to lead and influence in a matrixed environment is critical
Proven track record of delivering results of high quality and sustainability
Strong problem solving and root cause identification skills
Strong business acumen, with proven ability to leverage knowledge base to quickly come up to speed in new business areas and new types of projects
Proven ability to develop strong working relationships and establish a high level of credibility across functional and lines of business and organizational levels
Strong Change Management exposure to the discipline and components of Change Management
Demonstrated ability to rally support around vision & strategy
Adapts to ambiguous or unfamiliar terrains
Can work comfortably with senior leaders (band 6 and above)
Strong strategic thinker

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Job Description:
The Systems Analyst will be responsible for analyzing requirements and defining information systems solutions to address complex business needs.

We are looking for a system analyst to oversee implementation of minor system enhancements, security incentives and stop gap business process solutions. You will analyze system requirements and address any relevant problems. You will also perform standard testing and provide solutions to ensure high levels of performance, stability and security.

As a Systems Analyst here at Palladian Health, a division of eviCore, you will work closely with project, systems, business, and quality assurance stakeholders to help support a team of engineers who are passionate about system stability, system integration, compliance and data integrity.


Elicit and assess business needs/requests and define information system solutions to address complex business needs and troubleshooting technical issues

Understand the project technical architecture, as well as provide linkage to overall Business and Technology Strategic objectives

Perform in the capacity of an Analyst, Product Owner, Team Member, Product Manager or other Agile Roles as identified to resolve issues and ensuring solutions are viable and consistent

Partner with project sponsors and key stakeholders; mobilize and motivate teams; set direction and approach; resolve conflict; deliver tough messages with grace; execute with limited information and ambiguity

Facilitate joint socialization and refinement and author necessary documentation (business rules, data needs, mappings, analysis, initial options for high level design, user stories, etc) and knowledge transfer sessions with all applicable teams

Execution of roadmaps, maintaining and upgrading existing systems as required

Risk mitigation planning

Creating system walk and manuals for the organization

Creating user manuals, running training sessions and workshops on system processes

Structure and priorities business requirements and communicating plans with stakeholders for review and approval

Testing systems on a regular basis to ensure quality and function of enhancements


3+ years’ experience in a data driven role

2+ years’ experience in a quality insurance or business analyst role


Strong working knowledge of data mapping

Working knowledge in backend querying (MS SQL)

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and professional experience

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Paradigm is an accountable specialty care management organization focused on improving the lives of people with complex and catastrophic injuries and diagnoses. The company has been a pioneer in value-based care since 1991 and has an exceptional track record of generating the very best outcomes for patients, payers, and providers. Deep clinical expertise is the foundation for every part of Paradigm’s business, including its risk-based clinical solutions, case management services, high-value specialty networks, home health, and payment integrity programs. Paradigm is headquartered in Walnut Creek, California, with offices across the U.S. For more information, please visit www.paradigmcorp.com.

Job Summary:
The Director of Application Development is responsible for all facets of enterprise application development including customer management, project management, application architecture, business and systems analysis, testing and software engineering for the Paradigm’s applications and data.

He/she is expected to participate with Sr. Management team meetings making appropriate recommendations for improvements and/or additions that enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the information technology services and operations to support the mission of Paradigm. The Director of Application Development works closely with business partners and serves as a strategic liaison to the IT department. He/she is also responsible for maintenance and level 2 production support of custom-developed applications.


Assist in the creation, and drive the execution, of the Information Technology Strategy Plan that will leverage information and technology to deliver products and services in an effective and efficient manner unique to the market that supports the company’s growth and expansion. In conjunction with the CIO, create collaboratively with the Operations management business case(s) for proposed new IT initiatives that improve the Company’s operating capabilities.

IT Senior Management
Application Architecture
Application Development
Management







Paradigm believes that fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace is central to our mission of helping more people and transforming lives. We’re striving to build a culture that better reflects the society we live in, and empowers our team to deliver the highest levels of compassion and care to those we serve. For us, achieving this goal requires a workforce that respectfully embraces differences and commits to positive change, creating an environment where everyone is able to bring their whole self to work.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
The Evernorth Service Operations Business Intelligence & Analytics (SOBI) organization offers solutions that provide actionable insights to internal and external business partners and customers that help reduce health costs, improve outcomes, provide financial security and measure and forecast business performance.

The Business Analytics Lead Analyst within SOBI position is a hands-on role responsible for the end-to-end design, development, deployment, and integration of reporting & analytics solutions for the new MDLive group’s transition to Evernorth Service Operations. Working in SOBI, the analyst collaborates with Call Operations, Strategic Workforce Management, & SOBI partners to determine needs, facilitate requirements, design data layers, and design and develop ad hoc and canned reports related to supporting the integration of MDLive functions into Evernorth Service Operations.

Responsibilities Include:
Eliciting business requirements and specifications from WFM and other partners.
Collecting and organizing information from a variety of data sources.
Writing queries against underlying Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, or other relational databases.
Designing, developing, and deploying executive dashboards, operational scorecards, ad hoc and canned reports based on requirements and using Business Intelligence tools and solutions.
Integrating data related to the MDLive operation into existing Evernorth Service Operations reporting and data/reporting constructs.


Strong proficiency with SQL is required.
Experience with Tableau (Intermediate to Advanced) or other analytics software packages (i.e., SAS, Cognos, Qlikview, Looker) is required. Certifications are a plus.
Bachelor's degree is preferred. However, in lieu of a degree, relevant work experience is acceptable.
3-5 years’ experience using SQL, Tableau, or similar tools/languages required.
Experience with ETL tools such as SSIS, Python, Informatica, etc. is recommended.
Ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships across the organization.
Ability to communicate the results of the analysis to non-technical and technical audiences.
Domain expertise in contact center operational/analytical data is a plus.
Strong presentation skills is also a plus.
Programming language experience (i.e., Python, JavaScript, C#) is a plus.

***This role is WAH/Flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite.***

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $70,400 - $117,400, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Class Description
The purpose of this class is to perform professional level technical work in data management, data analysis, and report preparation to support the institutional research, assessment, and decision support activities of the Office of Planning, Research and Evaluation. Multiple positions available. Compensation within the posted range is determined by a candidate's education level and/or years of experience in the field. Generally, employees are hired in the lower third of the scale.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a social science, business, or similar discipline that includes course work in research design, statistics and data analysis. Master’s degree preferred. Two (2) years of work experience in institutional research or business analytics. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Excel and SPSS or other statistical software.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Zachary Piper Solutions is seeking a REMOTE IT Operations Analyst to join a long term program supporting the U.S. Customs and Border Protection's Office of Information Technology based in Ashburn, VA. The REMOTE IT Operations Analyst will be responsible for a variety of tasks including handling stakeholder correspondence, scheduling meetings, coordination between multiple parties, and facilitating discussions/leading meetings.

Responsibilities:
Represent and be the face of the portal (Business Connection website) to the end-user
Communicating with clients and the external end-users
Provide written content for the Business Connection website and consult with development team on website features and processes

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
T- Rex Solutions, LLC is seeking a Junior Intelligence Analyst to join our mission-focused team in Arlington, VA. T-Rex analysts support the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) Counter terrorism and Criminal Exploitation Unit. Analysts Investigate non-immigrant visa holders who violate their immigration status as well as scrutinize the activities of known or suspected terrorists and terrorist associations. This role is both demanding and rewarding job built on the foundation of exploitation, analysis, and sharing of information. This is a career where being proactive is key. Must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain Top Secret clearance
Responsibilities
The Junior Administrative Analyst is responsible for building reports to determine the legal status of visitors and students who entered the country on a specific visa.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
General Description
The Information Technology Jr Security Analyst is a hands-on role that requires technical expertise. Responsible for assisting in the strategy, design, specification and implementation of the Information Security Program and associated policies. Provides direction and coordination to City and IT staff for security incidents. Performs risk management functions including risk assessment, identification of mitigation and remediation requirements. Provides oversight of security issues resolutions including tracking and escalations. Assists with the coordination and management of security awareness training, business continuity and disaster recovery plans. Assists with the Incident Response processes. Works directly with IT and City staff to identify opportunities for improved security tools and processes.
Essential Job Functions
Develops, oversees, and maintains policies, procedures and associated plans for system security administration and user system access based on industry-standard best practices.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
The Evernorth Service Operations Business Insights (SOBI) organization offers solutions that provide actionable insights to internal and external business partners and customers that help reduce health costs, improve outcomes, provide financial security and measure and forecast business performance.

The Business Analytics Advisor position is a hands-on role supporting the Strategic Workforce Management group within Cigna. Working within SOBI, the Business Analytics Advisor will partner with internal team members and our stakeholders, leading and/or participating in projects centered on reporting, data visualization, dimensional modeling, and data management to ensure the success of our planning and operations organizations.

The ideal candidate will be leading or assisting in the development of systems to improve the forecasting, analytics, and reporting accuracy in our Contact Center Operations and Strategic Workforce Management teams. The output of this work will result in our ability to increase affordability for our clients and customers, while maximizing operational efficiencies.


Lead or participate in analyses and reporting related to Service Operations planning and forecasting processes within our Contact Center functions.

Deploys data models, dashboards, & operational scorecards using current tools and emerging tools/technologies including Python, JavaScript, Angular, Tableau, etc.

Collects, aggregates, and organizes information across various technologies.

Design and execute operations against various on premise and cloud-based systems including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, Hadoop, etc.

Present findings of analytics research and projects to stakeholders and leaders within planning and operations areas.

Consults with and provides guidance to other analysts/developers to promote growth as a team.


Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Data or Business Analytics, Computer Science, MIS, or a comparable field of study is preferred. In lieu of a degree, relevant work experience is acceptable.

Strong proficiency with SQL is required.

Experience with designing and developing database structures and dimensional models is required.

Experience with data visualization and analytical software packages (i.e., Tableau, ThoughtSpot, PowerBI, Qlikview) is preferred.

Experience with programming languages, libraries and frameworks, and Web API’s such as C#, Python, JavaScript, React, and Angular is preferred.

Experience with AWS or other cloud-based technologies is a plus.

Ability to establish and maintain strong working relationships across the organization is required.

Knowledge and experience working in an Agile environment is a plus.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 90,500 - 150,800 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) and its subsidiaries comprise a global health services and financial company that serves millions of people worldwide through our health, pharmacy, behavioral, dental, disability, life, accident and international products and services. Our mission is to help improve the health, well-being and sense of security of the people we serve.

Role Summary
Cigna is seeking a highly motivated team member with strong data and analytics background, reporting to the Senior Manager of Digital & Analytics (D&A), to join our growing and dynamic team leading and supporting the development of our D&A strategy and execution of our strategy. This individual will be an active contributor in high-visibility large-scale projects that drive the organization’s Digital & Analytics adoption and engagement. This individual will be responsible for conducting advanced analytics and research activities in efforts to make recommendations supporting digital, analytics, and technology initiatives, as well as a key contributor to provide data-driven analyses and strategic communication to senior leaderships with a focus on consumer insights and healthcare outcome.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


Support the development of cross-functional initiatives to improve Cigna and Evernorth’s digital adoption and engagement, design sustainable solutions, and turning our strategic recommendations into reality through a test-and-learn approach

Develop a rigorous and detailed understanding of our Digital and Analytics KPIs driving business outcome, by product, services; being able to link our strategy and execution to measurable, quantitative outcome

Collaborate effectively with D&A and business leaders influencing outcomes through effective verbal and written communication skills including planning and facilitating workshops, developing compelling senior-level presentations and other highly visible communications

Conduct analyses to identify business use cases, capability requirements, and digital, technology & data dependencies to support the our key strategic initiatives

Perform various financial/quantitative analyses including the complex data research, data mining, data exploration, statistical reporting and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets

Interpret business feedback and results to succinctly create compelling recommendations and solutions for senior leadership sponsorship and buy-in


Bachelor Degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Sciences, Math, Statistics, Actuarial Science or a related quantitative field strongly preferred

Strong technical skills required to explore, extract, organize, transpose and analyze large data sets housed in Teradata/Hadoop/Postgres using SQL and SAS/R/Python

Ability to build Visualizations using SAS/R/Python to tell a Data Story

Statistical training in school or through work (ability to formulate and execute appropriate hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, power analysis, bootstrapping, regression modeling, etc.)

Self-Starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions

At least 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or business analytics roles (experience with healthcare data preferred)

Strategic thinker with the ability to develop sophisticated quantitative analyses and synthesize the results into implications and communicate recommendations to senior leadership

Experienced in developing and analyzing complex financial models and other quantitative assessments including business KPIs, ROI, P&L, etc.

Proven business acumen with experience researching marketing trends and consumer insights, category analysis, competitive benchmarking, etc.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of shaping messages appropriately for a senior-level audience and proficiency using MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

The PEO Defense Healthcare Management System (DHMS) is transforming the delivery of health care and advance data sharing through a modernized electronic health record for service members, veterans and their families. The Workforce 3.0 program within DHMS is a managed solution that leverages innovative new processes, methods, and best-in-class methodologies from the private sector to enable the entire PEO DHMS workforce to deliver world-class technology. The DHMS systems provide important health IT capabilities to 9.6 million active military, their families, and their beneficiaries. This program supports management of technical deployments, field deployments, and technology training/adoption. Lets talk about how you can help make a difference!

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
The Senior Solution Architect leads multiple project deployment designs to guide project solutions and supports other Solution Architects and Infrastructure Analysts with enterprise infrastructure solutions. The senior architect is the lead in developing well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous project deployment designs issues and establishes the approach and direction for multiple significant projects. Acts as a resource for direction, mentoring and guidance for less experienced IT staff. Effectively communicates to individuals at all levels of the technical and business communities. Is able to operate as a contributing member of the Solution Architecture community, including the ability to use, share, contribute and influence the appropriate artifacts, approach and best-practices used to create enterprise-scale technical solutions. Monitors project schedules and costs. Contribute to Service Level Agreement creation and adherence. Typically requires 8-10 years of experience.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in the development of infrastructure solutions intended for enterprise use with a ‘cloud first’ mentality
Participate in Global Intake Planning and Delivery Model to create or guide infrastructure solutions for specific value streams.
Create deployment designs and/or provide leadership and oversight on projects to less experienced staff for deployment designs to guide project solutions.
Develop and foster strong relationships with Application solution areas
Produce a standard set of artifacts with sufficient implementation details so that the blueprint and/or topology becomes an integral part of “as built” documentation to guide production readiness, production operation, and disaster recovery.
Serve as an active member of the Cigna Solution Review Board and Technical Assessment and Alignment Committee, ensuring architectures and design align with IT standards, maximizes technology reuse and supports technology strategy directions.
Refine or oversee project deployment designs with input from build engineers, service owners and enterprise architects to ensure strategic technology alignment.
Refine the project based infrastructure design with input from build engineers, service owners and solution architects to ensure application solution alignment.
Complete the deployment design for project solutions with implementation details so that it becomes an integral part of “as built’ documentation to guide production readiness, production operation and disaster recovery.
Ensure architectural adherence throughout the design and deployment process.
Ensure project solutions meet all non-functional requirements
Ensure project solutions can meet business service level agreement objectives
Communicates with and engages appropriate IT organizations to ensure strategic technology alignment and application solution alignment.
Adopt and communicate new concepts, ideas, techniques, best practices and technology assistance
Work with vendors, Enterprise Architecture and product management areas to establish required infrastructures and frameworks, supporting product evaluations, and proof of concepts as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
B.S. in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
In depth knowledge and experience with cloud computing, specifically with AWS and Azure offerings
Familiarity with Agile delivery methodology.
Familiarity with ITIL framework and CMDB.
Familiarity with automation robotic process automation toolsets such as Pega and Blue Prism.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
Hands-on delivery experience as a designer, engineer or developer
Deep knowledge in two or three technology discipline areas (Operating Systems, Databases, Systems Management, Network, Information Security, Storage and Backup, Internet Technologies, Private/Public Cloud, Virtualization, Directory Services, Application Servers, Hardware, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and decision making skills
Strong leadership and influencing / negotiation skills
Strong interpersonal / relationship management skills

OTHER VALUED SKILLS
Experience using tools like System Architect, Sparx, or CMDB tools to describe, capture and/or learn infrastructure architecture for enhancing ITO services and integration solutions and driving better infrastructure architecture alignment with infrastructure standards and reference models.
Application development experience including web development, data base processing, and various middleware technologies

This role is WAH/Flex, which allows most work to be performed at home. WAH/Flex employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they choose to come onsite or if required to periodically come on site.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The PC/LAN Technician is responsible for the day to day performance and operation of both PC and LAN hardware and software. The PC/LAN Technician installs, configures, troubleshoots, and repairs computer workstations and local area networks, monitors performance, diagnoses and resolves problems. . The PC/LAN Technician provides accurate, timely and creative solutions to end-user computer and network problems. The PC/LAN Technician adheres to standard IT practices and techniques and follows established escalation processes for more complex problems.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Assist with the installation and maintenance of local infrastructure equipment which may carry data, voice and video communications to defined standards.
Coordinate with internal and external partners as required.
Participate on call rotation as needed including nights and weekends.
Install, configure, troubleshoot, and repair Windows or Macintosh desktop and laptop computer systems, peripheral equipment and mobile devices.
Escalate unresolved issues in a timely manner.
Configure and maintains Windows or Macintosh standard applications and networking software, diagnosing and solving hardware and software problems.
Deliver exceptional customer service, proactively setting expectations with customers and following up appropriately.
Manage service request queue and resolves daily hardware and software service and support requests.
Adhere to established service level agreements.
Thoroughly document work performed in ticketing system.
Maintain and track inventories of hardware for desktops, laptops, thin clients and peripherals in the appropriate systems.
Completes project tasks as assigned.
Ensure project dates are met.
Schedule installations/ upgrades and provides system maintenance in accordance with IT procedures.
Work on site specific department projects and/or sub-projects.
Implement approved operating system enhancements and recommends system modifications to reduce user problems.
Interact with other support groups to restore service and /or identify and correct end-user computing problems.
Escalate more complex problems/issues up the chain appropriately in a timely manner.
Provides technical assistance to PC/LAN technicians from other sites.
Follows process documentation and checklists to ensure standardization of work.
Proactively recommends documentation changes if necessary.
Assists with user and equipment moves along with occasional unloading of new equipment and disposal of old equipment to salvage vendor.

QUALIFICATIONS

High School Diploma or equivalent required.
0-2 years of experience with a Bachelor’s degree; 6-8 years of experience without a Bachelor's degree.
1-3 Years PC/LAN Technical experience.
Continued enhancement of technical skills through continuing education/seminars and interaction with other IT disciplines.
General knowledge of Microsoft Operating systems, especially XP, Windows 7, Microsoft Office, Apple computers and operating systems, networking switches and data networks, IP telecommunications systems and Audio Visual Systems.
Good communications skills.
Previous customer service experience preferred.
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks.
Possess in-depth knowledge of the tools and processes required by the role.
Functions in complex environments with minimal direction.
Solid individual performance while partnering with others.
Works well through self-directed effort.
Shares knowledge in area of expertise.
May serve as a technical subject matter expert.
May provide technical assistance to resolve operating issues.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

Do you enjoy the challenge of defending against security breaches? Put your skills to work at an organization trusted to protect client, patient and company data amid the ever-changing landscape of information security threats and risks. Our cyber defenders are challenged with maintaining a secure infrastructure day in and day out, while delivering an enterprise computing environment that resists breaches and disruptions. If you’re as passionate about data security as we are, explore our opportunities.

ABOUT EXPRESS SCRIPTS

At Express Scripts, we dare to imagine a better health care system, and we’re driven to make it happen. Where some see obstacles, we see possibilities. We’re challengers, difference-makers and opportunity-seekers, united with our partners in pursuit of a simpler, more sustainable system and better health for all.

We have always acted first to take on the toughest challenges. We uniquely partner across the health care ecosystem to uncover opportunities, take action, advance health care and deliver better outcomes – like no one else can. We believe health care can do more. We are Champions For BetterSM.

Express Scripts, part of Cigna Corporation, unlocks new value in pharmacy, medical and beyond to further total health for all.

Prioritize workload based on business needs and deliver the artifacts as proposed

Several years of test automation experience
Experience leading Automation Testing Team
Experience in testing web application and web services developed using latest technologies and frameworks: .NET, C#, JAVA, Rest, XML, JSON, JQuery, etc.
Proficient in using test automation tools such as Selenium WebDriver/IDE/Grid to develop automation testing scripts for web and client server applications.
Solid understanding of Quality Assurance methods and practices
Deep understanding of manual and automated testing concepts
Experience with Continuous Integration systems (e.g., Azure, Jenkins, Travis, GitLab)
Strong SQL knowledge
Framework creation
Agile testing methodologies
Strong communication skills
Solid understanding of STLC (Software Test Life Cycle)
Solid understanding of SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)
Willingness to learn and work in Security Testing
Healthcare background is a plus

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Verity Solutions, a Cigna Company, is an award-winning leader in software and services developed for administration of the federal 340B drug pricing program. Our mission is to simplify the complex process of maintaining 340B program compliance resulting in critical 340B cost savings for our customers. We value fresh thinking, drive, transparency, and are dedicated to providing agile and proactive solutions to those who serve the most vulnerable in our communities. At Verity Solutions, we foster a collaborative, casual, and technology driven environment and want to evolve and grow with diverse people who are inspired by progress and delighted by partnering with others.

The Sr. DevSecOps Engineer position is a key contributor to Verity’s industry-leading 340B SaaS platform, responsible for securing, maintaining, and extending performant, reliable, healthy, and scalable AWS architectures. This is a highly valuable position that will require you to have strong experience with securing cloud based infrastructure and applications. We’re looking for engineers who can mix great collaborative skills, an ability to work independently, an automation-first approach to problem solving, and deliver well thought and compelling solutions as part of an agile team.


Assure the DevSecOps infrastructure, data assets, and services meets appropriate Cigna and regulatory requirements.

Primary liaison with the Cigna Information Protection (CIP) team to manage policy compliance and issue remediation.

Support maintaining our security assessments and certifications such as HITRUST.

Protect the confidentiality of sensitive and/or proprietary company and customer information, including HIPAA data.

Support vendors, customers, or prospects requesting a security review of our platform and services.

Follow engineering and security best practices. Engage in understanding market trends by independent learning and research.

Manage production and pre-production environments and deployments for our SaaS platform.

Ensure business continuity and disaster recovery in an automated way.

Document work and automation code/logic so that others can understand and contribute.

Network, Servers, Active Directory, and similar systems.

Implement monitoring systems to alert and report on key production environment metrics.

Communicate progress, issues, and risks in a timely manner and cadence.

Collaborate with other engineers and analysts on design, task sharing, and problem solving.

Partner and communicate with Operations and Development team members to ensure successful production deployments and ensure security and effective monitoring in production environments.

Support and promote the Verity values through positive interactions with both internal and external stakeholders on a regular basis.

Support office IT needs as needed.

Other key projects and initiatives as assigned.


Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience.

At least 5+ years of hands on experience with core AWS services: EC2, Cloud Formation, S3, Cloud Watch, Inspector, and similar services. AWS certification is preferred but not required.

Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification is preferred but not required.

Lead reporting and remediation efforts surrounding security vulnerability compliance.

Experience with security tools such as PRISMA, Tenable, Archer GRC, Inspector, and OSSEC.

Experience in CICD automation and configuration software like Jenkins, Chef, Run Deck, MOVEit.

Experience with infrastructure as code, including Cloud Formation and Terraform.

Proficiency in Linux and Windows server administration.

Knowledgeable in supporting backend database technologies such as Mongo, MS-SQL, MYSQL.

Knowledgeable in network configuration/troubleshooting (load balancing, firewalls, VPN, etc.)

Proficiency in setting up and maintaining robust monitoring and alerting systems like Splunk or Grafana.

Programming proficiency in any of the following languages to develop tools and automation: PowerShell, Bash, JSON, Golang, C#.

Experience supporting Golang web based solutions preferred.

A track record of designing for high scale and fault tolerance.

Proficient with current industry-leading development tools (IDE, Source control, build/CI, etc.)

Knowledge of cloud-centric design patterns.

Curiosity and critical thinking skills.

Strong problem-solving skills.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Self-motivated, ability to be effective with minimal supervision.

Ability to collaborate effectively with team members in a Scrum-based environment.

Ability to adapt to changing requirements, business processes, etc.

Experience developing applications for Pharmacy or Healthcare industries preferred.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Systems Analyst - eviCore - Work From Home
Job_Description:
Cigna Investment Management (CIM) manages over $35 billion in assets on behalf of Cigna, a publicly traded global health services company. CIM’s assets are invested in public bonds, private placement securities, commercial mortgages, real estate equity, mezzanine debt, private equity, equity securities, warrants, commercial paper, certificates of deposit, municipal securities, mutual fund shares, United States government securities, options contracts on securities, futures contracts on intangibles, money market funds, derivatives, structured notes, exchange traded funds and hedge funds.

What we are looking for:
Join us as an Investment Analyst as part of the portfolio management team supporting US insurance, international insurance and pension portfolios. In this role, you will interact with portfolio managers, Cigna's US and International businesses, corporate finance and accounting partners, CIM’s trading desk and IT Staff.


Under the direction of the senior portfolio managers, the Investment Analyst will focus on the following:
Act as assistant portfolio manager for assigned portfolios, including assisting with development of portfolio strategies, monitoring of portfolio metrics, management of liquidity, credit, interest rate and other risks, and implementation of investment purchase and sale programs
Creating models to analyze potential and existing strategies and the impact on regulatory compliance, liquidity management, counterparty exposure, surplus investing and investment income projections
Participate in CIM Roadmap working groups and collaborate with Data Governance and across CIM to define manage and govern essential data
Collaborating with PM’s to write specifications and test IT projects within an Agile framework and ensuring that the requests adhere to data governance framework and IT principles
Work with portfolio analysts to create communication materials such as quarterly reports to clients, presentations for senior management and external stakeholders and portfolio management reports
Monitor and summarize economics, market themes and market activity for the portfolio management team

Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS
ASA or CFA or commitment to obtain CFA required. FSA, MBA or other advanced financial designation a plus
3+ years of actuarial, finance or investment experience
Ability to accommodate limited travel (up to 10%)
Flexibility to participate in calls after normal business hours with international customers
Flexible work from home arrangement

This position supports Cigna Investments, Inc., an investment adviser registered with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). The successful candidate will become an Access Person of CII required to comply with the personal trading requirements and restrictions contained in CII’s Code of Ethics. These requirements and restrictions apply to the Access Person and all securities transactions in accounts in which an Access Person has a Beneficial Interest.

Title: Software Engineering Senior Advisor - Evernorth
Job_Description:
Engineer will work on a team of truly talented individuals and be responsible for design, build and testing (using automation scripts but not limited to unit/integration/performance testing) of Individual & Family Retail Health Insurance applications and its components that interface with complex enterprise systems and external vendor systems. Engineer will have solid knowledge working with complex distributed applications and passion for technologies by solving data integration challenges. Individual will have zeal and drive to be up to speed with latest development in tech arena.

Engineer must be a highly motivated, well-rounded, team player and self-starter that works best in a collaborative, dynamic, agile environment. Excellent communication skills both written and oral are also essential as this position will interface with remote scrum teams, business owners, enterprise architects, security, infrastructure, and end users via email, phone, IM, desktop sharing, and wiki.

Responsibilities
Leverage existing open source frameworks, third party components/libraries, cloud and commercial software to design and develop robust enterprise solutions. Mentality towards integrating and reusing existing capabilities vs building from scratch is highly desired.
Enable a 360-degree view of customer-centric information through integration of a multitude of internal/external systems, mobile apps, devices, and data marts.
Ability to implement test driven development with strong focus on automation testing.
Support and enhance existing Individual & Family Retail Health Insurance applications used by consumers as well as operations staff.
Participate in all agile ceremonies effectively.
Ability to lead team of mid-level developers.

Skillset
Engineer should be very familiar with advanced concepts and have relevant, hands-on experience in many of the following areas to be a successful contributor on the team:
Informatica – data integration, extract, transform, load.
Data quality, data replication
Cloud and related technologies such as AWS, Google, Azure.
Test Automation Skills using Behavioral Driven Development.
Data Integration (batch, near real-time) following Enterprise Integration Patterns.
Service Oriented Architecture (event-driven SOA, Web Services, REST, ESB).
Message driven architecture (JMS, SOA, Spring).
Relational Database, No SQL Database, DynamoDB and Data Modeling,
Database development & tuning (PL/SQL/XQuery).
Performance (threading, indexing, clustering, caching).
Document-centric data architecture (XML DB/NoSQL).
Knowledge of reporting/BI tools such as Tableau would be plus.
Full-stack engineering mindset with a passion for excelling in all areas of the software development life cycle such as analysis, design, development, automated testing, and DevOps.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline strongly preferred, typically ten or more years of solid, diverse work experience in IT with a minimum of five years’ experience application program development, or the equivalent in education and work experience. Ideal candidate will have relevant experience either as a consultant or working for a start-up company.

This role is WAH/Flex, which allows most work to be performed at home. WAH/Flex employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they choose to come onsite or if required to periodically come on site.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Software Engineering Senior Advisor - Evernorth
Job_Description:
In this role, you will work with business and technical experts to implement quality software engineering solutions and best practices. You must serve as team lead and have superb analytical and technical skills. You will participate in the collaborative architectural refinement, software design and realization of products that support the strategic technology needs to support the organization. As a full stack engineer, you have the breadth of knowledge in computer science, a problem-solving mentality and a desire to learn. You are comfortable working within a technical capacity across many of the sectors including core development on platform, data processing and report generation. The FSE will be working in a team that demands technical excellence and whose members are expected to hold each other accountable in the overall success of the output. Focus for this team is on the delivery of innovative solutions to complex problems. Qualifications:
Demonstrate mentality of building well architected applications for Cloud.
Demonstrate mentality of quality being owned by the entire team.
Can identify code defects and work with other developers to address quality issues in product code.
Passion for finding bottlenecks and thresholds in existing code through the use of automation tools.
Contribute to automation pyramid and integrate with CI/CD tools for continuous validation.
Passion for continuing education and improving code quality.
Able to articulate clear business objectives aligned to technical specifications and work in an iterative agile pattern daily. Responsibilities
Lead team and complete core code development for back, middle and front end applications
Operational triage of bugs, failed test cases and system failures
Lead the team with technical support and guidance as needed
Perform code review and make recommendations for optimizing code performance
Mapping user stories to detailed technical specifications
Deploying & developing cloud applications end to end
Contributing to a pilot or PoC effort to bring innovation to delivery
Working In stages of the environment lifecycle including Production
Automation of manual data object creation and test cases
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas Requirements and Skill sets needed:
Experience or willingness to serve as team lead.
5+ years of software development experience in Core Java
Experience in AWS services including AWS Step function, Lambda (using Python), AWS Glue, SNS, SQS, Eventbridge
Experience in Java 8 features such as Lambda Expressions, functional programing
Experience in Java frameworks such as Spring Boot, RESTful API services
Experience with Terraform, experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines is a plus
Experience with NoSQL Databases such as MongoDB
Experience with containers such as Open Shift/ Kubernetes, Docker
Experience with Kafka
Experience with JUnit, end to end testing. Having done TDD based application development is a plus
Excellent communication skills
Experience in SDLC, including testing and deployment
Working knowledge of scripting languages
Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism

Title: Software Engineering Senior Advisor - Evernorth
Job_Description:
Help us support our future. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Do you have collaboration or problem-solving experience? If so, prepare to innovate, create, and inspire. The Software Engineering Senior Advisor will be working in a Parallel SYSPLEX environment across multiple LPAR’s with a robust online environment, i.e. CICS, DB2, MQ. Candidate should possess experience in system problem and diagnostic’s, team oriented demeanor, work within best practices guidelines for Change and Incident management, system changes a plus working with an Agile methodology. Team oriented demeanor with strong verbal and written communications skillsets.

Responsibilities
Responsible for providing technical system support 24x7 of operating system and related mainframe technical and operations areas.
Responsible for maintenance and technical support for all mainframe systems software including product currency and supportability.
Providing technical guidance as need to application and mainframe related technical teams.
Acting as technical liaison between client based needs and mainframe software vendors.
Adhering to all change, Incident and problem management procedures.
Problem / Incident Management - responsibility and accountability for follow up of associated system issues / incidents, identifying root cause, analysis of corrective / preventive actions, i.e. Automation. Monitoring, etc.
Agile – adhering to department defined processes, providing regular updates to user stories and user story management.
Pro-Active - Forward Thinking - review for any opportunities in maintaining system health and reducing risk to business. Leveraging Automation opportunities in working ‘ smarter not harder’.
Documentation Currency – ensure documentation is clear and current. Including but not limited to, product PID’s, software inventory, processes, procedures, SOP’s etc.

Qualifications
High School diploma; Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Senior-level experience (10+ years) as a mainframe systems engineer coupled with a strong background in root-cause analysis and preventive maintenance strategies are highly desired.
Candidate should be well versed in Operating Systems technical support, system parameters, operating system and third party software installations, upgrades.
Proficient in SMP/E, JCL, TSO, zOS System PARMs, JES2MAS, zOS and JES2 exits, Unix System Services, zFS File Structures, Change / Incident Management.
Experience with PARALLEL SYSPLEX, Coupling Facilities, CF Policies a plus.
Experience with IBM hardware, z14, z15, z16’s a plus.
Knowledge of TSO REXX, COBOL, Assembler a plus.
Knowledge of MASTER / USER Catalog structures.
Understanding of online applications, CICS, DB2, MQ a plus.
Experience with but not all Computer Associates, Compuware and IBM mainframe supporting products, i.e. CA7 / CA11, CA1, CA SYSVIEW, File Aid, Abend Aid, File Manager, IWS, RMM, Omegamon…
Strong verbal and written communications skillsets.
Team oriented along with self starter / independent work methodologies.
Supports the application and infrastructure environments
The role will report to a Senior Engineering manager located remotely. As such, the Senior Reliability Engineer will be required to build and sustain a strong, collaborative working relationship with the mainframe infrastructure support teams and leadership. Occasional travel may be requested.
Must have a depth of technical understanding within a respective specialization that requires to operate both independently, to methodically identify opportunities for improvement, and collaboratively, to implement solutions in conjunction with the application support team and related development teams.
Displays technical proficiency and effectively lead by example, communicate, mentor, as well as build and sustain the reliability culture for the mainframe infrastructure team.

Job_Description:
The RPA Platform Engineer will be an integral part of the RPA delivery team of our Office of Intelligent Automation (OIA) at EVERNORTH. Help design the To-Be state of automations, and assist in the creation of the Solution Design Document (SDD)
Help set up UiPath environments and communicate the technical infrastructure requirements to deploy automation solutions
Support UAT and deployments of automations to production and between environments.

Provide technical guidance to developers.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues


A Bachelors or M.S. Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or similar majors.
4+ years of experience coding in one or more system level programming languages (Powershell, C# C, C++, Python, Rust etc.) and a willingness to learn new ones2+ years supporting RPA platforms

Cloud ecosystems experience

Experience with Agile Software Development Lifecycle
Proven experience with design principles and modular programming techniques
Excellent Communication skills

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
United States - Work From Home

First things first, we’re a global health service company dedicated to helping people improve their health, well-being and sense of security. But we don’t just care about your well-being, we care about your career health too. That’s why when you work with us, you can count on a different kind of career – you’ll make a difference, learn a ton, and share in changing the way people think about healthcare.

Now on to the good stuff… what you’ll do:
Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineers uses specialized depth and experience to develop and modify complex software application programs supporting Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence initiatives. This position will be responsible for advocating, educating and partnering with teams across the enterprise to develop best practices around the preferred technology stacks, as well as implementing Machine Learning applications and proof of concepts (POC). As a member of the newly formed Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineering team, This position will also create detailed specifications, conduct quality assurance reviews of peer's application programming.

Create Machine Learning Solutions to achieve organizational objectives

Consult to product development team’s best practices related to Machine Learning application development and Machine Learning/AI-specific infrastructure technology stacks (e.g. GPU-based systems, A.I. in public cloud, etc).

Apply best practice software engineering principles towards the development of applications, in order to productionalize Machine Learning models produced by Data Scientists and ML Engineers

Leverage Big Data and Data Science tools (i.e. one or more of SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Python, R) to both source and work with data

Ensure quality of technology delivery of multiple vendors’ technology solutions for multiple concurrent projects or programs for an application family.

Deliver solutions for multiple concurrent projects

Identify and implement process enhancement opportunities associated with supporting the application area.

Implement actions to increase ESI and vendor partner knowledge on team.

Serve as SME for components of the team.

Provide technical guidance to projects/programs for complex components of a multiple technology suites.

Develop standard practices, components, guidelines for use of complex technology components.

Resolve urgent and high production incidents.

Determine root cause of problems and drive resolution.

Work on other projects as assigned.


Bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of relevant experience or a Master’s degree in a relevant field or the equivalence of education and experience

Good understanding of relational and nosql database concepts and data processing

data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning)

version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code

Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field.

Ability to provide and implement technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.

Solutions are innovative, thorough, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.

Strong customer service focus.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry.

Familiar with working in a vendor partner model.

Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Adaptability and willingness to lean new tools and applications.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across project team
