Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
The job profile for this position is for an IT Project Management Director, which is a Band 5 Career Track Role.

Position Overview:
The job profile for this position is IT Project Management Manager, reporting to the E2E Client Onboarding Solution Train Engineer Director within the US Medical Technology Front Office Technology organization. This is a Band 4 Individual Track Role.
As an IT Project Manager, you will have accountability for across a multi-year program focused on delivering 10M or less of value across multiple ARTs and agile scrum teams in the enterprise. Our aim is to accelerate our growth by advancing our capabilities and improving our overall efficiency and effectiveness. It means shifting how we get work done, moving away from our traditional vertical / silo mindset and embracing a more horizontal, end-to-end, cross-functional approach. The programs goals center on efficiency & effectiveness leveraging intelligent automation tools (NLP, AI, ML, Chabot’s etc.), process optimization and other applicable applications and software to help improve operational efficiency, enhance capacity utilization and improve stakeholder experiences across the Cigna enterprise. As an STE, you will help deliver solutions on an enterprise-wide scale that drive significant business value.

In this role, you will actively partner with Senior Leadership, Stakeholder Owners, operational excellence teams, subject matter experts, communication leaders, training partners, and enterprise strategic portfolio leaders.
As an STE will have an opportunity to demonstrate strong leadership skills as you drive change, resolve conflicts, synthesis solutions, and facilitate agile ceremonies with senior leadership. Core competencies to be successful in this role include being an effective communicator, having a strong customer focus, being results oriented, with an ability to manage ambiguity, conflicts, plans and the ability to adapt to various situations. Growth opportunities exist within Enterprise and Solution Architecture to learn cross-company (i.e. Cigna Health Plan, ESI Health Services, Evernorth) technology stacks and solution patterns that will drive the IT delivery/build roadmap. Additional growth opportunities to learn from product strategy and business operations on how we quote, sell, and price benefit offerings in the market and service/payout claims to our customers, providers, and clients.


Facilitate the flow of value through agile ceremonies and processes while working with agile release trains across the value stream.
Communicate with stakeholders, escalate blockers, facilitate risk management, and drive continuous improvement.
Facilitate and guide the work of all Agile Release Trains,(ARTs) and Suppliers aligned to the Solution.
Manage and optimize the flow of value through the Solution Train using various tools.
Facilitate Pre- and Post-Program Increment (PI) Planning to coordinate and integrate the outcomes of PI Planning across Agile Release Team (ARTs. Aggregate Program PI Objectives into Solution PI Objectives
Facilitate any necessary communication between delivery teams within a Value Stream. Drive continuous improvement via Inspect and Adapt (I&A) at the Large Solution layer
Encourage collaboration between System Architects and Solution Architects, User Experience, and Engineer’s Reports status, and support activities related to Lean Portfolio Management
Facilitate the Solution Demo
Help manage risks and dependencies across ARTs
Escalate and tracks impediments across ARTs
Help with strategy and execution alignment working with Solution Management, Product Management, and stakeholders
Encourage and facilitate Solution-level continuous integration and communities of practice for Quality, Engineering, SAFe, Agile, and Lean.


4-6 years’ experience managing software delivery; Proven track record of delivering on large scale or multiple initiatives.
Experience with all aspects of delivery, including planning, facilitation of epic/features/user story decomposition, design and delivery execution
Proven ability to effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders to identify needs and evaluate alternative solutions and strategies
Servant leader and strong communicator with strong interpersonal skills
Experience applying Lean Thinking and Systems Thinking in large organizations
Self-directed achiever who identifies opportunities to drive value and takes the lead
Excellent executive skills with a customer service oriented approach, and a focus on building relationships with people at all levels of the organization
Strong attention to detail, problem solving, and organizational skills
Ability to handle difficult or sensitive situations in a professional manner
Change leader who will be proactive in influencing positive growth for the future

Desired Experience / Qualifications
Agile Delivery Management experience proven through 2-4 years’ experience as an STE, RTE, Agile Product Owner, Program Manager
Strong IT application development & leadership background preferred

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Overall Job Purpose
This position will support all projects related to the Contact Center Engagement Channels. Candidates should have prior experience as an architect in a Contact Center environment and have deep technical understanding of Contact Center functionality. Responsibilities will include architecting contact center solutions coordinating with the cross-functional Contact Center Platform teams, Contact Center Operations, Enterprise Architecture, Security, Telephony and Contact Center product communities to design and drive the implementation of Contact Center solutions which meet the strategic needs of the business. The candidate will also need to coordinate with the individual business unit leads to ensure solution will satisfy their strategic going-forward requirements. The role of the solution architect within the organization is to understand the business needs of the organization and develop solutions based on Contact Center technology to satisfy those needs.
This permanent position has the ability to be not just a hands-on engineer role but more of an internal consultant to the business.

Key Job Accountabilities
Conduct internal client assessments which includes as-is, to-be, gap analysis phased technology plans, project plans and audit documentation
Be responsible for identifying gaps and issues, recommend areas of opportunity, determine potential timing and sequencing of improvement initiatives, and define the costs and benefits of proposed solutions
Act as a technology partner between the Contact Center Business Leadership and Technology teams to aid in planning, coordinating and directing the delivery of highly complex business solutions to meet our Contact Center needs.
Actively governs the IT elements of the project through its life cycle, ensuring the delivered solution is aligned with architecture and standards
Utilize experience of Contact Center systems such as Contact Routing and CTI, Automatic Call Distribution (ACD), Interactive Voice Response (IVR), Call Recording, Workforce Management and Quality Assurance for multi-channel contact management of voice, email, chat, SMS messaging, etc. to provide guidance, thought leadership and operational support as a highly skilled Contact Center advisor for internal and external customers
Development of strategic designs. Conducting iterative reviews and revisions of design documentation
Be capable of driving large contact center projects from an architecture and design perspective including:
Call routing
Multi-platform Contact Centers
Inbound/outbound self-service/queuing and applications
Agent desktop
Courtesy Callback
IVR
Deployment approach
Identify technology solutions and applications that meet the internal client’s business requirements from both a functional and technical perspective
Develop internal documentation for Contact Center solutions network and hardware requirements:
Technical white papers
Position papers as they relate to technology solutions
Technical proposals
Cost proposals and budgetary estimates
Develop internal documentation for strategic solutions
Collaborates, negotiates, and influences technical direction and decision making with internal clients in order to enable the delivery of quality for contact center solutions
Enhances Contact Center Application team reputation by identifying areas for expansion and improvement both internal and external; this duty requires forward looking vision to help assess potential avenues/opportunities to apply contact center technologies with new and unforeseen applications
Identifies new product opportunities as they relate to Contact Center systems

Basic Qualifications
Minimum 10 years’ experience in IT related role
Minimum 7 years’ experience with Contact Center technologies
Minimum 3 years’ experience in an architectural role, leading projects with full accountability

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrable industry leading knowledge across the Contact Center domain and leading-edge thinking in the arena of Omni-channel contact solutions.


Multi-media Contact Center (audio/video, chat, SMS, Web)
Cisco UCCE
Genesys
Conversational AI
Integration with 3rd party Omnichannel tools including Upstream Works, Surfly and others
Interactive Voice Recognition (IVR)
Agent Desktop
Cisco/Acqueon Outbound Dialer
Verint Voice / Screen recording
Server / Database infrastructure
Experience with an applied knowledge of Cisco and Genesys Contact Routing-CTI platforms, Telecommunications and TDM-VoIP technologies for Contact Center solutions
Working knowledge of technical/business analysis and program management methodologies
Demonstrated track record of delivering results in a matrix, multi partner environment
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain working relationships with a diverse community of technology and business partners and effectively influence both technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain working relationships with executive leadership
Demonstrated ability to deliver and support large complex projects

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Position Title: Application Development Sr Manager – Intelligent Automation Technical Leader
Excited to grow your career?
We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.
Help us architect our future. Be a leader. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Love being on the edge of technology, exploring, innovating, working through problems, meeting with technologies leaders across the industry and customers, building processes and technical solutions to deliver stronger business capabilities and results? If so, prepare to innovate, create and inspire. The Office of Intelligent Automation (OIA) at Cigna establishes governance, technology & tools adoption and enforces all Intelligent Automation operational guidelines and processes across Cigna. OIA’s primary focus is to identify and remove automation barriers to help businesses achieve productivity and operational efficiency goals consistently and quickly.
Position Summary
Intelligent Automation Technical Leader will be involved in driving multiple strategic/key initiatives within the organization. These initiatives could be related to exploring new products, POC’s for new products or solutions, enabling new automation products in the field of AI, ML, document processing, process mining, Conversational AI, Hyperautomation, Robotics and more. There will be an operational aspect to this role as well, being responsible for defining and operationalizing the operations model for new products, services and solutions enabled.
We are envisioning this role to be sort of full stack hands on technology leader, who can drive initiatives, be hands on working issues, manage critical issues and coach junior resources within the team.
Product vendors, Business leads, OIA (Office of Intelligent Automation) delivery leads, Platform team, multiple infrastructure teams, other support teams and vendors.

Responsibilities and Essential Functions
Provide technical leadership on the initiatives underway within OIA to evolve AI, ML, IDP, Conversational AI and Robotics capabilities.
Drive initiative related to exploration and POC of new products in the field of intelligent automation.
Drive short and long term resolution of production issues on the solution/code and automation platform.
Organize and participate in various agile ceremonies of the team.
Develop process/models to establish a balance between stability and speed to market to deliver new capabilities into production
Improve the emergency response procedures of production issues
In partnership with OIA technology leadership, develop procedure to expedite POC’s undertaken for new products & solutions being explored
Drive inclusion of nonfunctional requirements into the solutions being designed.
Managing a team accountable for monitoring, health check, issue reporting, issue triage, incident management and reporting for all production robots
Partnering with multiple delivery leads to plan onboarding (go-live) of Automation solutions into production
Actively lead high priority issues impacting production automations and help drive them to resolution working with multiple teams
Manage escalations and ensure proper resolutions
Identify process improvement opportunities and work towards incorporating them into the process model
Educate the vendor resources on Cigna processes and policies as necessary

Intelligent Automation Technical Leader top skills & proficiencies
Experience working on Intelligent automation products like Blue Prism, Pega Robotics, UiPath, IDP, AI, ML and conversational AI (the more the better)
Experienced working with cloud services
Comfortable working in dynamic, high pressure environment to meet target dates for deliverables
Experienced handling highly visible production issues
Technologist at heart, motivated to explore areas never worked in before.
Comfortable establishing new processes and implement them within and onshore – offshore teams
. Technically skilled on IT services for a large organization
Capable of driving alignment across multiple business and IT teams
Comfortable working in an evolving organization and dealing with ambiguity
Enterprise Competencies
Persistence - Demonstrates a strong and persistent drive to achieve meaningful results; drives tasks to successful completion and closure; shows determination in the face of obstacles and setbacks
Continuous Learning - Takes initiative to practice and apply new knowledge and skills, identifying areas of development and seeks ways to expand and continually broaden skills and capabilities while aligning to the goals and values of the organization
Flexibility - Demonstrates flexibility of responses to different situations and adapts to changing needs, conditions, priorities or opportunities
Thinking Outside the Box - Learns and applies innovative methods, tools, and technology and expertise in ways that are unique or innovative; explores multiple alternatives and approaches to overcome obstacles, suggesting creative ideas and innovative solutions
Relentless Focus on Continuous Improvement - Uses technologies to stay on the cutting edge of best practices, tools and processes; relentlessly seeks ways to continuously improve and leverage automation to its full potential
Automation First Mentality – approaches engagements with a focus on automation at all times seeking way to leverage automation first
Organizational Agility – knowledge about how the organization works; knows how to get things done both through formal channels and the informal network; and understand the culture of the organization

Position Qualifications
10+ years of progressive experience working in business and IT organizations combined, including 4+ years of software development managerial experience
Ability to navigate within a matrix organization effectively, as well as manage outsourced/offshore staff (managed services and time & materials)
Excellent analytical skills
Good communication and presentation skills
Ability to build and manage a team of high performing individuals
Demonstrated ability and experience in providing cross-organizational managerial leadership.
Ability to guide, mentor, and grow production operations professionals; and to integrate people and teams
Proven experience influencing senior management, business & technical leaders & software engineers
Demonstrated ability to delegate and empower others
Strong knowledge of industry standards and techniques in both proactive and reactive production operations
Ability to influence technical discussions and decisions
Strong work ethic and sense of urgency
Experience with fast-paced start-up software development environments
Experience with hiring and staffing
A BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related degree preferred

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $132,800 - $221,400, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
AMP Robotics is a pioneer and industry leader in artificial intelligence (AI), robotics, and infrastructure for the waste and recycling industry. We apply AI-powered automation to economically and sustainably improve our global recycling system.
Headquartered in Louisville, Colorado, the Denver Post and BuiltIn Colorado have recognized AMP as one of the state's top workplaces. AMP also has operations and career opportunities outside of Atlanta and Cleveland, as well as in Europe. We're fostering an environment where passionate individuals can grow and create impact. Learn more at AMPRobotics.com.
AMP Robotics is hiring a DevOps Engineer reporting to the Engineering Manager - Cloud to focus on automating the hard stuff and reducing friction in the software deployment process. You'll work closely with our other engineering teams to make sure that we can keep delivering the best possible accuracy with our sorting processes without missing a beat, and that our feature velocity doesn't require us to sacrifice quality. You'll touch just about every system at AMP, and you'll take the initiative to "be the glue" and help every part of the engineering organization work better.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Help us lead our future. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Do you have collaboration or agile experience? If so, prepare to innovate, create, and inspire. The Cloud Senior Engineer (Application Development Senior Advisor) will be responsible for participating in the collaborative architectural refinement, software design and realization of products that support the strategic technology needs for our organization. Lead and mentor a full-stack team to meet the demands of a fast-growing company for award-winning CRM deliveries. Lead multiple activities including but not limited to data models, APIs, partner integrations, and cloud infrastructure.

10+ years of diverse Technology experience with a minimum of 6 years of experience in Software development with Bachelor in Computer Science or equivalent trade.

Experience with Security Concepts (e.g. Encryption, Identity, etc.).

Desired
Experience in Healthcare

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Site Reliability Engineer
AMP Robotics is a pioneer and industry leader in artificial intelligence (AI), robotics, and infrastructure for the waste and recycling industry. We apply AI-powered automation to economically and sustainably improve our global recycling system.
Headquartered in Louisville, Colorado, the Denver Post and BuiltIn Colorado have recognized AMP as one of the state's top workplaces. AMP also has operations and career opportunities outside of Atlanta and Cleveland, as well as in Europe. We're fostering an environment where passionate individuals can grow and create impact. We seek unconventional thinkers to join our mission to enable a world without waste; at AMP, your contributions have meaning and can spur change. With backing from top-tier investors and national recognition including North American Cleantech Company of the Year and Forbes' most promising AI companies, we're always seeking ways to better our operations, raising the bar on innovation, and looking to collaborate and improve in what we do. Learn more at AMPRobotics.com.
AMP Robotics is hiring a Site Reliability Engineer reporting to the Site Reliability Engineering Manager. The role focuses on turning raw, field data into actionable and transparent intelligence - allowing efficient scaling and improved reliability of AMP fleet devices and facilities. As a Site Reliability Engineer you will build automated tooling to proactively monitor device health and technical process health - as well as lead efforts in commissioning and startup of new AMP facilities.
The Site Reliability Engineering team will work closely with other engineering groups (DevOps, Software Engineering, Facility Ops, QA Engineering, etc.) to define acceptable error rates and a common performance language. As an Ops facing and reliability focused group, Site Reliability Engineers will focus heavily on reducing product downtime, predictive modeling and proactive alerts for device level failure, standardized root cause analysis, and process engineering best practices.
Site Reliability Engineers function as the primary liaison between Ops and Sustaining Engineering efforts, increasing interdisciplinary knowledge of product designers, sales teams, project managers, service teams, and production groups with respect to how AMP devices and software actually function in the wild. The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for answering the question "Is the fleet operating within defined performance metrics, without interruption… and can we prove it". The Site Reliability Engineer will work closely with customers and internal teams to operate AMP Robotics fleet of devices at peak performance.
Site Reliability Engineering team

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Cigna, a leading Health Services company, is looking for exceptional Intelligent Automation Engineer Senior Advisor in our Intelligent Automation Center of Excellence (COE). The primary responsibility for this role is to be the principal engineer /designer/architect for UI Path and its entire suite of capabilities.

This role requires you to be able to understand business processes in operations across all domains in our enterprise, and also understand and help determine technologies we can use to help create business value. Provide comprehensive consultation to business unit and IT management and staff at the highest technical level on all phases of application programming and processes for diverse development platforms, computing environments (e.g., hosted, distributed systems, client server, software, hardware, IA technologies and tools, etc.).

Works closely with Business partners and IT management to identify IA solutions, determine technical feasibility, and engineer and architect IA solutions to meet the business need with an eye towards building/leveraging reusable components where applicable.

In this role, you will work as part of an agile scrum team and across scrum teams where appropriate and actively partner with Intelligent Automation COE leadership, business stakeholders, operational excellence teams, subject matter experts, application delivery teams and architects on initiatives that support Cigna's strategic goals centered on using intelligent automation tools (RPA, RDA, AI, ML, Chabot’s etc) to help improve operational efficiency, enhance capacity utilization and improve stakeholder experiences across the Cigna enterprise.


Understand, Analyze and Design automation Solutions
Contribute to the development of governance, frameworks and procedures to continually improve a rapid, standardized and repeatable delivery factory model using UI Path.
Assess automation opportunities from a technical perspective and design/implement enterprise-grade solutions that are efficient, scalable and maintainable.
Configure new RPA processes and objects using design principles that are efficient, well structured, maintainable and easy to understand using UI Path
Design RPA libraries and reusable components
Troubleshoot and debug UI Path automations for bug fixes
Analysis of RPA opportunities within business processes
Create and own and test automation processes including integration and unit testing
Participate in peer review of solution designs
Conduct production deployment processes and performance testing
Interact and engage with operational excellence teams and business process owners to understand process and value drivers using automation
Understand/determine process steps that can be automated
Provide your team with insight into the product roadmap and articulate technical direction and considerations partnering with solution architects
Encourage the team to start with the end in mind
Obsess with optimizing the product to achieve business goals while maximizing return on investment and business value
Knowledge of business process modeling and reengineering, awareness of standard SDLC processes (e.g., agile, waterfall, etc.) and change control disciplines, ability to blend business analysis with technical skillset to develop efficient processes
Possess good communication skills with the ability to present technical details to a non-technical audience
Especially UI Path
Determine automation idea viability & understand value drivers
Understand the overall value of an automation idea and different value drivers like efficiency, risk, improved productivity etc
Determine automation viability by analyzing complexity and technological feasibility
Help calculate cost for delivery of an automation idea by t-shirt sizing opportunities
Interact and collaborate with a wide variety of business and IT stakeholders across the Cigna enterprise
Intelligent automation capabilities and architecture
Developing rock-solid, scalable intelligent automation solutions
Drive opportunities to revolutionize workflow and business processes with robotics, machine learning, and AI
Enforce modern delivery practices such as continuous integration, continuous delivery, and test driven development in line with Cigna standards


Passionate about intelligent automation tools and using the latest technologies to deliver business solutions
Boundless intellectual curiosity to continually learn and explore how to do things better, faster and cheaper
A “roll-up your sleeves and get the job done” mentality
Enjoys speaking with customers to understand how we can best meet their needs
Ability to effectively deal with change
Team player and ability to collaborate well
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with a wide variety of stakeholders
Passion to learn
Takes ownership and accountability
Understands when to automate and when not to
Excellent abstract, analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent facilitation skills
Comfortable working with ambiguity
Ability to work as part of a high performing team in a fast paced environment

Experiences
A Bachelors or M.S. Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or similar majors.
5+ years of SDLC development
3+ years engineering and architecting solutions using UI Path is required
Demonstrated experience with thorough problem solving, analytical and design skills, combined with strong business acumen
Prior entrepreneurial or startup experience is desirable
Knowledge and experience with agile development is desired

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
As a part of Analytics Engineering, this role will directly engage with the Machine Learning COE team to usher in emerging technology solutions for the enterprise.

This role is preferred to be located in our Austin, TX office, with the opportunity to work in a Flex environment - part of the time working from home. We will consider candidates in remote locations as well.


How you'll make a difference:
Solve complex problems, inspire engineering talent, and deliver business capabilities that improve access to high performing providers

Develop strategies to support business capabilities on an enterprise-wide scale, delivering user-oriented products in a fast-paced and agile environment

Partner with various finance departments to identify and implement system enhancements in efficiency, accuracy, process improvements and automation, and user interface design

Drive opportunities to revolutionize workflow with embedded analytics, machine learning, and AI

Manage the planning and delivery of a consolidated, conformed enterprise data warehouse and data lake

Focuses on achievement of departmental goals and plays a significant part in achieving functional goals

Lead, manage and develop a high performing team

Hire and retain strong software engineering talent

Develop existing talent into full stack engineers

Provide your team with insight into the product roadmap and articulate technical direction and considerations

Enforce modern delivery practices such as continuous integration, behavior/test driven development

Performance management of direct reports

Drive a culture of continuous improvement and accountability


5+ years of experience managing other leaders

5+ years of experience designing and developing complex, large scale interactive applications with hands-on architectural, solutions-based or modular systems experience including: Java, Python, React )

Experience with Cloud native architecture preferred (ie AWS, ECS, Sagemaker, Redshift)

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
KEY OBJECTIVE – Forensic/Performance Troubleshooting – On Premise and Cloud Infrastructure and Applications
Functions as an EOCC Forensics/Performance Team member and subject matter expert utilizing academic and/or practical systems and/or application level performance skills for analysis, troubleshooting and monitoring of key IT components.
Functions as an investigator for systems and application outages, issues, resolution and testing.
Adheres to the concept of “Site Reliability Engineering” (SRE). A site reliability engineer will spend up to 50% of their time doing operations related work such as handling issues, spending time on-call, and manual intervention. Since the software system that an SRE oversees is expected to be highly automatic and self-healing, the SRE should spend the other 50% of their time on development tasks such as adding new features, such as for scaling or automation. A site reliability engineer is usually either a software engineer with a good administration background or a skilled system administrator with knowledge of coding and automation.In general, an SRE team is responsible for availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, emergency response, and capacity planning.
Will function as a technical subject matter expert in one or more areas of computer forensics investigation. Examples – Cloud computing, infrastructure, operating systems, applications, databases, network.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Proactive
Solicit and provide technical direction into constant improvement in the performance monitoring and analysis process to improve availability and reduce future mean time between failures.
Understand the technical design, current and proposed usage of infrastructure and IT services, as well as the maximum capacity and target performance of each component.
Utilize best practices of tooling, metrics, correlation, anomaly detection, methodologies, and education. Utilize expertise in these areas from industry, training, academia, and in-house conceptual testing.
Provide performance related feedback to Capacity Planners, application and product owners, platform and command center operations teams .
Reactive
Work with EOCC Incident and Problem Management, application owners, and support towers to lead or assist in resolving any performance or capacity related incidents or severe system/application problems.
Preventative
Support application Performance Volume Stress/Resiliency (PVSR) testing with the level of engagement varying by project scope, criticality or when performance problems are encountered during testing.
Service Level
Analyze performance information to establish/update performance baselines and projections.
Report on service and component performance against the targets.
Mentoring
Provide training and mentoring to other team members and to the IT community on systems and application performance topics in order to create and build better performance troubleshooting skills at various technical tiers and computing disciplines.
Additional
Attendance at continual technical training courses and conferences is required.
24x7 support may occasionally be required.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, OR a high level of comparable and focused work or academic experience
Required Skills
In depth knowledge of Linux and/or Windows operating system and VMware hypervisor
Familiarity with one or more systems/application/network management and performance tools (Splunk, CA Suite, New Relic, Dynatrace, TeamQuest, Prometheus, Opnet/Riverbed, NetScout and Wireshark)
Deep understanding of system capacity and availability concepts
Knowledge of the project and application development lifecycles as they pertain to resource capacity requirements
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Strong problem determination skills
Definite Plus Skills
In depth knowledge of container technology, OpenStack, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Pivotal Cloud Foundry
Understanding of Java Virtual Machine internals and performance concepts (heap and thread analysis and tools)
In depth knowledge of Windows Server operating system
Familiarity with AWS, Azure and other public and private cloud services
Knowledge of one or more database and middleware technologies (JBoss, WAS, DB2/UDB, Oracle, SQL Server. MongoDB, HADOOP)
Familiarity with one or more programming, scripting or configuration management languages (Puppet, Ansible, Python, PowerShell, .NET languages, etc)
Vendor training and/or certifications
Network analysis skills including packet capture concepts

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
Position Title: Application Development Sr Manager – Intelligent Automation Technical Leader
Excited to grow your career?
We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
Our people make all the difference in our success.
Help us architect our future. Be a leader. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Love being on the edge of technology, exploring, innovating, working through problems, meeting with technologies leaders across the industry and customers, building processes and technical solutions to deliver stronger business capabilities and results? If so, prepare to innovate, create and inspire. The Office of Intelligent Automation (OIA) at Cigna establishes governance, technology & tools adoption and enforces all Intelligent Automation operational guidelines and processes across Cigna. OIA’s primary focus is to identify and remove automation barriers to help businesses achieve productivity and operational efficiency goals consistently and quickly.
Position Summary
Intelligent Automation Technical Leader will be involved in driving multiple strategic/key initiatives within the organization. These initiatives could be related to exploring new products, POC’s for new products or solutions, enabling new automation products in the field of AI, ML, document processing, process mining, Conversational AI, Hyperautomation, Robotics and more. There will be an operational aspect to this role as well, being responsible for defining and operationalizing the operations model for new products, services and solutions enabled.
We are envisioning this role to be sort of full stack hands on technology leader, who can drive initiatives, be hands on working issues, manage critical issues and coach junior resources within the team.
Product vendors, Business leads, OIA (Office of Intelligent Automation) delivery leads, Platform team, multiple infrastructure teams, other support teams and vendors.

Responsibilities and Essential Functions
Provide technical leadership on the initiatives underway within OIA to evolve AI, ML, IDP, Conversational AI and Robotics capabilities.
Drive initiative related to exploration and POC of new products in the field of intelligent automation.
Drive short and long term resolution of production issues on the solution/code and automation platform.
Organize and participate in various agile ceremonies of the team.
Develop process/models to establish a balance between stability and speed to market to deliver new capabilities into production
Improve the emergency response procedures of production issues
In partnership with OIA technology leadership, develop procedure to expedite POC’s undertaken for new products & solutions being explored
Drive inclusion of nonfunctional requirements into the solutions being designed.
Managing a team accountable for monitoring, health check, issue reporting, issue triage, incident management and reporting for all production robots
Partnering with multiple delivery leads to plan onboarding (go-live) of Automation solutions into production
Actively lead high priority issues impacting production automations and help drive them to resolution working with multiple teams
Manage escalations and ensure proper resolutions
Identify process improvement opportunities and work towards incorporating them into the process model
Educate the vendor resources on Cigna processes and policies as necessary

Intelligent Automation Technical Leader top skills & proficiencies
Experience working on Intelligent automation products like Blue Prism, Pega Robotics, UiPath, IDP, AI, ML and conversational AI (the more the better)
Experienced working with cloud services
Comfortable working in dynamic, high pressure environment to meet target dates for deliverables
Experienced handling highly visible production issues
Technologist at heart, motivated to explore areas never worked in before.
Comfortable establishing new processes and implement them within and onshore – offshore teams
. Technically skilled on IT services for a large organization
Capable of driving alignment across multiple business and IT teams
Comfortable working in an evolving organization and dealing with ambiguity
Enterprise Competencies
Persistence - Demonstrates a strong and persistent drive to achieve meaningful results; drives tasks to successful completion and closure; shows determination in the face of obstacles and setbacks
Continuous Learning - Takes initiative to practice and apply new knowledge and skills, identifying areas of development and seeks ways to expand and continually broaden skills and capabilities while aligning to the goals and values of the organization
Flexibility - Demonstrates flexibility of responses to different situations and adapts to changing needs, conditions, priorities or opportunities
Thinking Outside the Box - Learns and applies innovative methods, tools, and technology and expertise in ways that are unique or innovative; explores multiple alternatives and approaches to overcome obstacles, suggesting creative ideas and innovative solutions
Relentless Focus on Continuous Improvement - Uses technologies to stay on the cutting edge of best practices, tools and processes; relentlessly seeks ways to continuously improve and leverage automation to its full potential
Automation First Mentality – approaches engagements with a focus on automation at all times seeking way to leverage automation first
Organizational Agility – knowledge about how the organization works; knows how to get things done both through formal channels and the informal network; and understand the culture of the organization

Position Qualifications
10+ years of progressive experience working in business and IT organizations combined, including 4+ years of software development managerial experience
Ability to navigate within a matrix organization effectively, as well as manage outsourced/offshore staff (managed services and time & materials)
Excellent analytical skills
Good communication and presentation skills
Ability to build and manage a team of high performing individuals
Demonstrated ability and experience in providing cross-organizational managerial leadership.
Ability to guide, mentor, and grow production operations professionals; and to integrate people and teams
Proven experience influencing senior management, business & technical leaders & software engineers
Demonstrated ability to delegate and empower others
Strong knowledge of industry standards and techniques in both proactive and reactive production operations
Ability to influence technical discussions and decisions
Strong work ethic and sense of urgency
Experience with fast-paced start-up software development environments
Experience with hiring and staffing
A BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related degree preferred

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $132,800 - $221,400, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

As a member of the D&AE Technology Product Management Team, the Technical Product Owner, Senior Manager is responsible for managing and championing product development and management of the Policy & Governance API for Evernorth’s Interoperability Network. The product owner will lead a small product team and harness a combination of product management, API’s, data privacy & governance, big data, data science and analysis skills to closely collaborate across engineering and respective business functions to define feature sets, aid in the design of solutions and build, deploy and drive adoption the Policy & Governance API.
The Technology Product Owner (TPO) is focused on the technical components of the product and delivery strategy and acts as a conduit between the Agile Team(s), the data governance organization and the interoperability product management org. The TPO partners closely with the internal customers, other product orgs, architects, the engineering team and delivery leads to ensure that the technical product roadmap and overall delivery strategy is in alignment with the business strategy roadmap as defined by internal and external customer need.

The TPO is also responsible for defining and decomposing portfolio and program epics into features that are fully documented, prioritized, and “ready” for the engineering team to plan, execute on, and deliver. Additionally, the TPO plays a critical role in testing new functionality, accepting work as complete, coordinating demos, and publishing release notes in preparation for production deployment.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead a small team of talented technical product owners

Author documents relating to product life cycle including product roadmap, business requirements and functional specifications.

Own delivery and release strategy including managing the technology product roadmap, continually refine the feature and user story backlog, identify technical dependencies, and manage acceptance/feedback strategy

Write, prioritize, sequence, test, and accept features, user stories, and defects

Exhibit excellent judgment on how to prioritize between focusing on features, architectural improvements, and operational excellence

Organize sprint demos, ensuring that the team is prepared with content to demo

Write and distribute release notes for each production deployment

Partner with interop product and engineering team to manage both customer and production support

Communicate progress to relevant stakeholders (including internal Cigna/Evernorth stakeholders)

Background and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (computer science, engineering, or information technology)

Experience with data governance, privacy, and policy management, required

Experience building use cases based on expected value and estimate costs is required

Flexibility to change course based on business needs is required

Strategic thinking is required; must be able to track to goals and deadlines in the context of the big picture

Excellent verbal and written communication skills is required; individual must be polished and professional and have experience interacting with senior leadership. Must demonstrate a high “EQ” (emotional intelligence) in all situations.

Experience in healthcare environment and healthcare consent, preferred

Experience driving agile and/or lean product development with demonstrated record of delivering solutions to internal stakeholders and/or external market segments, ideally in a Product Owner, Product Manager, or Release Train Engineer role, is preferred

Strong business acumen is preferred

Experience with Rally or Jira for documenting project requirements is preferred

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 119,600 - 199,300 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
The Senior Solution Architect leads multiple project deployment designs to guide project solutions and supports other Solution Architects and Infrastructure Analysts with enterprise infrastructure solutions. The senior architect is the lead in developing well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous project deployment designs issues and establishes the approach and direction for multiple significant projects. Acts as a resource for direction, mentoring and guidance for less experienced IT staff. Effectively communicates to individuals at all levels of the technical and business communities. Is able to operate as a contributing member of the Solution Architecture community, including the ability to use, share, contribute and influence the appropriate artifacts, approach and best-practices used to create enterprise-scale technical solutions. Monitors project schedules and costs. Contribute to Service Level Agreement creation and adherence. Typically requires 8-10 years of experience.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in the development of infrastructure solutions intended for enterprise use with a ‘cloud first’ mentality
Participate in Global Intake Planning and Delivery Model to create or guide infrastructure solutions for specific value streams.
Create deployment designs and/or provide leadership and oversight on projects to less experienced staff for deployment designs to guide project solutions.
Develop and foster strong relationships with Application solution areas
Produce a standard set of artifacts with sufficient implementation details so that the blueprint and/or topology becomes an integral part of “as built” documentation to guide production readiness, production operation, and disaster recovery.
Serve as an active member of the Cigna Solution Review Board and Technical Assessment and Alignment Committee, ensuring architectures and design align with IT standards, maximizes technology reuse and supports technology strategy directions.
Refine or oversee project deployment designs with input from build engineers, service owners and enterprise architects to ensure strategic technology alignment.
Refine the project based infrastructure design with input from build engineers, service owners and solution architects to ensure application solution alignment.
Complete the deployment design for project solutions with implementation details so that it becomes an integral part of “as built’ documentation to guide production readiness, production operation and disaster recovery.
Ensure architectural adherence throughout the design and deployment process.
Ensure project solutions meet all non-functional requirements
Ensure project solutions can meet business service level agreement objectives
Communicates with and engages appropriate IT organizations to ensure strategic technology alignment and application solution alignment.
Adopt and communicate new concepts, ideas, techniques, best practices and technology assistance
Work with vendors, Enterprise Architecture and product management areas to establish required infrastructures and frameworks, supporting product evaluations, and proof of concepts as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
B.S. in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
In depth knowledge and experience with cloud computing, specifically with AWS and Azure offerings
Familiarity with Agile delivery methodology.
Familiarity with ITIL framework and CMDB.
Familiarity with automation robotic process automation toolsets such as Pega and Blue Prism.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
Hands-on delivery experience as a designer, engineer or developer
Deep knowledge in two or three technology discipline areas (Operating Systems, Databases, Systems Management, Network, Information Security, Storage and Backup, Internet Technologies, Private/Public Cloud, Virtualization, Directory Services, Application Servers, Hardware, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and decision making skills
Strong leadership and influencing / negotiation skills
Strong interpersonal / relationship management skills

OTHER VALUED SKILLS
Experience using tools like System Architect, Sparx, or CMDB tools to describe, capture and/or learn infrastructure architecture for enhancing ITO services and integration solutions and driving better infrastructure architecture alignment with infrastructure standards and reference models.
Application development experience including web development, data base processing, and various middleware technologies

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:

We invite you to join the small business team where you can build, innovate, and secure your career.
Sentar is seeking Network Engineers in Tampa, FL. Hybrid work is available.
Role Description:
Network Engineers perform tier-three network support in accordance with the SIE OPORD. Network Engineers must be detail-oriented and have in-depth knowledge of networking hardware and software. Extensive experience in areas such as network design and implementation, LAN/WAN interfacing, security, Internet protocols, and TCP/IP, as well as server and network infrastructure, is required. This position tests and analyzes elements of network facilities, including power, software, security features, communications devices, In-Line encryption (INE) communications lines, modems, and terminals, and is responsible for the overall integration of the enterprise network. Network Engineers is also responsible for planning, modeling, simulation, design, installation, maintenance, management, and coordination of the network. This position monitors and controls the performance and status of network resources by using software and hardware tools, as well as by identifying and diagnosing complex problems and factors affecting network performance. Network Engineers keep his or her technical skills updated and study vendor products to determine those which best meet the Government’s needs. This position provides guidance and direction for junior network support technicians.

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
The CRD/UM Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Director will be part of a growing and dynamic team where we expect large growth within our growing CIGNA and EVERNORTH footprint. The CRD/UM Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Director is an experienced technical leader with exceptional subject matter expertise in elements of resiliency such as system availability, latency, performance, monitoring, and modernization. The ideal candidate will be a thought leader in these elements, providing executive leadership with technical guidance and recommendations to engineer for the future wellness of Evernorth technology, as well as Ability to digest architecture and critically analyze for failure modes and effects. The individual will drive a culture of resiliency, Driving decisions and cost optionality in partnership with the business and adoption that not only creates stability, but through automation manifest systems which can recover on their own, with limited to no human interaction, and build in monitoring and observability that can predict and prevent outages and operational impacts. The leader will work closely with architecture, cyber security, infrastructure, technical product & planning, and software engineering teams to drive the culture of resiliency into our people, processes, and technology. Ideal candidate will understand that the culture shift will require change management practices and will partner with change manage practitioners to drive this change. This role will also require a leader who is a proven mentor and coach, able to guide and support the learning and development of resiliency engineering for our employees at all stages of their career journeys. The scope of the role is aligned to Evernorth technology’s strategic focus on Reliability & Resiliency as we embrace being trusted operators of our systems
Reliability Champion and Sr. Leader Sponsor for Evernorth Technology’s goals for improving Resiliency of our systems
Responsible to use extensive subject matter expertise and network to support critical production incidents and to represent Technology at applicable enterprise daily incident reviews and raising awareness and required actions to other leaders. Additionally, proactively identify products or applications that may need additional attention or investment and mobilize the appropriate team(s) for action in partnership with the program office.
Responsible for identifying trends and corrective actions to reduce major incidents “M1/M2” for critical applications at or better than the overall technology goals
Deep dives into Release quality metrics (‘Accelerate Metrics’, e.g. Lead Time for Change, Deployment Frequency, Change Success Rate, and Time to Restore) to baseline current results, identify areas of improvement, and drive for improvement plans.
Resiliency engineering champion for Evernorth technology partnering with other Resiliency champions across the enterprise to embed a culture of resiliency engineering into our teams; Accountable for outlining resiliency engineering goals (12, 18, and 36 month success metrics) and driving the processes, best practices, training plans, and product level change management plans in conjunction with principal engineers, product and software engineering leaders. This champion holds the responsibility for the big picture and:
Determining how our systems relate to one another and how they can be redesigned to better handle outages and be resilient through
Uses a breadth of tools and approaches to solve a broad spectrum of problems that results from software and hardware failures
Proactively identifies areas requiring resiliency improvements, including risk quantification and dollar valuation of risk/reward
Proactively identifies and prevents potential outages through detailed review of system logs, metrics and monitoring
Strong participation in issue resolution & postmortem calls and ensure action plans are in place and helps drive resolution of those items working with product and engineering teams
Responsible for collaborating across architecture, cyber security, infrastructure, technical product & planning, and software engineering team partners to create a prioritized product health roadmap that is looking out at least 24 months. This will increase our ability to proactively plan. Further responsible for tracking progress, risks, and working across all partner teams to mitigate impacts. (add consistency w partners from above)
Accountable leader in our drive to simplify our environment through the retirement of redundant assets or processes and retire legacy assets or processes; work across technology teams to identify opportunities and track progress on a quarterly basis. Set and sponsor a technology team goal for 2023 and beyond.
Identification of opportunities and the development of a prioritized backlog of those opportunities, with business cases, to be submitted to the Evernorth Technology Wellness Program and other portfolio initiatives on a rolling basis. The business cases must align with the requirements from the Program, but also articulate overall value to the technology organization, as well as reporting on the pull through of that value.
Coach and mentor leaders, managers, and individual contributors across Evernorth Technology, seeking to increase resiliency engineering expertise. Qualifications
10ears of experience in software development or engineering, or 5 years with an advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering.
Experience architecting, designing, and developing systems.
Experience in technical leadership and setting technical direction for engineering projects.
Experience in an IT operating and/or support role
Understanding of enterprise workloads.
Ability to create a compelling vision for the future, communicate clearly, and have a collaborative leadership approach.
Understands end to end business transactions or customer journey
Ability to be entrepreneurial and strategic.
Embrace automation and seek to automate when feasible, familiar with automation concepts and methods
Risk management & safety science background a plus

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: DevSecOps Engineer
Job_Description:
** please note, this position is specific to Connecticut based applicants.

Business Summary

Provides engineering leadership and oversight on design, engineering and development of information technology solutions. Responsible for the most complex, multi-site, multi domain activities and integration. Manages the troubleshooting and resolution of infrastructure compatibility issues based on system architecture, project requirements, and customer expectations. Partners with IT leadership on engineering related issues and strategies. May manage infrastructure engineers on a project basis. Bachelor degree in Computer Science or a related discipline and at least six, typically eight or more years of experience in all phases of infrastructure network management or its equivalent in education and work experience.

Position Summary

Senior Linux Engineer within a global Cigna IT organization responsible for engineering design, implementation, automation, tuning, and troubleshooting for a large multi-location Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment. The position will focus on automation, engineering and support of Red Hat products, Active Directory integration, and specialized support of Cigna's Oracle RAC infrastructure.

Responsibilities and Essential Functions

Demonstrate engineering excellence in the design, systems management, patching, deployment, troubleshooting, and performance tuning for Linux based operating systems. Recommend and implement process improvements and automation to maximize system availability and consistency. Automate patching and deployments using the latest technologies. Effectively mesh various infrastructure components, such as servers, storage, networks, etc. to a service or application. Set strategic direction and manage implementation. Provide accurate project estimates, while meeting project deadlines. Provide timely, creative and alternative solutions to meet business needs. Provide off-hours support as needed.

Enterprise Competencies
Customer Focus – is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; acts with customers in mind; and establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect
Strategic Agility – Is able to come up with the next great breakthrough thing to do; is creative, a visionary, and can manage innovation; is an effective strategist full of ideas and possibilities; sees multiple futures; has broad interests and knowledge; can both create and bring exciting ideas to market; comfortable speculating about alternative futures without all of the data
Dealing with Ambiguity – can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can handle risk and uncertainty; and can decide and act without having the total picture
Learning and Applying Quickly – learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; and quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything
Priority Setting – quickly zeroes in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; and create focus / eliminates roadblocks
Problem Solving – looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers; is excellent at honest analysis; and uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions

Education

Bachelor’s degree in a computer related field, or equivalent, with 6+ years of relevant IT work experience.

Position Qualifications
Ideal candidate will be self-motivated with strong leadership skills. Candidate should have the following skills:
Proficient Linux administration skills in support of Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Thorough working knowledge of VMWare. Automation development skills. Experience supporting Hadoop, Red Hat Identity Management/Active Directory, Satellite, and Oracle RAC. Experience using Ansible and Ansible Tower is preferable. Good understanding of networking and security concepts (switches, routers, firewall, etc). Excellent leadership and communication skills. Ability to lead simultaneous projects and prioritize effectively.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Director, IT Application Development - Remote

Paradigm is an accountable specialty care management organization focused on improving the lives of people with complex and catastrophic injuries and diagnoses. Job Summary:
The Director of Application Development is responsible for all facets of enterprise application development including customer management, project management, application architecture, business and systems analysis, testing and software engineering for the Paradigm’s applications and data.

He/she is expected to participate with Sr. Management team meetings making appropriate recommendations for improvements and/or additions that enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the information technology services and operations to support the mission of Paradigm. The Director of Application Development works closely with business partners and serves as a strategic liaison to the IT department. He/she is also responsible for maintenance and level 2 production support of custom-developed applications.


Assist in the creation, and drive the execution, of the Information Technology Strategy Plan that will leverage information and technology to deliver products and services in an effective and efficient manner unique to the market that supports the company’s growth and expansion. In conjunction with the CIO, create collaboratively with the Operations management business case(s) for proposed new IT initiatives that improve the Company’s operating capabilities.

IT Senior Management
Application Architecture
Application Development
Management

For us, achieving this goal requires a workforce that respectfully embraces differences and commits to positive change, creating an environment where everyone is able to bring their whole self to work.

Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
KEY OBJECTIVE – Forensic/Performance Troubleshooting – On Premise and Cloud Infrastructure and Applications
Functions as an EOCC Forensics/Performance Team member and subject matter expert utilizing academic and/or practical systems and/or application level performance skills for analysis, troubleshooting and monitoring of key IT components.
Functions as an investigator for systems and application outages, issues, resolution and testing.
Adheres to the concept of “Site Reliability Engineering” (SRE). A site reliability engineer will spend up to 50% of their time doing operations related work such as handling issues, spending time on-call, and manual intervention. Since the software system that an SRE oversees is expected to be highly automatic and self-healing, the SRE should spend the other 50% of their time on development tasks such as adding new features, such as for scaling or automation. A site reliability engineer is usually either a software engineer with a good administration background or a skilled system administrator with knowledge of coding and automation.In general, an SRE team is responsible for availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, emergency response, and capacity planning.
Will function as a technical subject matter expert in one or more areas of computer forensics investigation. Examples – Cloud computing, infrastructure, operating systems, applications, databases, network.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Proactive
Solicit and provide technical direction into constant improvement in the performance monitoring and analysis process to improve availability and reduce future mean time between failures.
Understand the technical design, current and proposed usage of infrastructure and IT services, as well as the maximum capacity and target performance of each component.
Utilize best practices of tooling, metrics, correlation, anomaly detection, methodologies, and education. Utilize expertise in these areas from industry, training, academia, and in-house conceptual testing.
Provide performance related feedback to Capacity Planners, application and product owners, platform and command center operations teams .
Reactive
Work with EOCC Incident and Problem Management, application owners, and support towers to lead or assist in resolving any performance or capacity related incidents or severe system/application problems.
Preventative
Support application Performance Volume Stress/Resiliency (PVSR) testing with the level of engagement varying by project scope, criticality or when performance problems are encountered during testing.
Service Level
Analyze performance information to establish/update performance baselines and projections.
Report on service and component performance against the targets.
Mentoring
Provide training and mentoring to other team members and to the IT community on systems and application performance topics in order to create and build better performance troubleshooting skills at various technical tiers and computing disciplines.
Additional
Attendance at continual technical training courses and conferences is required.
24x7 support may occasionally be required.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, OR a high level of comparable and focused work or academic experience
Required Skills
In depth knowledge of Linux and/or Windows operating system and VMware hypervisor
Familiarity with one or more systems/application/network management and performance tools (Splunk, CA Suite, New Relic, Dynatrace, TeamQuest, Prometheus, Opnet/Riverbed, NetScout and Wireshark)
Deep understanding of system capacity and availability concepts
Knowledge of the project and application development lifecycles as they pertain to resource capacity requirements
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Strong problem determination skills
Definite Plus Skills
In depth knowledge of container technology, OpenStack, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Pivotal Cloud Foundry
Understanding of Java Virtual Machine internals and performance concepts (heap and thread analysis and tools)
In depth knowledge of Windows Server operating system
Familiarity with AWS, Azure and other public and private cloud services
Knowledge of one or more database and middleware technologies (JBoss, WAS, DB2/UDB, Oracle, SQL Server. MongoDB, HADOOP)

Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
A Platform Engineer (Cloud Engineering Senior Advisor) will support the establishment of the Destination State Architecture that is comprised of several Platform Services: Application Management, Developer Experience, Data and Identity Management. The key goal of the Destination State Architecture is to provide a high-quality low-friction experience for delivery teams within the enterprise. Additionally, the Digital Platform Engineer must participate and/or lead technical communities and continually push for thoughtful evolution of technology and/or software engineering best practices. Lastly, the individual is expected to collaborate with peers across the organization to contribute to the technical direction and/or strategy.

Key Job Responsibilities
Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary engineers to help standardize the adoption of Destination State patterns and practices to enable and empower teams to develop and operate solutions that embrace experimentation, scale participation, simplify complexity and increase speed to market
Build, maintain and continuously improve the platforms and services including infrastructure, automation, platform integrations and CI/CD tooling used by engineers, operations, and applications making it easier to develop, build, deploy and operate software across the enterprise.
Design and build innovative tools and services in a large distributed environment and help lead changes across the company.
Design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems
Work in an agile environment and deliver high quality software

Qualifications
AWS Cloud skills highly desired
Kubernetes skills highly desired
Experience in using development languages such as Python, Java, Go, Shell or other languages to build reusable tools
Experience with GitOps
Experience automating software deployments and following a continuous delivery and deployment (CI/CD) model
Deep knowledge in adjacent areas of engineering to influence peer group
Able to lead and contribute expertise to activities associated with defining engineering requirements, determining technical feasibility, forecasting (time, cost, complexity), and best practices to avoid pitfalls and mistakes
Able to drive deployment design in support of logical solution architecture
Able to conceptualize solution ideas
Able to lead development of design patterns
Able to play a tech lead role for major engineering initiatives
Able to rationalize technical recommendation for directional decisions
Ability to speak in non-technical terms and explain technical concepts in crisp, clear, and plain terms
Proven ability to design systems integration approaches, new software applications, interfaces, and services as well as enhancements to existing components comprising an overall IT solution. Broad, applied experience with common computing platforms, legacy and modern development tools and languages, database management systems, and enterprise application integration (middleware) technologies
Results-oriented and diligent with a sense of urgency
Assertive and self-directed
Ability to navigate a highly-matrixed organization effectively.

Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
The Senior Solution Architect leads multiple project deployment designs to guide project solutions and supports other Solution Architects and Infrastructure Analysts with enterprise infrastructure solutions. The senior architect is the lead in developing well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous project deployment designs issues and establishes the approach and direction for multiple significant projects. Acts as a resource for direction, mentoring and guidance for less experienced IT staff. Effectively communicates to individuals at all levels of the technical and business communities. Is able to operate as a contributing member of the Solution Architecture community, including the ability to use, share, contribute and influence the appropriate artifacts, approach and best-practices used to create enterprise-scale technical solutions. Monitors project schedules and costs. Contribute to Service Level Agreement creation and adherence. Typically requires 8-10 years of experience.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in the development of infrastructure solutions intended for enterprise use with a ‘cloud first’ mentality
Participate in Global Intake Planning and Delivery Model to create or guide infrastructure solutions for specific value streams.
Create deployment designs and/or provide leadership and oversight on projects to less experienced staff for deployment designs to guide project solutions.
Develop and foster strong relationships with Application solution areas
Produce a standard set of artifacts with sufficient implementation details so that the blueprint and/or topology becomes an integral part of “as built” documentation to guide production readiness, production operation, and disaster recovery.
Serve as an active member of the Cigna Solution Review Board and Technical Assessment and Alignment Committee, ensuring architectures and design align with IT standards, maximizes technology reuse and supports technology strategy directions.
Refine or oversee project deployment designs with input from build engineers, service owners and enterprise architects to ensure strategic technology alignment.
Refine the project based infrastructure design with input from build engineers, service owners and solution architects to ensure application solution alignment.
Complete the deployment design for project solutions with implementation details so that it becomes an integral part of “as built’ documentation to guide production readiness, production operation and disaster recovery.
Ensure architectural adherence throughout the design and deployment process.
Ensure project solutions meet all non-functional requirements
Ensure project solutions can meet business service level agreement objectives
Communicates with and engages appropriate IT organizations to ensure strategic technology alignment and application solution alignment.
Adopt and communicate new concepts, ideas, techniques, best practices and technology assistance
Work with vendors, Enterprise Architecture and product management areas to establish required infrastructures and frameworks, supporting product evaluations, and proof of concepts as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
B.S. in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
In depth knowledge and experience with cloud computing, specifically with AWS and Azure offerings
Familiarity with Agile delivery methodology.
Familiarity with ITIL framework and CMDB.
Familiarity with automation robotic process automation toolsets such as Pega and Blue Prism.
Broad Infrastructure and/or application architecture background
Hands-on delivery experience as a designer, engineer or developer
Deep knowledge in two or three technology discipline areas (Operating Systems, Databases, Systems Management, Network, Information Security, Storage and Backup, Internet Technologies, Private/Public Cloud, Virtualization, Directory Services, Application Servers, Hardware, etc.)
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Strong problem solving and decision making skills
Strong leadership and influencing / negotiation skills
Strong interpersonal / relationship management skills

OTHER VALUED SKILLS
Experience using tools like System Architect, Sparx, or CMDB tools to describe, capture and/or learn infrastructure architecture for enhancing ITO services and integration solutions and driving better infrastructure architecture alignment with infrastructure standards and reference models.
Application development experience including web development, data base processing, and various middleware technologies

Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
