Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Java Services Engineer (internal title: Software Engineering Sr. Advisor) uses in-depth knowledge and experience to maintain and enhance a Spring driven, cloud based API. Creates detailed specifications, implement maintenance and enhancements, conduct quality assurance reviews of peer's application programming, and act as a resource for team members with less experience. Provides counsel and advice to top management on significant Application Development matters, often requiring coordination between organizations. Acts as the designer for complex major systems and their subsystems utilizing a thorough understanding of available technology, tools and existing designs. Provides comprehensive consultation to business unit and IT management and staff at the technical level on all phases of application programming and processes for diverse development platforms, computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server, software, hardware, technologies and tools, etc.). Works closely with client and IT management and staff to identify application development solutions, new or modified programs, reuse of existing code through the use of program development software alternatives, or integration of purchased solutions or a combination of the available alternatives.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Responsible for the delivery of a business need end-to-end starting from understanding the requirements to deploying the software into production. This role requires you to be fluent in some of the critical technologies with proficiency in others and have a hunger to learn on the job and add value to the business. Critical attributes of being a full-stack engineer among others is Ownership & Accountability.

In addition to Delivery, the advisor should have an automation first and continuous improvement mindset. He/she should drive the adoption of CI/CD tools and support the improvement of the tools sets/processes.

The candidate will need to have expertise in software engineering as well as data analysis. This person needs to understand the interrelationships between systems, and be able to write working software that will successfully integrate and interface these systems. From a system and design perspective this person will need to understand how different pieces work together and use library calls, REST APIs, database queries, etc.) In order to communicate with them. The candidate will play a technical role in an enterprise area responsible for driving innovative analytical methods to better align IT analytics with CIGNA’s short term and long-term goals, adding value by adopting software engineering best practices. The candidate must possess excellent analytical and technical skills coupled with the ability to quickly learn new technologies. The individual will be hands on with architecture and design to support various Cigna organizations.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.

12+ years of experience in IT delivery

5+ years of experience in software development of enterprise Java web applications or API, preferably using Spring.

5+ years' experience being past of Agile teams and working in Agile methodology

Spring, SpringBoot, GIT, Maven, Jenkins, Splunk.

Experience with SQL and ability to check data

Experience working with databases like DB2, Oracle, MongoDB (desirable)

Experience working with Kafka, Attunity and MQ technologies is desirable

Thorough understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field.

Ability to provide and implement technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.

Experience creating solutions that are innovative, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.

Strong customer service focus.

Ability to lead discussions with all levels of the organization and provide balanced information of an idea or communication of an issue regardless of written or verbal.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry and a passion for driving positive patient outcomes

Familiar with working in a vendor partner model.

Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Strong mentoring skills.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Adaptability and willingness to lean new tools and applications.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across project teams.

Ability to learn new technology and technical products to increase technical skills and expertise.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

Do you have a passion for programming and find yourself asking “I wonder if I could do it this way…”? Our software engineering teams start with strategy and then create, test and deploy our client and patient applications. The result? Innovative, high-performing, scalable user-facing solutions relied on by millions every day. We work in an Agile environment, partnering with teams across the organization to craft exceptional applications – with the ultimate goal of improving health outcomes for the 100 million people we serve.

ABOUT CIGNA

At Cigna, we dare to imagine a better health care system, and we’re driven to make it happen. Where some see obstacles, we see possibilities. We’re challengers, difference-makers and opportunity-seekers, united with our partners in pursuit of a simpler, more sustainable system and better health for all.

We have always acted first to take on the toughest challenges. We uniquely partner across the health care ecosystem to uncover opportunities, take action, advance health care and deliver better outcomes – like no one else can. We believe health care can do more. We are Champions For Better. Express Scripts, part of Cigna Corporation, unlocks new value in pharmacy, medical and beyond to further total health for all.

Title: Infrastructure Engineering Advisor- Work from home
Job_Description:
Ux Engineer
We are looking for developers who really enjoy writing code to help us design and build large-scale applications. The position requires hands-on development of service-based scalable applications. Our team is extremely collaborative. Interested candidates must love to write code, be self-motivated, willing to learn, and willing to share new ideas to improve our team and processes.
Candidates will need to have experience with medium-to-large-scale web development. Ability to develop within "full" technology stack (back,middle,front end).
Be part of a fast moving team, working with the latest tools and open source technologies Design and develop our next generation of RESTful APIs and Event driven services in a distributed environment Use advanced, distributed technologies to process, store, and quickly retrieve huge volumes of data Work on a development team using agile methodologies

General Qualifications / Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline strongly preferred, diverse work experience in IT with a minimum of five years’ experience designing, developing, deploying, and supporting computing applications in a large-scale, complex environment.
Strong communication skills geared towards effective communication of concepts, design rationale and findings to the organization.
Track record of consistently driving projects to completion and taking accountability for work and results. Confronts tough issues and situations.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Ability to perform detailed analysis of business problems and technical environments.
Ability to think strategically and implement iteratively. Ability to estimate financial impact of design/architecture alternatives.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
United States - Work From Home

First things first, we’re a global health service company dedicated to helping people improve their health, well-being and sense of security. But we don’t just care about your well-being, we care about your career health too. That’s why when you work with us, you can count on a different kind of career – you’ll make a difference, learn a ton, and share in changing the way people think about healthcare.

Now on to the good stuff… what you’ll do:
Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineers uses specialized depth and experience to develop and modify complex software application programs supporting Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence initiatives. This position will be responsible for advocating, educating and partnering with teams across the enterprise to develop best practices around the preferred technology stacks, as well as implementing Machine Learning applications and proof of concepts (POC). As a member of the newly formed Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineering team, This position will also create detailed specifications, conduct quality assurance reviews of peer's application programming.

Create Machine Learning Solutions to achieve organizational objectives

Consult to product development team’s best practices related to Machine Learning application development and Machine Learning/AI-specific infrastructure technology stacks (e.g. GPU-based systems, A.I. in public cloud, etc).

Apply best practice software engineering principles towards the development of applications, in order to productionalize Machine Learning models produced by Data Scientists and ML Engineers

Leverage Big Data and Data Science tools (i.e. one or more of SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Python, R) to both source and work with data

Ensure quality of technology delivery of multiple vendors’ technology solutions for multiple concurrent projects or programs for an application family.

Deliver solutions for multiple concurrent projects

Identify and implement process enhancement opportunities associated with supporting the application area.

Implement actions to increase ESI and vendor partner knowledge on team.

Serve as SME for components of the team.

Provide technical guidance to projects/programs for complex components of a multiple technology suites.

Develop standard practices, components, guidelines for use of complex technology components.

Resolve urgent and high production incidents.

Determine root cause of problems and drive resolution.

Work on other projects as assigned.


Bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of relevant experience or a Master’s degree in a relevant field or the equivalence of education and experience

Good understanding of relational and nosql database concepts and data processing

data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning)

version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code

Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field.

Ability to provide and implement technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.

Solutions are innovative, thorough, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.

Strong customer service focus.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry.

Familiar with working in a vendor partner model.

Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Adaptability and willingness to lean new tools and applications.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across project team

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
The Data Scientist Advisor will be responsible for supporting the analytics strategy, performing research and analysis. The data scientist will analyze healthcare data to make recommendations based on relevant findings.

The Data Scientist Advisor will interface across multiple business areas, including, but not limited to clinical, pricing, reporting, product development, operations, and marketing departments as needed. The ideal candidate for this role will be highly motivated, flexible, embrace change, as well as develop analytical and statistical models and methodologies to predict, quantify, and/or forecast business metrics.

Responsibilities

Extract and analyze large healthcare claims using SAS, SQL, R, Python, Teradata, Hadoop, etc.

Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in data sets through descriptive and multivariate statistics

Conduct matched case-control studies and/or randomized control trials for determining the effectiveness of health program services and solutions

Develop statistical models and methods (including but not limited to machine learning and other regression techniques) that identify and stratify individuals in terms of health risk and/or behavior change

Create predictive models to identify individuals at high risk for clinically relevant conditions, metrics of utilization, or other outcomes

Develop actionable insights and present results to non-technical business partners and stakeholders to drive the decision-making process

Collaborate with matrix partners to understand project developments, assess impacts to data and analytics

Develop methods for improving internal techniques and processes with expertise in creating highly effective, visual graphics that tell complex stories in formats that can be easily conveyed to leadership and executive clients.

Develop analytical and statistical models and methodologies to classify, quantify, and/or forecast business metrics that help customers make sound business decisions

Work collaboratively and partner with departments across the organization to ensure deliverables are accomplished

Qualifications

3+ years of healthcare-related data/analytics experience solving business problems through the application of analytic approaches

Experience with diverse healthcare data preferred, including claims, EHR, demographic, exercise, pharmacy, lab, biometrics, genomic, and text

Previous experience conducting program evaluation/outcomes research methods, predictive modeling and data mining is required

Experience with statistical software program SAS/SAS EG, R and/or Python is required

propensity score matching, coarsened exact matching, multivariate regression, machine learning, etc.

Comprehension of healthcare data (e.g., ICD-10, claims, utilization, provider information) and demonstrated understanding of health care and delivery system processes

Leadership competencies including the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically, and influence key leaders with a Strong customer focus and management of stakeholder expectations

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
DATA SCIENCE SENIOR ADVISOR – PRICING AND UNDERWRITING

Using your knowledge of statistics, healthcare, and ML / AI you will build models to help identify opportunities for our pricing and underwriting partners. You will perform feature engineering, model development, and model monitoring / maintenance using a broad range of medical, prescription drug, utilization management, and third-party data. In this role you will work closely with leadership, data scientists, business stakeholders and engineering partners to deliver robust well-documented deliverables that will enhance our competitive position in the marketplace.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.

Role Summary:
This person will contribute to the development of comprehensive analytics that facilitate best in class pricing and underwriting. The responsibilities are as follows:

Execute special projects and pioneer 3rd party relationships that can improve Commercial Healthcare underwriting.

Utilize data science and advanced analytics to create actionable insights and recommendations for business leaders to advance Cigna’s strategic objectives.

Regularly communicate work with business stakeholders and senior leadership.

Stay up to date on latest analytic tools and techniques and strategize how to leverage these tools to modernize our pricing/UW organizations.

Ensure solutions drive long term value while also ensuring they can integrate with current processes.

collaborate with business leaders to design, launch and measure robust pilots to test new solutions.

Develop models that foster underwriting and actuarial advancement by aligning business problems to a potential solution like GLMs, Machine Learning, Clustering or other advanced techniques.


Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in Statistics, Biostatistics, Econometrics, Economics, Actuarial Science, or Data Science.

At least 5 years of experience in insurance analytics/data science.

Statistical training in school or through work (ability to formulate and execute appropriate confidence intervals, regression modeling, various machine learning methods, etc.)

Strong technical skills to extract large amount of data through SAS/Teradata/Hadoop/Oracle/SQL and construct easy to use tools and reports using VBA/Tableau/R/Python/GIS (knowledge of or ability to learn Python required).

Ability to build models and manage the model building process (data prep, model build, validation, and implementation).

Previous experience collaborating with others, establish working relationships, and communicating effectively across the organization.

Self-motivated and ability to influence, drive, and improve the above processes

Strong verbal/written communication skills to work with various matrix partners, including but not limited to actuarial, medical economics, contracting, business, marketing, and IT.

Working knowledge of Commercial Markets (Business to Business) - Underwriting and Actuarial preferred

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Join our team as a Senior Data Scientist - Model Governance supporting our Evernorth business in Equity Governance. This is a role on the forefront of the new and highly adapting health equity analytics area. New regulation and policy is being drafted and developed to sign into bill across many federal, state and local regulating bodies. This team is responsible for assisting regulators and internal advisory committees in the assessment and feasibility of such bills. The position also works with internal model development organization to guide them through the adoption of regulation into their organizations to ensure compliance.

Responsibilities:
Manage model governance needs across business partners in the Data Science CoE, GD&A.
Review and provide thought leadership on model design, assumptions and performance as they relate to disparate metrics identified in our model governance framework.
Work cross-functionally to implement the model governance framework, enforce adherence and provide ongoing support for enhancements to the methodology.
Work with business partners to evaluate conceptual and technical soundness of models, including assumptions, performance, weaknesses and limitations. Provide guidance on mitigation actions.
Monitor and manage model governance KPIs of business partners around usage, disparity metrics and performance tracking
Participate in ongoing implementation of the governance procedure and various efforts in model standardization, automation, and inventory management.
Implement periodic model reviews and validation procedure for models in production.
Participate in internal audits and responses to regulatory requests.
Collaborate with Analytics Platform and Data Engineering teams to develop tools suitable for model governance needs.


MS in Quantitative fields such as Mathematics, Decision Science, Operations Research, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Engineering or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of strong technical skills to extract and analyze data with proficiency in SAS, Python, or R.
Deep understanding of statistics, probability theory, applied mathematics, and numerical optimization methods with broad exposure to modern machine learning models.
Strong interpersonal skills and an outstanding ability to build relationships and navigate within a complex organization.
Self-awareness, maturity, ability to collaborate as part of the multi-disciplinary team.
Passionate self-starter to collaborate with senior stakeholders to establish trust & transparency in model life-cycles.


PhD in Quantitative fields such as Mathematics, Decision Science, Operations Research, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or Engineering.
Experience in established institutions requiring setting up regulatory and / or consensus-driven methodology and model validation guidelines.

As a part of Analytics Engineering, this role will directly engage with the Machine Learning COE team to usher in emerging technology solutions for the enterprise.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for machine learning and artificial intelligence? Are you excited about using your skills to bring innovation to healthcare and improve affordability?

Evernorth’s Episode Grouper Center of Expertise (CoE) applies advanced Data Science (DS), Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) to produce solutions that reduce customer health costs and improve outcomes and business processes. Using state of the art AI tools, DS platforms, ML libraries, and optimization tools, we leverage internal, external, online and offline data sources comprising clinical, pharmacy, provider, and behavioral/attitudinal data.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.

Role Summary

The Data Science Senior Manager is a hands-on management role, combining model-building work and team management. They will lead the team’s application of rigorous statistical and methodology know-how to test, innovate and maintain Episode Grouper and Episode Risk models. They will also direct the team’s research, development and testing of new solutions (homegrown, open source and new vendor alternatives). The Senior Manager will also advise and deliver actionable insights that will provide value to the business, propose solutions to Evernorth's Senior Leadership and influence Evernorth's strategic use of these models. They will continue the team’s tradition of delivering solid methodological guidance to other teams on appropriate model use and output consumption. These models are key inputs, and the basis of analytics to assess provider performance, customer risk prediction for condition or program interventions and many other uses.

Key Responsibilities

Manage the statistical analysis and fine tuning of current Episode Grouper and Episode Risk prediction model parameters, inputs and outputs.

Serve as methodological SME on multiple aspects of Evernorth’s Episode Groupers/Risk and adjoining Risk Adjustment applications. Maintain awareness of main use cases and stakeholder teams.

Present findings/recommendations to technical and non-technical leaders to drive Evernorth's Episode Grouper and Risk Adjustment strategy.

Lead the team’s innovation efforts of Machine Learning and Deep Learning alternative models for superior performance in various Episode Grouper and Risk model use cases.

Collaborate with the Data Science COE and other teams on Risk model initiatives.

Qualifications

This position requires demonstrated clinical acumen, experience applying rigorous statistical methodology, as well as knowledge of risk adjustment and/or risk prediction models:

Post-Graduate degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Actuarial or Data Science (Masters or PhD preferred), with significant modelling experience (4+ years preferred) using Python, R or SAS to build Supervised Learning models for predictive purposes.

Proven experience querying (SQL, Hadoop) and applying statistical analysis (Python, R, SAS) to large health claims and clinical data sets as key step prior to modeling. (required)

Prior experience applying Supervised Learning models (Lasso Regression, Classification, other ML and DL) for cost, risk or other outcome predictions (required).

Knowledge of Episode Groupers and Risk Adjustment models (preferred)

Keen eye for methodological and data nuances

Solid verbal communication and consultative skills. Ability to collaborate with technical and non- technical teams/leadership, establish working relationships, and drive business decisions based on sound methodologic points.

3-5 years of Managerial experience (preferred).

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States. Must be able to work EST hours.

Cigna, a leading Health Services company, is looking for exceptional engineers in our Data & Analytics Engineering organization to help deliver meaningful value within the healthcare space. The engineer is responsible for the delivering business needs end-to-end, starting from understanding the requirements to deploying the software into production. This role requires being fluent in some technologies while being proficient in others, while learning on the job to deliver value to both customers and to the business. Necessary attributes of being an engineer are ownership, accountability, and resilience.

In addition to delivery, the engineer should have an automation first and continuous improvement mindset, driving the adoption of CI/CD tools while supporting the improvement of the tool sets/processes.

This agile team partners with the Data & Analytics Engineering organization to help solve integration needs by supplying and consuming information needed for analytics and operations. We use technology to integrate and present meaningful analytical insights into the data to both Healthcare Providers and Internal Cigna business groups and develop applications to optimize affordability for all of Cigna's customers. Our tools analyze historical data to identify insights, forecast trends, and recommend actionable items to improve total medical costs.

You will have the unique opportunity to design, develop, and deploy new applications and features that will directly impact Cigna's bottom line, to ultimately provide better and more affordable healthcare for our customers. Our team uses a variety of technologies, from big data to the latest web frameworks. You will get to build state-of-the-art technology that is scalable and robust, utilizing cloud infrastructure, and full automation.


E ngineers are able to articulate clear business objectives aligned to technical specifications and work in an iterative, agile pattern to deliver value. They have ownership over their work tasks, and embrace interacting with all levels of the team and raise challenges when necessary.
We aim to be cutting-edge full stack engineers, not institutionalized developers.

Skills
Documented experience in a business intelligence or analytic development role on a variety of large scale projects (3 years minimum)
Expertise in Hadoop/spark/AWS and related technologies
Excellent Data analysis skills


A passion for healthcare and the potential for technology to improve people’s lives

The aptitude to deliver enterprise or customer-facing applications in a variety of scenarios

A deep understanding of environmental constraints to implementing and deploying differing application solutions

Proven track record of quality software development and an ability to innovate outside of traditional architecture/software patterns when needed

A desire to collaborate in a high-performing team environment, and an ability to influence and be influenced by others

Experience in helping distilling complex ideas into an architectural and implementation plan, and then proving it out

The ability to critically evaluate the trade-offs and implementation impacts of emerging vs. more established technologies

Skills, Qualifications, and Certifications (not all are required):

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required; a degree in a quantitative discipline: statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, data mining, machine learning, or some other empirical science.

Expertise in BigData and related technologies

Cloud certifications, and/or cloud development experience with developing applications or infrastructure on AWS

Knowledge of Apache Spark, distributed application development on spark using PySpark or Scala, and familiarity with other Hadoop ecosystem such as, Yarn, Hive, Oozie, Impala

Experience with distribute computing, experience with vedor software such as databricks, domino, developing data engineering and analytics models and solutions.

Experience in development using scripting languages such as Python.

Experience in development using object-oriented languages such as Java

Experience or knowledge of functional programming using languages such as Scala, Java-8, or Python

DevOps, CICD development experience is a plus ( Jenkins/Ansible/cloudbees)

Experience in deploying applications using docker and/or kubernetes

Web app development, Ability to rapidly prototype and storyboard/wireframe development as part of application design

Comfortable in configuring and using multiple operating systems (Mac/Windows/*nix)

Design and architecture expertise with AWS, Hadoop, Teradata, BI, and related ecosystem tools.

Knowledge of statistical languages such as SAS, R or Python with SciPy/NumPy

Experience with disciplined software development lifecycle

Ability to communicate at various levels within large organizations

Knowledge of Big Data tool performance/tuning/measurement and usage criteria to drive appropriate tool selections and use

Knowledge and/or experience with Health care information domains a plus.

Documented experience working on advanced Big Data solutions is a plus.

Some expertise in designing business intelligence systems, dashboard reporting, and analytical reporting is also a plus.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Data Science Advisor is a hands-on data role that will be relied on to further advance Cigna and Evernorth's risk adjustment accuracy in the Individual and Family Plans (IFP) market. The advisor will need to use data science to answer business critical risk adjustment questions and provide expert content/professional leadership on complex data science assignments and projects. Our goal is to leverage data science, with the lens of risk adjustment, to drive business decisions that will help make healthcare affordable, predictable, and simple for the members that we serve.

The right candidate will possess a strong degree of innovation, a core healthcare data and analytics skillset, and a proficiency in applying advanced analytic methods to healthcare data. They will also demonstrate a talent for translating between technical and non-technical audiences, as well as a desire to champion a data-driven culture with our business partners.

This role involves leading the design and development of new advanced analytical models utilizing healthcare data and clinical records for each member. This means developing new tools and techniques, using a variety of internal and external data sources, to enable a comprehensive understanding of a member’s clinically relevant information.


How can we use clinically relevant data to create a comprehensive and accurate prediction for what health conditions members may have?

How do we incorporate clinical data and insights (structured and unstructured) into meaningful risk adjustment insights for our business and clinical partners?

What is the potential business impact that can be driven by modeling results?

Which model best addresses the business need at hand?

What else should we as a collective team be looking at to advance our risk adjustment capabilities?

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


Initiate and collaborate with stakeholders across the IFP business to prioritize and define key performance indicators that can be addressed with risk adjustment targeting models

Enhance and create new advanced analytical models that prioritize outreach efforts

Maintain and enhance existing advanced analytical models that predict member’s condition profile

Develop clear and thoughtful materials to communicate results/recommendations to business partners

Work effectively and efficiently on multiple tasks and deadlines, while producing high quality results.

Use data science and advanced analytic methods (machine learning, cluster analysis, predictive modeling) to identify areas of opportunity and inform risk adjustment business strategy


Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, statistics, data science, business, MIS, actuarial science, finance, etc.) preferred

Strong experience with large SQL-based relational databases required

Excellent command of data science libraries in Python strongly preferred

Experience with ACA or MA risk adjustment scoring algorithms and targeting models preferred

3+ years of experience building, deploying, scaling machine learning algorithms in production

Experience working in a cloud based environment (preferably AWS) preferred

Deep healthcare data (e.g., ICD-9/ICD-10, claims, profiling) and demonstrated understanding of health care and delivery system processes preferred

Ability to work with business partners in consultative manner

Ability to independently prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities

Proficiency with syntactic and semantic interoperability of health information exchange using data standards such as SNOMED CT, RxNorm, LOINC, and variations of HL7 (e.g. 2, FHIR, etc.) a plus.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
US Work from Home

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Financial Data Analyst is responsible for the design and development of the financial forecasting and analytics toolkits which enable our Client Guarantee Management team to accurately and efficiently manage client guarantees.

The Senior Data Analyst will oversee both the development and modernization of reporting and analysis tools. In this capacity, the Senior Data Analyst will drive direct improvements to our financial results through enhancements to communication of financial figures, forecasting, and key driver analysis. A major part of this effort will be maintaining active lines of communication with business partners to learn about their needs and help to track and translate them into relevant financial models.

To perform this function, the Senior Data Analyst will be expected to use a modern software toolkit, including Microsoft Excel and Tableau for financial reporting, and Python for data analysis and forecasting. It is expected that additional models and tools will be picked up quickly based on the needs of the project being worked on.

In addition to continued development, the Senior Data Analyst will guide the effort to automate, streamline and document tools, to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the financial reporting process, while also reducing the business risks of misstatements or delays. This will be done using a variety of scheduling tools and version control systems, such as GitHub.

Key to these efforts will be managing a variety of competing priorities and communicating key results to leadership and stakeholders. This will frequently involve simplifying complicated technical topics in simple terms.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Develop and Maintain Financial Reporting Pipeline.

Develop Financial Forecasting and Analysis Modeling.

Modernize tools using Python and Tableau.

Identify opportunities to implement financial best practices and documentation.

Work with business partners to identify future enhancement opportunities.

Analyze historical results to determine ways to enhance forecasting capabilities.

Produce Client Price Change and Revenue Impact reporting.

Provide ad-hoc financial data analysis to business partners.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics).

4+ years relevant experience.

Continual willingness to learn and develop both technical and business skills.

Intermediate understanding of Microsoft Excel and VBA including both their benefits and limitations.

Knowledge of programming and the ability to learn new tools as needed.

Experience using Python.

Strong knowledge of financial reporting, data analysis, and financial forecasting.

Excellent Communication skills, oral and written.

This can be a remote Work from Home position.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

If your niche is in financial reporting and analysis, underwriting, cash management, audit or investor relations, our Finance department may be a perfect fit for you. Our teams within Finance work together to ensure that spending stays on track and that we remain a profitable industry leader. We’re always on the lookout for innovative people who will bring outside-the-box thinking to our team.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
This position is part of the Enterprise DevOps Shared Service team focused on creating service offerings that enable development teams to improve continuous delivery of applications by applying DevOps best practices, processes, and tools across the organization. This position will drive strategic direction, design, and innovation of the Enterprise DevOps products and service offerings. This role reports to the Enterprise DevOps Lead and is part of the broader Cloud Hosting organization supporting Cigna.
As an Architect Director, this role will act as a Chief Engineer examining the current Enterprise DevOps ecosystem to generate and incubate new solutions while solidifying our existing service offerings. This role will be responsible for partnering with Enterprise DevOps and Cloud Hosting leadership to form, drive, and execute the strategy, roadmap, and architecture for the destination state of the Enterprise DevOps organization. This role will define, build, guide, and oversee architectures that lead the technical direction of DevOps across the enterprise. The candidate will have Human Resources and mentoring responsibility for a small team of architects within the broader DevOps organization.


Evaluate the current Enterprise DevOps ecosystem to determine the core products and service offerings to deliver best in class CI/CD pipeline capabilities
Partner with Enterprise DevOps leadership and engineering to develop and implement a robust and achievable architectural roadmap for all DevOps ecosystem products and service offerings.
Architect for business value outcomes by developing architecture blueprints and patterns and implementing architectures that align with best-in-class design and software engineering principles.
Develop and promote engineering best practices, guidelines, and tools for the Enterprise development communities.
Create holistic roadmaps for Source Code Management & Version Control, CICD Orchestration, Artifact repositories, configuration Management, Pipelines and Scanning
Work with business, solution, and integration architects across technology groups to ensure the architecture strategies align with the demands of the business.
Identify and lead technical research and analysis and make recommendations on potential approaches to achieve business and IT capabilities.
Act as a thought leader and mentor to the Enterprise DevOps engineering team to promote organic growth and recruit new talent
Be vigilant in staying current on industry data and analytics trends and emerging technologies.
Ability to create a strong partnership with Enterprise Architecture to ensure solutions support destination state architectures for the Enterprise


Bachelor’s Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline strongly preferred
Extensive experience in a software engineering or architecture environment
Extensive years of architecture experience, including web, and other digital or distributed platforms
Advanced analytical skills, judgement and expertise to create solutions to the most complex problems focusing on the business requirements
Strong technical leader who can roll-up their sleeves when necessary
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Able to understand, document, and describe complex technical subjects
Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to take principled bets on new technologies
Ability to “think big” and challenge conventional wisdom regarding technology refresh and hype
Ability to establish, implement, and enforce appropriate architectural standards to meet business requirements
Experienced with developing reusable assets such as prototypes, POCs, and MVPs that contribute to organizational effectiveness and efficiency


Comprehensive knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, tools, and processes
Able to coach and mentor colleagues on architectural frameworks, patterns & best practices
Deep knowledge of service-oriented and event-driven architectures
Hands-on experience in cloud engineering and cloud-native design
Extensive understanding of DevOps best practices and introducing continuous automation into the application lifecycle (CI/CD pipeline)
Well-versed in API development and management
Experienced in container and container management
Experienced with industry standard programming languages, operating systems, application development frameworks, monitoring tools, and CI/CT/CD tools
Deep understanding of non-functional requirements and their importance to solution design
Skilled at aligning technology capabilities to business capabilities


Strategic Mindset – Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies
Mentoring Talent – Developing engineers to grow their skill set and align to the organization’s goals
Cultivates Innovation – Creating new and better ways for the organization to be successful
Drives Results – Pushes team and cross functional partners to deliver needed results in tough circumstances and expedited timelines
Manages Complexity – Makes sense of complex and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems
Manages Ambiguity – Operates effectively and drives work forward even when things are not certain or there is no clear way forward
Instills Trust – Quickly gains confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for evaluating and improving processes around continuous integration, automation and cost management. The DevOps Engineer will work with the cAi DevOps team to design and manage these automation systems, including software deployment, release management, product development life cycles and system cost controls. The DevOps Engineer will support Software Engineers, QA, Product Management, and Support teams as well as work closely with Enterprise Architecture and Software Engineering leadership teams.

Develop and advance our capabilities in Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment
Build, operate, scale, and troubleshoot the cAI infrastructure

Enhance our monitoring tools, build infrastructure and source code management
In collaboration with other teams, make sure our infrastructure and applications that depend on it work together seamlessly
Support other teams’ build and infrastructure needs on an as-needed basis
Write tools for systems and infrastructure automation
Mentor cAI development, infrastructure and support staff as needed

5+ years’ experience with Windows and Linux
Experience with Cyara and Other Test automation tool, like, JMeter, Cucumber, Selenium
Strong experience with Cloud Technologies (AWS, Open Shift, PCF) ; experience migrating to the Cloud is strongly preferred
Experience in scripting or programming languages (Ruby, Perl, Python, Shell, PowerShell, etc.)
Experience with Configuration Management platforms (Chef, Ansible, Puppet, etc.)
Experience with monitoring tools like (Site24/7, ELK, SPLUNK, Application monitoring, etc.)
Expert level understanding and implementation of Ruby and RESTful API
Experience with VSTS, Git, Pipelines, Releases
Strong understanding of container technology
Solid understanding of networking and security best practices

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
Infrastructure & Automation - DevOps Engineering Advisor
Position Overview
The job profile for this position is an Engineering Advisor. This is a Band 4 Senior Contributor Career Track Role.
The Infrastructure & Automation engineering team is focused on improving the stages within the Software Development Life Cycle so a product can be delivered to market faster, safer, and reliably. The Infrastructure & Automation engineer will focus on work within Provider Manage Finance Experience Group to cultivate DevOps practices and implement automation tools. The engineer will work closely with other delivery, engineering, and operational teams throughout the iterative development cycle.
Key Responsibilities
Building and maintaining automation/deployment tools using industry standard technology
Building and maintaining infrastructure for many assets across different coding languages
Establish and promote Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) DevOps Engineering best practices
Actively troubleshoot any issues that arise during testing while catching and solving issues before launch
Support code and database deployments for all SDLC environments
Update and design new procedures as needed to optimize performance
Automate operational processes as needed, with accuracy and in compliance with security requirements
Specifying, documenting and developing new product features, and writing automation scripts so that others may learn and utilize the functionality
Work with open-source technologies as needed
Work with CI/CD and source control tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, Udeploy, and GIT
Participate in Agile ceremonies across the Agile release train to produce results conducive to company interests
Provide technical support where needed
Stay current with industry trends and source new ways for our business to improve

Experience working within SAFe DevOps principles
Hands-on experience with supporting core infrastructure technology like RHEL operating systems, Java containers (EAP/JWS), and databases (Oracle/PostgreSQL)
Solid understanding of object orientated languages such as JAVA, C++, and Python
Experience using web services and APIs
Experience with CI/CD pipelines using technologies such as Jenkins, Teraform, Gitflow, CI, etc.

Desired Experience/Qualifications

Ansible and Python development experience is highly preferred
Hands-on programming experience using relevant languages, such as Pega and Java
Solid organizational and multi-tasking skills, as well as attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Must be able to “know your audience” and communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Creative problem-solving skills
Flexibility to change course based on business and infrastructure needs as well as effectively manage and deal with the fast changes
Ability to work independently and also within a team environment
Minimal travel will be required

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
Cloud Engineering Advisor (AWS Deployment)

The job profile for this position is Cloud Engineering Advisor, which is a Band 4 Senior Contributor Career Track Role.

Excited to grow your career?

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Summary

After continued success and investment, Cigna, a leading Health Services company, is looking for exceptional Software Engineers to join our Technology organization.

The role involves working with business and technical experts to implement cloud engineering best practices related that promotes the highest reusability across Cigna globally.

You will be responsible for the delivery of a business need end-to-end starting from understanding the requirements to deploying the software into production.

The focus for this team is on the delivery of innovative solutions to complex problems, with the unique opportunity to:

Tackle cloud and application deployments that must satisfy data privacy rules and best practices around the industry
Use cutting edge technology in the AWS cloud environment with global/enterprise scope
Work in a collaborative environment with people around the globe


You are a “driver,” not a “passenger” on your team, demonstrating a passion for solving hard technical problems, and propelling delivery forward. The harder the problem, the better you stand out; you rise to a challenge.
You have a breadth of knowledge in computer science, a problem solving mentality and a desire to learn. You have cloud engineering experience that includes core development on platform, data processing, and application development.
You yearn to be part of a team recognized for technical excellence, and technology leadership, and collaborate to ensure the success of a global cloud platform.


Drive automation and integrate with CI/CD tools for continuous validation.
Drive mentality of building well architected applications for AWS Cloud.
Drive the mentality of quality being owned by the entire team.
Identify code defects and work with other developers to address quality issues in product code.
Finding bottlenecks and thresholds in existing code through the use of automation tools.
Collaborating with Enterprise CoEs where appropriate to share practises/solutions and identify potential practises/solutions for reuse.
Articulate clear business objectives aligned to technical specifications and work in an iterative agile pattern daily.
Ownership over your work task, and are comfortable interacting with all levels of the team and raise challenges when necessary.


AWS cloud experience with some of the core services – S3, SQS, SNS, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambda, Step Functions, EKS, Secrets Manager, Systems Manager, Glue, EC2, IAM, VPC.
Core code production for AWS Infrastructure using Terraform
Deploying and developing AWS cloud applications and services end to end
Operational triage of bugs, failed test cases and system failures
Mapping user stories to detailed technical specifications
Complete detailed peer code reviews
Architecting pilots and proofs-of-concept effort to spur innovation
Working in all stages of the development lifecycle
Ask smart questions, collaborate, team up, take risks, and champion new ideas


Extensive experience with AWS or other cloud technologies
Strong Terraform IaaS experience.
Experience with DevOps & CI/CD tools – Jenkins, uDeploy, Argo CD.
Experience with Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS).
Demonstrate proficiency with languages such as Python, Unix Shell scripting
Solid experience with git software version control and good understanding of code branching strategies and organization for code reuse


Linux / UNIX operating system environment, comfort with bash scripting and command line

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
Verity Solutions, a Cigna Company, is an award-winning leader in software and services developed for administration of the federal 340B drug pricing program. Our mission is to simplify the complex process of maintaining 340B program compliance resulting in critical 340B cost savings for our customers. We value fresh thinking, drive, transparency, and are dedicated to providing agile and proactive solutions to those who serve the most vulnerable in our communities. At Verity Solutions, we foster a collaborative, casual, and technology driven environment and want to evolve and grow with diverse people who are inspired by progress and delighted by partnering with others.

The Sr. DevSecOps Engineer position is a key contributor to Verity’s industry-leading 340B SaaS platform, responsible for securing, maintaining, and extending performant, reliable, healthy, and scalable AWS architectures. This is a highly valuable position that will require you to have strong experience with securing cloud based infrastructure and applications. We’re looking for engineers who can mix great collaborative skills, an ability to work independently, an automation-first approach to problem solving, and deliver well thought and compelling solutions as part of an agile team.


Assure the DevSecOps infrastructure, data assets, and services meets appropriate Cigna and regulatory requirements.

Primary liaison with the Cigna Information Protection (CIP) team to manage policy compliance and issue remediation.

Support maintaining our security assessments and certifications such as HITRUST.

Protect the confidentiality of sensitive and/or proprietary company and customer information, including HIPAA data.

Support vendors, customers, or prospects requesting a security review of our platform and services.

Follow engineering and security best practices. Engage in understanding market trends by independent learning and research.

Manage production and pre-production environments and deployments for our SaaS platform.

Ensure business continuity and disaster recovery in an automated way.

Document work and automation code/logic so that others can understand and contribute.

Network, Servers, Active Directory, and similar systems.

Implement monitoring systems to alert and report on key production environment metrics.

Communicate progress, issues, and risks in a timely manner and cadence.

Collaborate with other engineers and analysts on design, task sharing, and problem solving.

Partner and communicate with Operations and Development team members to ensure successful production deployments and ensure security and effective monitoring in production environments.

Support and promote the Verity values through positive interactions with both internal and external stakeholders on a regular basis.

Support office IT needs as needed.

Other key projects and initiatives as assigned.


Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience.

At least 5+ years of hands on experience with core AWS services: EC2, Cloud Formation, S3, Cloud Watch, Inspector, and similar services. AWS certification is preferred but not required.

Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification is preferred but not required.

Lead reporting and remediation efforts surrounding security vulnerability compliance.

Experience with security tools such as PRISMA, Tenable, Archer GRC, Inspector, and OSSEC.

Experience in CICD automation and configuration software like Jenkins, Chef, Run Deck, MOVEit.

Experience with infrastructure as code, including Cloud Formation and Terraform.

Proficiency in Linux and Windows server administration.

Knowledgeable in supporting backend database technologies such as Mongo, MS-SQL, MYSQL.

Knowledgeable in network configuration/troubleshooting (load balancing, firewalls, VPN, etc.)

Proficiency in setting up and maintaining robust monitoring and alerting systems like Splunk or Grafana.

Programming proficiency in any of the following languages to develop tools and automation: PowerShell, Bash, JSON, Golang, C#.

Experience supporting Golang web based solutions preferred.

A track record of designing for high scale and fault tolerance.

Proficient with current industry-leading development tools (IDE, Source control, build/CI, etc.)

Knowledge of cloud-centric design patterns.

Curiosity and critical thinking skills.

Strong problem-solving skills.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Self-motivated, ability to be effective with minimal supervision.

Ability to collaborate effectively with team members in a Scrum-based environment.

Ability to adapt to changing requirements, business processes, etc.

Experience developing applications for Pharmacy or Healthcare industries preferred.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: Enterprise DevOps Architect Director- Work from home
Job_Description:
We are seeking a passionate and talented AWS Engineer. The ideal candidate would be someone with significant AWS and devops experience and a thorough background in CS fundamentals such as data structures, algorithms, and design patterns. They would be well versed in the challenges and complexities involved in building scalable and robust applications. Most importantly, they would thrive in a fast paced & collaborative culture, helping to grow a pharmacy startup.

Required Technical Skills and Experience

AWS, gitlab, python, shell scripting, ECS

Security: AWS security tools(WAF, cloudtrail, guard duty), IDS IPS, image auditing tools

Devops: Terraform/cloudformation
AWS networking(VPC , subnets, transit gateways, VPC peering)

Ability to work in a cross-functional environment where team members may fill many roles

Ability to work with other teams to accomplish goals together
You get Bonus Points if...

you have Kubernates experience

you know how to set-up/maintain CI/CD pipelines

you are familiar with the Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence)

you have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar field
You're a Good Cultural Fit if...

you are comfortable being self-directed and taking ownership of work

you like to level up your skills and knowledge, and are constantly learning

you don’t hesitate to state and discuss your ideas, and are open to consider ideas of others

a collaborative team environment is where you thrive
Your typical workday may include activities like ....

Deployment, automation, management, and maintenance of AWS cloud-based production system.

Ensuring availability, performance, security, and scalability of AWS production systems.

Management of creation, release, and configuration of production systems.

Leverage best practices to provide the system and AWS cloud security

Evaluation of new technology alternatives and vendor products.

System troubleshooting and problem resolution across various application domains and platforms.

Pre-production acceptance testing for quality assurance.

Provision of critical system security by leveraging best practices and prolific cloud security solutions.

Providing recommendations for architecture and process improvements.

Definition and deployment of systems for metrics, logging, and monitoring on AWS platform.

Designing, maintenance and management of tools for automation of different operational processes.

Define and deploy systems for metrics and monitoring on the AWS platform, etc.

Title: BI Data Engineer - eviCore - Work from home
Job_Description:
eviCore’s Analytics Engineering team is looking for a Data Engineer that enjoys working with new technology and delivering quality data!

Duties

Build ETL processes to allow data to flow seamlessly from source to target using tools like Databricks, Azure Data Factory, SSIS, SQL Stored Procedures and Powershell scripting

Load and enhance dimensional data models

Leverage code to apply business rules to ensure data is clean and is interpreted correctly by all business stakeholders, using tools like Databricks, SQL, Scala and Python

Perform code reviews and QA

Participate in sprint ceremonies

Provide on-call support to offshore operations team

Train operations teams on the ETL processes being developed

Troubleshoot and address issues with the data and/or the ETL process

Fine tune existing code to make processes more efficient

Maintain and create documentation to describe our data management processes

Analyze reports using various tools like Micro Strategy, Tableau and SSRS

Support user questions on data management processes and results

Minimum Required Skills

3+ Years building big data and data warehousing solutions

Knowledge of data modeling (including dimensional modeling), data architecture & data governance concepts

Experience in working with implementations of Azure cloud data solutions (ADLS, Data Bricks, Synapse, ADF)

Proficient in database concepts and technologies including MS SQ Server, DB2 and Oracle

Excellent written and oral communications skills

Must be able to effectively communicate complex technical topics to a variety of audiences

Experience with Healthcare data is a plus

Title: BI Data Engineer - eviCore - Work from home
Job_Description:
United States - Work From Home

First things first, we’re a global health service company dedicated to helping people improve their health, well-being and sense of security. But we don’t just care about your well-being, we care about your career health too. That’s why when you work with us, you can count on a different kind of career – you’ll make a difference, learn a ton, and share in changing the way people think about healthcare.

Now on to the good stuff… what you’ll do:
Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineers uses specialized depth and experience to develop and modify complex software application programs supporting Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence initiatives. This position will be responsible for advocating, educating and partnering with teams across the enterprise to develop best practices around the preferred technology stacks, as well as implementing Machine Learning applications and proof of concepts (POC). As a member of the newly formed Pharmacy Machine Learning Engineering team, This position will also create detailed specifications, conduct quality assurance reviews of peer's application programming.

Create Machine Learning Solutions to achieve organizational objectives

Consult to product development team’s best practices related to Machine Learning application development and Machine Learning/AI-specific infrastructure technology stacks (e.g. GPU-based systems, A.I. in public cloud, etc).

Apply best practice software engineering principles towards the development of applications, in order to productionalize Machine Learning models produced by Data Scientists and ML Engineers

Leverage Big Data and Data Science tools (i.e. one or more of SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Python, R) to both source and work with data

Ensure quality of technology delivery of multiple vendors’ technology solutions for multiple concurrent projects or programs for an application family.

Deliver solutions for multiple concurrent projects

Identify and implement process enhancement opportunities associated with supporting the application area.

Implement actions to increase ESI and vendor partner knowledge on team.

Serve as SME for components of the team.

Provide technical guidance to projects/programs for complex components of a multiple technology suites.

Develop standard practices, components, guidelines for use of complex technology components.

Resolve urgent and high production incidents.

Determine root cause of problems and drive resolution.

Work on other projects as assigned.


Bachelor’s degree and 3+ years of relevant experience or a Master’s degree in a relevant field or the equivalence of education and experience

Good understanding of relational and nosql database concepts and data processing

data structures, algorithms, performance complexity, and implications of computer architecture on software performance (e.g., I/O and memory tuning)

version control systems (i.e. Git, Github) and workflows, and ability to write production-ready code

Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field.

Ability to provide and implement technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.

Solutions are innovative, thorough, practical and consistent with organizational objectives.

Strong customer service focus.

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry.

Familiar with working in a vendor partner model.

Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines.

Adaptability and willingness to lean new tools and applications.

Ability to adapt in a dynamic work environment and make independent decisions.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across project team

Title: BI Data Engineer - eviCore - Work from home
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

The Senior Data Engineer will work with business and technical experts to implement software engineering best practices that promotes the highest re usability across the US and Global. The individual must have superb analytical and technical skills coupled with the ability to drive project deliverables. The individual will be expected to participate in the collaborative concept definition, architectural refinement, software design and realization of products that support the strategic technology needs to support the organization. This person is comfortable working with in a technical capacity across many of the sectors including core development on platform, data processing and report generation. You will work in a team that demands technical excellence and whose members are expected to hold each other accountable in the overall success of the output.

Behaviors

Drive automation pyramid and integrate with CI/CD tools for continuous validation.

Understands when to automate and when not to.

Drive mentality of building well architected applications for Cloud

Drive the mentality of quality being owned by the entire team.

Can identify code defects and work with other developers to address quality issues in product code.

Passion for finding bottlenecks and thresholds in existing code through the use of automation tools.

Passion for continuing education and improving code quality.

Responsibilities

Technical Lead that can roll up their sleeves when needed, and enjoys being involved in solution designs.

Develop technical architecture to achieve more modular, cloud centric, API and streaming driven architecture for agile delivery.

Migrating On-Premise solution to cloud including Teradata Vantage

Develop data pipelines to integrate with enterprise data steams – Cloud and on-perm

Collaborate on architecture decisions and develop solutions in AWS – Including Python, Databricks, Redshift, elastic search, DynamoDB, Lambda, Kinesis, Glue and AI/ML tools.

Create Proof of concepts, innovate and integrate cloud-based software in a continuous delivery environment.

Lead and mentor a full-stack team to meet the demands of a fast-growing company.

Lead multiple activities including but not limited to data models, solution, design data pipeline, APIs, partner integrations, and cloud infrastructure.


10+ years of diverse Technology experience with a minimum of 6 years of experience in Software development

Experience with AWS capabilities – Databricks, dynamoDB, Lambda, Redshift, elastic search.

Experience with API and Streaming technologies.

Software development experience with Python, PySpark, Apache Spark and Kafka

Strong knowledge of Data Integration (e.g. Streaming, Batch, Error and Replay) and data analysis techniques.

Experience with GitHub, Jenkins, and Terraform.

Experience with Teradata (Vantage) or any RDBMS system/ ETL Tools

Good experience on designing and developing data pipelines for data ingestion and transformation using Spark.

Excellent in trouble shooting the performance and data skew issues.

Deep knowledge in partitioning, bucketing concepts of data ingestion.

Working knowledge on the implementation of data lake ETL using AWS glue, Databricks etc.

Proficiency in SQL, relational and non-relational databases, query optimization and data modelling.

Experience with source code control systems like Gitlab.

Experience with large scale distributed relational and NoSQL database systems.

Expertise in designing technical solutions using object-oriented design concepts

Excellent communication skills

Provide recommendations and design optimal configurations for large-scale deployments.

Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.

Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

Desired

Experience in Healthcare

Experience in Teradata Customer Journey

Experience with Data & Analytics

Competencies
Customer focus, dealing with Ambiguity, Informing, Learning and Applying Quickly, Managing Vision and Purpose, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Perseverance

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 115,100 - 191,800 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Title: BI Data Engineer - eviCore - Work from home
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from home, United States

Data and Analytics Engineering at Cigna is looking for a strong Software Engineering Senior Advisor who can lead a team and solve complex problems, eager to learn new technologies, and deliver business capabilities that improve access to high performing providers and increase healthcare affordability. This role is the perfect blend of management, software development, data engineering, business analytics, and delivery execution. It is a great opportunity for someone who wants to be challenged, drive change, and deliver value that is tangible.

You will lead a team that designs, and develops applications that provide Cigna with competitive analytics and intelligence used to create more cost effective products, increase member affordability, and optimize market growth strategies. You will have the opportunity to design, develop, and deploy new applications and features that will directly impact and drive Cigna's competitive decisions within the marketplace, and ultimately provide better and more affordable healthcare.
Cigna uses a variety of technologies, from big data to the latest web frameworks. You will get to build state-of-the-art technology that is scalable and robust, utilizing cloud infrastructure, and full automation.


As a Software Engineering senior advisor, you will help develop an integrated cloud-enabled enterprise solution to support next-generation reporting and analytical capabilities on an enterprise-wide scale. You will deliver user-oriented products in a fast –paced and agile environment.

Work on a team of software engineers, managing work to ensure it’s on track and adheres to quality controls

Develop rock-solid, scalable systems that are thoughtfully designed

Collaborate with other software engineers, domain experts, and end-users, to build the right solutions that address our business needs

Implement modern delivery practices such as continuous integration, behavior/test driven development and automation



LOVES data, analytics, building self-service tools and products using the latest technologies

Boundless intellectual curiosity to continually explore how to do things better, bigger, faster and cheaper

Comfortable with all layers of the stack, from the database to the front-end

Excellent team player

Knows how to navigate an organization to find the people and answers you need.

Prioritize many competing tasks on an aggressive timeline

Passionate about learning – about healthcare as well as technology

Willing to take risks and advocate new ideas


5+ years of experience in software development

Javascript, Python, Ruby, Perl, etc.

C++, Java, Scala, or other OO compiled language

Familiarity with AWS, cloud native application development

Data mining and SQL experience

Knowledge and experience with agile development process

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent in education and experience


Real-time streaming application development using Kafka

Experience within Databricks

DevOps and CICD technologies experience

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from Home, United States

This role supports the Network Quality & Innovation organization and the associated functional processes within Provider Solutions & Operations (PS&O). This position will conduct validation and quality activities that analyze the quality and consumption of provider data. Activities will include outbound calls to providers’ offices, ancillaries and facilities validating provider demographic and relational data and data remediation. Along with these duties, this role improves the quality of the data, the process, and improvements in data consumption. This will require the ability to think critically and utilize judgment, fact and discretion in helping to drive quality improvements.

The Business Analytics Lead Analyst should be proficient in understanding and interpreting provider data in both the CPF and HCPM systems. Excellent customer service and communication skills are also a requirement of the role. This role uses various tools that assist with data validation and requires a proficiency working with data and basic data analysis. This role requires a solid understanding of the importance of data accuracy, data analytics, and external provider group relationships.


Engage with external provider partners by conducting outreach calls in a meaningful manner in order to improve and enhance the provider experience
Track outgoing and incoming communication including documentation of outcome, key relational and field element changes
Validate the demographic information and metadata of providers across the following data elements: Provider Status, Name, Gender, Date of Birth (DOB), State License, DEA, Address and Hospital Affiliation by web research and outbound calls to providers’ offices.
Validate the relational information of providers across the following data elements: Service Locations, Group Affiliation and Provider Practicing Status by making outbound calls to providers’ offices.
Assess the accuracy, completeness, and currency of Networks, Contracts, Demographic and Reimbursement data within Cigna systems
Implement and support business activities utilizing data mining, reporting, and other intelligence methods and tools
Submit provider updates to Provider Data Management (PDM) following existing outlined processes.
Perform provider updates through the use of automated processes and manual remediation.
Excellent relationship skills with internal and external partners
Accountable for supporting business readiness activities for project implementation.
Assist with any special projects


3+ years of work experience in provider services, provider contracting, network operations or analytics
Strong knowledge and exposure/experience in the healthcare operations with emphasis on healthcare providers, contracting, and provider services
Strong knowledge of Network, Contract and Demographic data elements.
Strong knowledge of Provider structures and relationships
For Cigna employees only - strong knowledge of Cigna systems such as CPF and HCPM
For external candidates only - strong knowledge of Provider Book of Record
Microsoft Excel proficiency required (pivot tables, conditional formatting, VLOOKUP, etc.)
Strong drive to learn new concepts/technology with the ability to embrace a rapidly changing environment
Strong documentation and organizational skills with the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment while supporting multiple concurrent efforts.
Solid communication skills with the ability to discuss data analysis results
Ability to manage large data sets
Adept critical thinking skills with the ability to determine causes with consistency in results


Bachelor’s Degree or higher strongly preferred or equivalent work experience.
Previous telephonic customer service experience preferred

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.
