Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Remote, Work from Home, United States

This position will conduct analysis activities that measures the validity of provider data and augments the provider book of record as required.
Activities may include evaluating roster accuracy, utilizing logic and analytical tools to compare multiple sources of data and decision, analyzing root cause and performing analytical techniques.
This role improves the quality of the data, the process, and improvements in data consumption.
The Quality Analyst will also identify defects and will contribute to pinpointing the causes and offer recommendations for prevention.
This role will maintain a strong focus on facts and data to understand the quality of our network, contracts, and demographics in Provider data.
The Quality Analyst should be proficient conducting sampling, designing and maintaining analytical procedures, implementing change based on findings, assisting in the development and enhancement of tools, and analyzing results to improve quality outcomes.


Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred or equivalent work experience required.
3+ years of experience performing quality audits, analysis, or quality related activities within a healthcare setting.
Cigna employees should have strong experience using HCPM (ideal) and/or CPF.
Medicare knowlege highly preferred.
Solid Excel experience creating pivot tables/VLOOKUPs required.
Strong knowledge of Proclaim, PMHS, SANP, and Facets highly preferred
Experience using Minitab, MS Access, Toad, Cognos Hyperion, SAS, SQL, etc. highly preferred
Strong knowledge and exposure/experience in the healthcare operations claim process, with emphasis on healthcare providers, contracting, and provider services preferred
Strong knowledge of Network, Contract and Demographic data elements highly preferred
Strong knowledge of Provider structures and relationships
Solid communication skills with the ability to discuss data analysis results
Organization skills with the ability to manage data sets
Critical thinking skills with the ability to determine causes with consistency in results

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
The Data Integrity group is responsible for managing the data integrity of master data within core ERP to ensure accurate reporting and system functionality. This group will act as key liaison in master data entry using both manual and automated solutions to enforce quality control and approval requirements. The group interfaces with all business, operational and technology areas to develop and execute data integrity plans and changes and will share data ownership regarding master data maintenance.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Creates and maintains master data reporting, dashboards and analyses
Creates and validates master data mass updates per data standards and requirements
Supports master data entry using both automated and manual solutions for item, vendor, customer and other master data

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
WORK LOCATION: Georgia - Alabama Market

The Healthcare Provider Data Lead Analyst serves as an integral Provider Data Analytics member of the Local Market Network Management Team. This role assists in developing the strategic direction and management of the alternative access network contracting activities for a given market. The role is focused on configuration of new alternative access networks, maintaining existing alternative access networks and any reconfigurations of existing alternative access networks. This position will be a subject matter expert on the criteria and intent for each alternative access product in the assigned market(s). This position works in close collaboration with Network Development & Competitive Insights, Network Solutions, Network Operations, Pricing, Provider Services, Product, and Compliance.

The position is active in both the evaluation of network design opportunities and the network implementation. The role will not be responsible for loading the network directly, but is responsible for ensuring the Contracting intent is translated correctly to Network Solutions and Network Operations, and that contract interpretation flows consistently to downstream processes. The role will remain active in the ongoing support of the integrity of the alternative networks.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Subject Matter Expert for all Alternative Access Networks in assigned markets, including inclusion/exclusion criteria, anchor providers, network adequacy and differences between various alternative access products in assigned markets.

Evaluate various network configuration alternatives and make informed recommendations to markets. Includes, in part, acquiring information on multiple scenarios, analyzing, reporting, recommending, compiling, reviewing, and/or submitting data as required to ensure network meets established solution criteria.

Analyze GeoAccess and Quest reporting in multiple scenarios during strategic discussions and then for ongoing network adequacy maintenance.

Works in partnership with Network Solutions to manage the end to end network build, reconfiguration or expansion (i.e. drive the creation of correct provider files based on criteria, analysis, reporting and decision making).

Develop and maintain contract grid to track contracting activities required for implementation, provide Contracting updates on project implementation calls with AAN or Network Operations team

Develop guidebooks, GSI and GMI summaries, and identify criteria logic tools for provider inclusion/exclusion

Translates the intent of the delivery system criteria as it relates to network configuration, works with other areas to resolve discrepancies and ensures that it will be consistently applied across all tools and processes.

Coordinate with matrix partners in Network Solutions and Compliance to ensure appropriate submissions. Coordinates discussion regarding any overlap and variations between products and markets to ensure consistency.

Conducts ongoing evaluation of network criteria to maintain quality control of the network construct. Provides recommendations for issue resolution. Reviews data files for data engineering, check-out quality audits and loading submissions.

Responsible for coordinating market sign off of data loading files during implementation and LocalPlus reconciliation trueups.

As part of end to end implementation management, ensure critical timelines are consistently met. Proactively provide input on maintenance requirements during implementation planning.

Understand Federal and State regulatory requirements, especially as they relate to market suppression, providers accepting new patients, and the requirements for network adequacy, communicating with Compliance to obtain guidance.

Interacts with Compliance to support requirements for filing processes, which may include development, evaluation, formatting and reporting of information to regulatory bodies.

Manage network adequacy reporting analysis and validation processes during the phases of alternative network evaluation, implementation and filing, as well as on an ongoing basis. May assist in annual re-filings, as required, to ensure consistency.

Manages the LocalPlus product reconciliation trueup process for aligned market(s) by running reports, summarizing results, assigning needed research to Provider Services, getting needed approvals from Contracting and submitting for loading/correction.

Ensures that communications are issued on network HCP changes per established processes.

Participates in the development of internal training and documentation updates, as required.

Works closely with Regional and National Network Access Leads. Determine implications and alternatives related to pending terminations impacting alternative access networks.

Manages review of quarterly Network Health reports to ensure Regional Network Analysts are managing necessary recruitment so that all alternate access products remain in compliance according to State and Federal guidelines.

CMS ECP provider review process to support annual Compliance network adequacy and filings for on-market IFP solutions as required.

Provide guidance or expertise to other Provider Data Network Advisors in the local markets. May also provide coverage for other markets as required.

Resolve elevated and complex issues.

Provides reporting and analysis support for the local market Network Management team, as required.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree required, MBA or MHA preferred

Healthcare Data Analytics experience required

Provider Network Contracting and Provider Relations experience preferred

Experience with Commercial and Government products a plus

Demonstrates understanding of provider data structures, design/implementation/architecture and working with large data sets, Data Integrity and Data Quality

Ability to develop an understanding of market-specific nuances and network constructs

Working knowledge of hospital, managed care, and provider business models

Strong project management, analytical and critical thinking skills

Team player with proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively by developing strong working relationships within a fast paced matrix organization

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Superior problem solving and decision-making skills

Ability to interact and negotiate effectively with various matrix partners

Provider Workbench, Central Provider File, HCPM a plus

Proficient with MS Office including strong Access and Excel skills to support data mining and analysis

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
The Contact Center Workforce Planning Senior Analyst is a key member of the Workforce Management planning team. This role is responsible for performing trend analysis for key performance indicators with the ability to compile executive level reporting.

Through a strong understanding of business goals, strategy and pain points, the workforce planning team is responsible for delivering detailed reporting and analytics supporting operational performance against objectives. This position will be a key contributor in exemplifying how operations is functioning against the forecasted goals.

Responsibilities:
Performs analysis, trending and communications of defined key performance indicators; has the ability to write detailed business requirements in order to develop reporting documents supporting key business objectives.
Analyzes and recommends success measures and creates models to support business objectives. Has solid understanding of call center drivers and key performance indicators.
Compile executive level reporting as required.
Handles ad hoc requests for the remainder of the Workforce Optimization team, such as root cause analysis, research and process mapping requests.
Other duties as assigned


Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years equivalent work experience
3 - 5 years of experience in operational improvement and/or operational effectiveness. Must possess in depth knowledge about contact center operations, customer expectations and experience
Strong presenting and influencing skills with ability to turn data into a compelling story with a call to action. Ability to communicate across all levels of leadership is a must.
Tableau experience strongly preferred.
Advanced Excel skills required.
Knowledge of both contact center and back office metrics; key performance indicators preferred.
Ability to work with a high sense of urgency.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Primary Responsibilities
This role is responsible for the design, construction, testing, optimization, and operational support of the Client Analytics initiatives. The duties of the position include the following:

Define Data/reporting strategies in order to optimize the use of enterprise data to effectively meet the Analytics organizations business objectives.

Evaluate and make recommendations related to reporting components utilized in the enterprise data warehouse and overall information delivery solution.

Develop and maintain innovative Azure solutions/ MSSQL server solutions.

Solution design using Microsoft Azure services and MSSQL Server tools.

The ability to automate tasks and deploy production standard code (with unit testing, continuous integration, versioning etc.)

Load transformed data into storage and reporting structures in destinations including data warehouse, reporting systems and analytics applications

Function as a member of a larger Analytics team and is responsible for translating business and functional requirements into detailed technical designs and the delivery of reporting solutions according to specification.

SQL experience required.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work collaboratively with other analysts and advisors across the organization.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
This is a dynamic role in the Enterprise Data Office responsible for analysis supporting lakehouse solution development. This role supports a wide variety of business analytics needs across eviCore stakeholders. It is a very customer focused role and c ommunication is key as the resource will work directly with stakeholders to capture requirements across multiple teams. Healthcare background is a plus but not a requirement.

Responsibilities:
Analyzes data from eviCore’s information systems, develops or supports development of solutions, and assists other team members and stakeholders in their use and understanding of eviCore’s data and processes.

Provides advanced professional input to complex Engineering assignments/projects.

Supports a team of developers that design and develop a consolidated, conformed enterprise data lake house which stores all critical data across Customer, Provider, Claims, Client and Benefits data.

Analyzes large amounts of data stored in a data lake house to find relationships and patterns.

Supports and provides direction to more junior professionals.

Works autonomously, only requiring “expert” level technical support from others.

Exercises judgment in the evaluation, selection, and adaptation of both standard and complex techniques and procedures.

Utilizes in-depth professional knowledge and acumen to develop models and procedures, and monitor trends, within Information Management.

Collaborates effectively with teammates and business leaders influencing outcomes through effective verbal and written communication skills including planning and facilitating workshops, developing compelling senior-level presentations and other highly visible communications.

Conducts analyses to identify business use cases, capability requirements, and technology & data dependencies to support the our key strategic initiatives.

Interprets business feedback and results to succinctly create compelling recommendations and solutions for senior leadership sponsorship and buy-in.


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in managed care and/or working with healthcare claims.

Must be organized and work well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Strong technical skills required to explore, extract, organize, transpose and analyze data sets.

Good understanding of data warehousing / dimensional modeling concepts.

Experience in ETL, data mapping, data handling and Data Analytics.

Proficient in Database Concepts and Technologies including MS SQL Server.

Self-Starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions.

Strategic thinker with the ability to develop sophisticated analyses and synthesize the results into implications and communicate recommendations to senior leadership.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of shaping messages appropriately for a senior-level audience and proficiency using MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint.

Excellent Communications skills and should be able to effectively collaborate with the remote teams – both on-shore and off-shore.

Experience in Agile Methodology.

Experience creating analysis or BI output using one or more of the following:

MicroStrategy

SQL Server Management Studio

SAS

Tableau

PowerBI

Qlik

Other BI tools


Critical thinking

Highly developed communication

Thorough and well-thought-out data analysis

Quick learning

Self-motivated

Teamwork

Time management

Adaptability

Organized

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
WORK LOCATION: Work at Home

Do you love digging into data? Do you love a challenge? If so, read on!

The Data Analytics Lead Analyst will provide expert content for data measurement and reporting projects by using various tools for provider data profiling and analytics related to the compliance reporting environment. The incumbent will work closely in a team setting with the product owner(s) to meet business deliverables. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.
This position is a SAS programmer role responsible for writing queries to extract data from CPF, HCPM and other sources, including mapping to previously built crosswalks and other supporting files. The candidate will have the ability to write complex, efficient SAS code to extract large data sets in a short amount of time and derive data that we do not house in our system based on logic provided from the business analyst.

Responsibilities
Produce standardized, accurate, and efficient SAS/SQL programs to extract and derive data per detailed requirements in order to deliver state filing results
Debug and make queries reusable
Collaborate with Business Analyst teammates and other Provider Data query writers within the Network Quality Department to deliver state filing results and serve as a peer reviewer and implementing improvements to queries.
Continually strive to enhance and improve existing queries and their own skills by demonstrating initiative to participate in ongoing coaching and training
Utilize independent judgment and discretion, identify data quality issues, and provides recommendations for adjustment.
Able to prioritize and multi-task work.
Facilitate team conference calls as required by management.

Qualifications
High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor's degree or advance degree preferred.
3+ years experience in Data Analytics required
Experience with SQL is required
Healthcare related experience a plus
Hands-on experience working with data mining, analysis, informatics data processing software and languages such as: SAS or Cognos highly preferred
Solid experience using Excel (VLOOKUP, formulas and pivot tables) required
Hadoop, Hive, Toad and Tableau
Experience with GEO Access or Quest Analytics a plus
Ability to review and analyze code to help decode or research data issues using technologies such SQL, SAS, Excel etc.
Experience working with provider data.
Experience applying a consultative and collaborative approach. Work experience & expertise with team input to influence business priorities and business actions for maximum strategic benefit.
Have led code review process, giving constructive feedback to peers.
Strong problem-solving skills (able to critically think through problems to get to the solution)
Detail oriented (quality assurance on the reports you are producing are accurate)
Strong focus on delivery with proven time management skills (rapid turnaround, ability to engage in multiple tasks, meet deadlines/standards, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
This position is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining automation and analytics to support the Workforce Management team and Service Operations. This role will create data flows in Alteryx, dashboards in Tableau, automating of existing reporting, and conduct adhoc business analysis as needed.

Business Analytics Lead Analyst role will also support reviewing data sources for data quality/consistency and creating/blending data sources required for automation, reporting, and analytics. Another key function of the role is to review current reporting and analytics processes for efficiency improvements, accuracy, and providing business value. This position has exposure to cross-functional teams and provides WFM data to drive incremental revenue and margin.

Responsibilities:
Design, development, testing and deployment of Tableau Dashboards.
Leverage advanced Tableau functionality (parameters, actions, tooltip modifications, API, etc.) to create analytical dashboards.
Utilize a growing technology base (Alteryx, Tableau, Cloud) to develop scalable solutions that can easily integrate new properties and resorts.
Working Knowledge of API using analytical tools such as SQL / Alteryx or related tools.
Provide business requirements to WFM and Service Operations teams to further the program's data needs and data quality, driving to satisfy self-serve and dashboard driven reporting with data source transparency and quality.
Create SOPs and process documentation for reporting and analytics created
Plan, prioritize, and lead analytics projects to deliver revenue-generating insights or increase operational efficiencies within the WFM team.
Contribute to continuous improvement of enterprise reporting systems, analytical tools, enterprise data warehouse and transactional systems.
Collaborate with WFM and Service Operations teams to develop techniques to evaluate the quality of data. In some cases, this may include developing tactical approaches that allow the Data Analytics team to monitor quality of key data.
Understand business requirements and identify opportunities to improve data quality enhance how data is used for decision support.
Perform data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root cause analysis using Alteryx.
Using Alteryx to ensure data used in performing analyses is of sufficient quality to effectively support informed decision making and timely analysis.
Conducts strategic data analysis identifies insights, implications and make strategic recommendations, develops data visualization that clearly communicate the analysis.
Establish a strong collaborative relationship and be able to drive ad-hoc projects effectively.
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining and the presentation of the data to see beyond the numbers and under how our WFM and Service Operations business interact with our analytic outputs.
Deliver concise communication detailing the progress and results of initiative underway.


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
1-3 years in business analytics, data analysis, or business intelligence required.
Tableau (or other visualization tool) / creating dashboards, SQL and Excel at Intermediate level.
Ability to develop strong client and working relationships with a globally distributed team
Assist with development and deployment of enterprise systems and tools.
Detail-oriented, with focus on delivering accurate reporting and analysis.
Strong analytical, data mining/manipulation, WFM modeling, and problem-solving skills.
Keen ability to assimilate multiple data points into a succinct and meaningful message to be used across the enterprise.
Good communication skills with a demonstrated customer-focused, service-first attitude.
Self-driven, desire to continuously learn and challenge conventional wisdom as it relates to data and revenue analysis.
Alteryx, report scheduling and automation, or other statistical software experience preferred.


5+ years progressive experience as a business operations analyst with forecasting and budgeting experience
Experience development, data modeling and ETL knowledge
Experience in modeling sequential data, statistical forecasting, and time series models
Experience in multiple Workforce Management roles is a plus
Process mapping, system mapping, user experience mapping, data analysis

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Advisor, Digital Mobile Analytics Sr. Analyst role will be a part of our design, research and analytics communities and will lead a small team of analysts to deliver digital analytics and insights. This role will collaborate with our business partners, development teams, design partners, researchers and product owners to insure they have a clear picture of how users are engaging with the digital tools we are creating. This role will be responsible for generating standard reporting and complete ad hoc analyses designed to monitor the digital user experience and answer business questions.

How you'll make a difference:
Lead a small team of consultant analysts, as well as have individual project work

Collaborate across multiple teams to align on product KPIs

Ability to establish and carry on web and mobile Analytics Instrumentation life cycle (Define KPIs, translate KPIs to technical requirements, validate implemented requirements, build reports to satisfy defined business KPIs)

Previous experience with Mobile app debugging tools such as BrowserStack, Project Griffon (Assurance), etc

Define data requirements for projects, identify missing metrics to build KPIs, and work with Product/Technical Product Owners to implement tagging requirements to ensure proper tracking and reporting of digital data

Define, develop, and present standard KPI reports using Adobe Analytics tools (e.g: Workspace, Report Builder, data warehouse)

Investigate, analyze, and socialize digital usage analytics to identify trends and create data-driven insights about visitor behavior (e.g. traffic patterns, conversion funnel, navigation behavior, and pathing)

Deliver actionable data-driven insights to business stakeholders through story-telling presentations and presentation skills

Combine analytics insights from multiple sources (e.g. session replay, feedback surveys) to generate insights when applicable

Function as a subject matter expert on utilization of Adobe Analytics and analyzing web metrics across applicable apps and websites for user insights

Write and maintain technical documentation and requirements related to web and mobile analytics

Stay current with the latest developments with Adobe Analytics


Bachelor's degree; advanced degree a plus

Must have 3+ years of data analytics using Adobe Analytics related tools

Experienced with most of the following Adobe Analytics Admin tools, such as Reporting Suites setup and configurations (conversion and traffic variables, processing rules, marketing channels, classifications), classification rule builder, classification importer, data feed, and data sources)

Experienced with Adobe Analytics components (Projects, segments, calculated metrics, VRs)

tags, cookies, variables, Data Layer

Experience with cross-channel and omnichannel data analytics

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Passion for optimizing the user experience

Familiarity with other Adobe Admin Console a plus

Basic JavaScript and CSS experience a plus

Motivated, result oriented self-starter, curious and inquisitive


The Express Scripts Digital Product & Experience Design team is like few in comparable Technology companies today: we are a collective of carefully curated, specialized disciplines that, when whole, imagines, plans, tests, instruments, measures, builds, deploys, monitors and optimizes end-to-end experiences that represent the health services suite of product offerings.

We are united by our mission to improve life, but we practice our crafts in a discipline orientation that allows us to perfect, excel, and stay current; we then bring our gifts together in an impressive expression of teamwork

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Position Objective:
Join our team as a Business Intelligence Analyst supporting Third Party Analytics within our Global Procurement and Third Party Management (GP&TPM) organization. You will be responsible for developing systems and processes for data collection and analysis and preparing analytical reports for business leaders that present complex data information in an understandable way. This position will also look for opportunities to automate existing manual processes for data collection, uploading and report generation.

General Description:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for accurate data collection, processing, modeling, and analysis. They will use data modeling, predictive modeling, and analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes. The person is required to apply their exhaustive knowledge of data analysis to solving problems faced by GP&TPM and finding opportunities for improvement across multiple areas, teams, and business units.


Maintaining, enhancing, and developing of reporting in our Third Party Command Center environment in AWS through Tableau and ThoughtSpot
Use Tableau or other visualization tools to display advanced, interactive dashboards and reporting that will be used to drive GP&TPM Strategy and aid in storytelling
Communicating with key business users across the department and within outside departments to gather requirements, understand business pain points, and develop reporting solutions to solve their business problems.
Assist with team initiatives and projects such as business process improvement and strategic initiatives
Validate and partner with Data Engineering teams to ensure solutions meet business users’ requirements and solve their business problems
Work with internal teams to deliver standard and ad hoc reporting requests to meet the needs of the business
Entering, updating, closing intake request items.
Maintaining the Third Party Command Center ARC site with relevant updates. Experience/Knowledge:
Bachelor and/or Master’s degree or equivalent work experience
5+ years of relevant work experience
2+ years of experience creating visualizations with Tableau or similar tools
Strong data analysis capabilities and creative thinking with demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations
Experience with analytical tools such as SQL, Tableau, Excel, ThoughtSpot, Alteryx, etc.
Experience interpreting and defining business requirements for complex business problems
Demonstrated cross-functional collaboration and business partnering skills to use across diverse stakeholders
Identify gaps and opportunities in departmental process mapping of current state and the future state workflows
Ability to "think on the fly" and adapt to rapidly changing reporting priorities
Ability to establish and maintain effective and professional working relationships with managers and other employees on the team
Strong intellectual capacity and curiosity

Job_Description:
Remote, work from home, United States

Summary:
Cigna is seeking a highly motivated team member with strong data and analytics background to join our Medicare member retention strategy & analytics team. This individual will be an active contributor in high-visibility large-scale projects that drive one of the organization’s top priorities, member retention. This individual will work with retention and customer experience team members as well as various parts of the organization to create the analytics and reporting that drive strategy.

Self-Starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions

Strategic thinker with the ability to develop sophisticated quantitative analyses and synthesize the results into implications and communicate recommendations to senior leadership
Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of shaping messages appropriately for a senior-level audience and proficiency using MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
US Work from Home

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Financial Data Analyst is responsible for the design and development of the financial forecasting and analytics toolkits which enable our Client Guarantee Management team to accurately and efficiently manage client guarantees.

The Senior Data Analyst will oversee both the development and modernization of reporting and analysis tools. In this capacity, the Senior Data Analyst will drive direct improvements to our financial results through enhancements to communication of financial figures, forecasting, and key driver analysis. A major part of this effort will be maintaining active lines of communication with business partners to learn about their needs and help to track and translate them into relevant financial models.

To perform this function, the Senior Data Analyst will be expected to use a modern software toolkit, including Microsoft Excel and Tableau for financial reporting, and Python for data analysis and forecasting. It is expected that additional models and tools will be picked up quickly based on the needs of the project being worked on.

In addition to continued development, the Senior Data Analyst will guide the effort to automate, streamline and document tools, to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the financial reporting process, while also reducing the business risks of misstatements or delays. This will be done using a variety of scheduling tools and version control systems, such as GitHub.

Key to these efforts will be managing a variety of competing priorities and communicating key results to leadership and stakeholders. This will frequently involve simplifying complicated technical topics in simple terms.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Develop and Maintain Financial Reporting Pipeline.

Develop Financial Forecasting and Analysis Modeling.

Modernize tools using Python and Tableau.

Identify opportunities to implement financial best practices and documentation.

Work with business partners to identify future enhancement opportunities.

Analyze historical results to determine ways to enhance forecasting capabilities.

Produce Client Price Change and Revenue Impact reporting.

Provide ad-hoc financial data analysis to business partners.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree (Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics).

4+ years relevant experience.

Continual willingness to learn and develop both technical and business skills.

Intermediate understanding of Microsoft Excel and VBA including both their benefits and limitations.

Knowledge of programming and the ability to learn new tools as needed.

Experience using Python.

Strong knowledge of financial reporting, data analysis, and financial forecasting.

Excellent Communication skills, oral and written.

This can be a remote Work from Home position.

ABOUT THE DEPARTMENT

If your niche is in financial reporting and analysis, underwriting, cash management, audit or investor relations, our Finance department may be a perfect fit for you. Our teams within Finance work together to ensure that spending stays on track and that we remain a profitable industry leader. We’re always on the lookout for innovative people who will bring outside-the-box thinking to our team.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Organization

Cigna Global Health Benefits (CGHB), Americas has many years of experience in providing health insurance to globally mobile employees and their families to help improve their health, well-being, and peace of mind while outside of their home country. With the introduction of the ConnectUS program, the last several years have been an exciting time for CGHB to revamp the product suite and introduce a multi-state compliance model. CGHB is looking for an energetic and adaptive individual to join the Compliance Solutions Delivery Organization and support our goal to continuously strengthen the company’s culture of compliance.

The Business Project Senior Analyst role as part of the CGHB Compliance Solutions Delivery Organization will have the opportunity to lead and support multiple phases of the delivery lifecycle while interacting with a variety of business areas across CGHB and the Cigna and Evernorth enterprise.

Analyze state and federal mandates to determine applicability to the CGHB business in consult with regulatory, legal/compliance, and business subject matter experts

Document clear, concise, and measurable business requirements and walk through with business, technology, and leadership

Maintain documentation in Open Pages, which is the enterprise system for mandates and evidence of compliance

Lead small to mid-sized compliance initiatives in partnership with scrum team product owners and scrum masters and the GHB Compliance Alliance, a team of compliance champions from business areas across the organization

Support regulatory reporting requirements by facilitating data pulls and validation in partnership with Business Intelligence and Data & Analytics

Participation in the Enterprise New Law Implementation (NLI) forum and process, which includes business leads from across the Cigna Enterprise and provides coordination of mandate implementation

Manage user acceptance testing and support

The requirements for this role are best suited for an individual with skills in both data and business analysis, as well as the ability to lead business delivery. This role will primarily involve Agile delivery; however, may interact with some teams who use the Waterfall methodology. The successful candidate must be comfortable interacting and working with individuals from all different business areas across CGHB and the Cigna Enterprise.

Skills and Experience

The suitable candidate must be able to demonstrate strong experience in the following areas:

A minimum of 3 years business analysis experience

Data analysis and validation; working with Business Intelligence and Data & Analytics

Agile methodology and delivery

User acceptance testing and support

Experience authoring in KnowledgeXChange a plus

Proven experience working on business and IT projects with an understanding of the software delivery lifecycle as well as operational adoption of new processes


Strong analytical skills to critically evaluate mandates and identify true compliance needs requiring action

Strong organizational and communication skills to organize multiple sources of data and create clear requirements, including creation of written Epics and facilitation of the walkthrough

Must be a self-starter who is able to work independently and develop recommendations to progress the goals of the organization

Comfortable with raising questions, issues, ideas or suggestions to co-workers at all levels across the organization, including internationally

Ability to interpret and analyze large sets of data

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Business Analytics Lead Analyst – Network Quality & Performance

Activities will include creating focused programming algorithms, utilizing quality tools, analyzing root cause and performing analytical techniques. Along with these duties, this role improves the quality of provider data, the process, and improvements in data consumption. The Business Analytics Lead Analyst will also identify defects and will contribute to pinpointing the causes and offer recommendations for prevention. This role will maintain a strong focus on facts and data to understand the quality of our network, contracts, and demographics in Provider data.

The Business Analytics Lead Analyst should be proficient in SAS, SQL, sample audits, assisting in the development and enhancement of quality tools, implementing quality inspections, and analyzing results to improve quality outcomes. This role uses various tools that assist with quality assessments producing metrics and information and requires a proficiency working with data and basic data analysis.


Create programs to test the accuracy of demographic data and automate for specific transactions utilizing data mining and intelligence tools
Works independently and collaboratively with Cigna business partners to verify and document quality defects with opportunities
Assesses the accuracy, completeness, and currency of Networks, Contracts, and Demographic data within Cigna systems
Organizes and completes activities including documented support of any audit findings and defects
Ensures compliance with all internal and external quality audit requirements
Implements and supports business activities utilizing data mining, reporting, and other intelligence methods and tools
Committed to improving skills and competencies by demonstrating initiative and leadership in ongoing coaching and training programs
Analyzes results for trends and root cause through comparative, diagnostic, or statistical analysis with conclusions
Makes recommendations based on findings
Work with ambiguity and create processes to determine relevant data
Conducts data comparisons utilizing source information relative to demographic, contract and reimbursement data
Documents and maintains inventory of failures within the process as fed by audit and data obtainable through analysis and reporting related to claims, directory and system fallout, etc.


College degree preferred
Three – five years’ experience in data quality within a healthcare setting
Experience or exposure to audits or quality activities
Strong knowledge and exposure/experience in the healthcare operations claim process, with emphasis on healthcare providers, contracting, and provider services
Experience in with high-complex relational data model(s)
Strong knowledge of Network, Contract and Demographic data
Strong knowledge of Provider structures and relationships
Solid communication skills with the ability to discuss data analysis results
Organization skills with the ability to manage data sets
Adept critical thinking skills with the ability to determine causes with consistency in results
Experience in analytical tools such as MS Excel, Minitab, MS Access, Toad, Cognos Hyperion, SAS, etc.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Help us support our future. Get ready for a job that encourages you to think strategically yet stay connected with your teams. Do you have data manage or problem-solving experience? If so, prepare to innovate, create, and inspire. The Data Management Strategy & Governance Senior Analyst role will work with a team of data engineers to enrich, curate, and produce operational data. The person hired will work under the supervision of more seasoned developers to write, test, and optimize Microsoft SQL Server code, oversee Server Health, and maintain ETL Processes.

Responsibilities:
Delivers specific delegated tasks assigned by a supervisor.
Partners with senior-level team members to optimize SQL queries and SSIS packages and monitor server performance.
Validates data and loads data into appropriate systems for reporting.
Conducts testing and system validation to troubleshoot issues related to master data management and system integrity.
Supports the team with a variety of other tasks such as rerunning failed processes, troubleshooting issues, and creating documentation.
Maintains professional and collaborative working relationships with all.
May own assigned functions to provide system support and data quality governance.
Completes day-to-day Data Management Strategy & Governance tasks without immediate supervision, but has ready access to advice from more experienced team members.


High School Diploma; Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
1-2 years of work experience in a data governance role preferred
Experience or Coursework in data manipulation using Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS


Big data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, and Spark.
Oracle SQL, MySQL, or Teradata SQL.
DBA activities.
Familiarity with health care or PBM industry.
Strong organizational, troubleshooting, and requirement-gathering skills.
Ability to quickly learn how to use new software applications.
Analytical and strategic thinking skills.
Ability to prioritize workload and meet project deadlines.
Ability to work a flexible schedule to accommodate project deadlines.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
**Implementation and Service, Proclaim, Choice Fund, PMHS, Dental
**Work from home opportunity
**Candidate must commit to travel one day a month to the client North Carolina office and two days a month to the client Boston office (travel expense covered by company)

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Interact with internal/external customers and business partners in a professional manner (includes verbal and written interactions).

Own any customer issue that is brought to the table for resolution by employer. Manage resolution in a timely manner and provide status to all appropriate parties when resolved, including a summary of root cause, countermeasures and next steps.

Keep account team updated on any identified trends or client interaction that should be escalated or communicated.

Provide education and guidance about programs and resources available as part of the Client’s benefit plans, including mycigna.com, wellness and discount programs, health savings account and pharmacy.

Deliver lunch and learn sessions on Cigna's programs and services offered and/or meet with Employee Services team periodically to train and answer questions related to trending issues and/or provide updates to the team on Cigna processes/products.

Assist in arranging case manager (or other appropriate Cigna resource) for customer with complicated medical conditions or technical/non-clinical needs

Research, analyze, and track customer call/claim inquiries from employees. Communicate outcome and next step directly to employees with cc to employee’s HR when appropriate.

Handle transactional tasks (customer/provider outreach calls, create out-of-pocket ledgers, etc).

Pull claim reports and analyze data and trends.

Navigate multiple Cigna systems including client self-service portals, claim systems, and tracking systems.

Compile monthly service reporting based on client needs/requests.

Establish and maintain deep connections with the OneGuide team in order to delegate issues appropriately, but also to maintain a feedback loop to report status back to the employee and or HR in a timely, clear and accurate manner.


Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent previously related work experience

Professional Insurance Industry experience is required

Demonstrated strength and ability to interface with and influence key decision makers/clients through use of negotiation skills, dealing with ambiguity and conflict management.

Demonstrated strength and understanding of customer expectations and "sense of urgency" resulting in the ability to influence the organization to meet and exceed customer expectations

Strong analytical ability, with ability to design, track, and work toward specific measurable performance targets for self and team.

Ability to manage multiple and divergent priorities and deadlines, work independently and pro-actively, negotiate and manage expectations for mutually acceptable solutions and creatively problem-solve effective customer solutions

Excellent presentation skills. Previous/proven success and 2 to 4 plus years experience delivering customer/producer communications.

Strong knowledge of Cigna benefits, products, and services (HMCM Complete, MotivateMe, LMP, OneGuide, Cigna Telehealth, HSAB, EAP, etc.)

Ability to quickly understand the customer’s needs and expectations.

Ability to pivot seamlessly from customer interaction to client level updates and communication/coordination.

Demonstrated background preferred in navigating Cigna's various matrix partners to triage inbound Cigna issues from the customer (ie – Dental, DME, Eligibility, Appeals, HSAB, Incentives)

Must meet travel requirements for the role.

Job_Description:
This position is responsible for the analysis, creation and distribution of information and insights via dashboards and self-service applications. The role requires experience of taking business questions and requests, understanding how that relates to data, delivering automated solutions that meet the business needs, and support them with end users.

Must be a current contractor with Cigna, Express Scripts or Evernorth. Evernorth is a new business within the Cigna Corporation.

Key Responsibilities:
Development and execution of complex SQL queries to create key insights and KPI-based reporting. Draws recommendations from insights for business-facing customers

Leverage VBA within Microsoft Office products to automate reporting and generate analytic outputs

Contribute to the design and development of business reporting and data analytics based on business requirements

Being adept in the display of quantitative information through charts, graphs, tables and other visualizations

Working with internal data resources to ensure you have the data you need to provide quality analytics

Bachelor’s degree OR 4-8 years of experience without a bachelor's degree

Experienced in writing and understanding/modifying complex SQL queries

Advanced skills with Microsoft Office products such as Excel and PowerPoint. VBA, formulas, pivot tables, etc.

Knowledge of Python development, design, methodologies, tools and processes is a plus

Ability to provide innovative, practical, and consistent technical and analytical solutions

Experience in Data Visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI is a plus

Demonstrated ability to prioritize work load and meet project deadlines via team collaboration

Adaptability and willingness to learn new tools and applications

Highly organized with strong documentation skills

Works well as a member of a team

Familiarity with health care or PBM industry is a plus

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Summary
The Data Analyst Operations Lead is responsible for gathering data requirements across several disparate systems and compiling them into a comprehensive functional set of requirements for presentation to internal and external stakeholders. This role will serve as a bridge between business and IT and therefore will require strong communication skills. This position will work with business and IT counterparts to manage multiple, concurrent client implementation and enhancement projects. This position will collaborate with project management team to keep track of data deliverables, issues, risks and dependencies for any assigned projects. The Lead Analyst will also be responsible for identifying and leading data process improvement initiatives. This position will ultimately be a technical role – requiring system analysis, technical requirements writing, data validation and both internal and external cross-departmental interfacing.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manages multiple, concurrent implementation/enhancement projects with high degrees of complexity and system analysis at any given time

Leads implementation/enhancement activities such as requirements gathering, technical writing, system analysis, data design, data validation, application testing, monitoring of deliverables/tasks, post launch warranty

Owns client interactions/communications in implementation/enhancement projects

Guides clients to the best solutions and data architecture/design in high complexity implementation/enhancement projects

Leads high value data COE process improvement projects

Trains and leads lesser experienced data analysts

Prioritizes and manages tasks effectively using time management skills

Demonstrates critical thinking skills and understanding of conditional logic

Communicates effectively; across multiple departments and to leadership as necessary

Demonstrates general understanding of Agile Methodology

Demonstrates knowledge of end-to-end member, provider, authorization and other ancillary data exchanges


Bachelor's degree required

3+ years of system/data analysis experience required

Competent level of understanding of SQL, PL/SQL, and API's of assigned modules

Solid understanding of conditional logic

Demonstrated advanced proficiency in MS Office applications

Ability to travel to client sites as required

Strong communication skills (interfacing between external and internal stakeholders)

Strong organizational, time management skills with ability to prioritize tasks effectively

Knowledge of healthcare industry data standards and formats – X12, HL7, FHIR, etc. JSON, XML, Custom Delimited, etc.is a plus

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) and its subsidiaries comprise a global health services and financial company that serves millions of people worldwide through our health, pharmacy, behavioral, dental, disability, life, accident and international products and services. Our mission is to help improve the health, well-being and sense of security of the people we serve.

Role Summary
Cigna is seeking a highly motivated team member with strong data and analytics background, reporting to the Senior Manager of Digital & Analytics (D&A), to join our growing and dynamic team leading and supporting the development of our D&A strategy and execution of our strategy. This individual will be an active contributor in high-visibility large-scale projects that drive the organization’s Digital & Analytics adoption and engagement. This individual will be responsible for conducting advanced analytics and research activities in efforts to make recommendations supporting digital, analytics, and technology initiatives, as well as a key contributor to provide data-driven analyses and strategic communication to senior leaderships with a focus on consumer insights and healthcare outcome.

This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.


Support the development of cross-functional initiatives to improve Cigna and Evernorth’s digital adoption and engagement, design sustainable solutions, and turning our strategic recommendations into reality through a test-and-learn approach

Develop a rigorous and detailed understanding of our Digital and Analytics KPIs driving business outcome, by product, services; being able to link our strategy and execution to measurable, quantitative outcome

Collaborate effectively with D&A and business leaders influencing outcomes through effective verbal and written communication skills including planning and facilitating workshops, developing compelling senior-level presentations and other highly visible communications

Conduct analyses to identify business use cases, capability requirements, and digital, technology & data dependencies to support the our key strategic initiatives

Perform various financial/quantitative analyses including the complex data research, data mining, data exploration, statistical reporting and data analysis methodologies to identify trends in large data sets

Interpret business feedback and results to succinctly create compelling recommendations and solutions for senior leadership sponsorship and buy-in


Bachelor Degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Sciences, Math, Statistics, Actuarial Science or a related quantitative field strongly preferred

Strong technical skills required to explore, extract, organize, transpose and analyze large data sets housed in Teradata/Hadoop/Postgres using SQL and SAS/R/Python

Ability to build Visualizations using SAS/R/Python to tell a Data Story

Statistical training in school or through work (ability to formulate and execute appropriate hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, power analysis, bootstrapping, regression modeling, etc.)

Self-Starter who enjoys problem solving and creating innovative solutions

At least 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or business analytics roles (experience with healthcare data preferred)

Strategic thinker with the ability to develop sophisticated quantitative analyses and synthesize the results into implications and communicate recommendations to senior leadership

Experienced in developing and analyzing complex financial models and other quantitative assessments including business KPIs, ROI, P&L, etc.

Proven business acumen with experience researching marketing trends and consumer insights, category analysis, competitive benchmarking, etc.

Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of shaping messages appropriately for a senior-level audience and proficiency using MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Team
Pharma Reporting maintains a highly experienced team that is dedicated to data delivery, analytics, and reporting functional areas. Our reporting is designed to provide data analytics in a timely manner while ensuring that our clients, Pharmaceutical Manufacturers, receive actionable data that can be used to monitor activity, as well as develop program improvement recommendations. Through our various software applications, data feeds, and secured third-party communications; Accredo can collect and track a significant volume of data and provide the most comprehensive reporting to our clients.

Position Summary
The Business Analyst ensures that Specialty Pharmacy reports for Pharma Manufacturers are delivered to our internal and external data recipients on time and accurately. The Business Analyst will be on point to troubleshoot any client concerns to determine if it is an operational or reporting issue, and act accordingly. The Business Analyst is a data liaison between the client and Accredo Specialty Pharmacy.
The Business Analyst assist in the launching of new data reports by completing contract reviews, mapping requirements, and ensuring developed reports are accurate in meeting the contract requirements. Productive relationships with our internal partners will be necessary for a successful product launch.

Essential Functions
Build and maintain relationships with external clients and internal partners
Review and redline contracts to ensure alignment with HIPAA guidance and the team’s reporting standards
Translate the contracted data requirements into a detailed mapping document for a developer to create the report(s)
Troubleshoot any client concerns to determine if it is an operational or reporting issue, and take the appropriate action
Audit reports, correct data errors, and communicate findings with all levels of employees and management, including internal business units and external clients
Ensure quality reporting through a thorough knowledge and understanding of the report logic, analysis of discrepancies, and ability to determine root cause of issues
Thoroughly organize and document end to end process of the launch and any production support concerns
Participate in special projects with senior level or management oversight

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
2-5 years relevant experience or Master’s degree
Strong customer service focus
Adaptability and eagerness to learn
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organization skills
Must be a proven problem solver
Immaculate attention to detail with the ability to understand the bigger picture
Familiarity with health care or pharmaceutical industry very helpful
Follow policies and procedures to ensure audit and corporate compliance
Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and meet deadlines in a high-demand environment
Ability to work collaboratively with other departments and levels of employees to resolve complex issues
Works largely through self-directed effort or partnering with others; solid performance with minimal supervision
Preferred technical skills
Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access
User Acceptance Testing (UAT) or Data Quality Assurance (QA) experience
Business Objects
Oracle and Teradata SQL

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
The Quality Review and Audit Lead Analyst, supports Front End Pharmacy Operations in meeting their objective to consistently deliver accurate prescriptions to patients. This is accomplished by providing a timely, comprehensive review of internal errors captured in the Internal Non-Conformance Reporting System (INCRS) to assess the accuracy of required prescription elements as defined by established policies and documented procedures. All team members participate in creating quality products to include coaching packets with detailed coaching notes to support Front-Line Leaders and educate employees; weekly reports to track quality results; data analysis to provide insight to trends and opportunities; and recommendations for improvements based on findings to drive quality performance.

WORK SHEDULE:
Training work schedule: Monday -- 8 AM to 4:30 PM CST

Flex time schedule option may be available after training with core working hours between 9 AM to 2 PM CST Monday - Friday


MUST HAVE -- FRONT END HOME DELIVERY EXPERIENCE IN HEADER ENTRY & ORDER COMPLETION
MUST HAVE -- PHARMACY TECHNICIAN CERTIFICATION (PTCB)

Minimum 3 years of production experience as a pharmacy technician

Additional Protocol areas may include Doctor Call & Quick Start

Strong analytical skills

Ability to consolidate & analyze data using Excel and/or Bi query

Strong PC skills including Microsoft Office, Internet & email

Strong quality background & presentation skillset

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong prioritization skills

Strong leadership skills with some supervisory experience preferred

High regard for superior quality of service

Strong analytical skills

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

High speed internet with wired Ethernet connection. Not hot spot or Satellite

Private and quiet workspace

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Lead Analyst
High Band 3

Role Summary:
This position will be responsible for conducting quality reviews of HCP-HS contracts both manually and using automated inspection tools. The candidate will have the ability to drive change, and positively impact the accuracy and efficiency of the team. Candidates selected for these critical roles will work closely with management and the Technical Coaches to recommend / implement corrective actions to address top defect trends and root-causes.

Duties include:
Conducts data analysis and data mining activities, using SQL and BI tools, to determine the root cause and develop recommendations to mitigate risks
Pulls Data and Conducts comparisons of source (contract) information relative to demographic, contract, network and reimbursement data that has been submitted for processing (pre-submission and post-loading).
Diagnose problems and perform root cause analysis based on policies and procedures
Conducts quality inspections and audits of simple, intermediate and complex healthcare provider records and associated data processed within Cigna systems. Additionally, completes quality inspections audits and reports of healthcare provider directory / payment records and data within Cigna systems against source information.
Responsible for validation / dispute of defects identified by third party audits (SAM3 audits, claim panel, audits, etc.)
Ensure that expected CQI turnaround times are adhered to and that batches progress appropriately through CQI process. CQI must provide timely and constructive feedback to staff regarding issues that have been identified.
Facilitate team conference calls as required by management
Assesses the accuracy of provider data processed to and within Cigna systems in accordance with documented and standard operating policies and procedures.
Maintains organized and complete files (including documented support for audit findings).
Continually strives to improve their own skills and competencies by demonstrating initiative to participate in ongoing coaching and training programs
Acts as a coach and mentor to less experienced staff.


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent or relevant experience.
Experience in ETL with Tools. SQL Server Integrations Services (SSIS) required.
PL/SQL, Oracle, DB2, T-SQL-SQL Server 2016+ required.
JSON, JSON Schemas required
Web Services (SOAP, XML, REST, and /or JSON) preferred.
Demonstrate superior knowledge in Database Tuning and optimization (MS SQL Server 2016) including stored procedures, functions, index, custom types, JSON, JSON Schemas and triggers.
Experience analyzing, designing, developing, testing, troubleshooting and implementing thoughtful and cost-effective software solutions and applications.
Work with senior developers to understand and design new solutions.
Determines, investigates, and carries out application problem resolutions & code fixes until the problem is resolved.
Translate business and technical requirements into well-engineered, tested, and deployed business application systems.
Complete Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) experience required.
Ability to work effectively with end-users, project teams, senior management with minimal supervision.
Detail oriented, with proven time management skills (including the ability to engage in multiple tasks and meet deadlines/standards).


Problem Solving, Analytical, Creative Thinker
Communicating
Managing Through Systems
Organizing
Listening
Creativity
Time Management

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Job Summary:
The Sales Effectiveness team works collaboratively to support our Sales Partners with business-critical reporting, value add insights and data. We are flexible and ready to prioritize when required. Ultimately, we want to help Sales to sell more and sell better. If you are someone who excels in data extraction and analysis, collaborating very closely with key stakeholders and always looking for opportunities for efficiency gains then this is the role for you.
We are an evolving team with a combination of strong leadership, ambition, collaboration, fun and incredible growth opportunities. Through dashboard building and reporting, deep-dive never seen before analysis and close communication with other teams you will enable our Sales Partners to advise their clients to make smarter, better and more lucrative decisions.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with sales partners to develop reports for all sales channels and business leadership to monitor and assess the quantity and quality of sales
Develop templates and dashboards as necessary to facilitate the above and create scalability, ease of use or replication and consolidation
Partner with the Business Analytics team to ensure close collaboration for requests to reduce redundancies, leverage expertise
Leverage tools such as Tableau to improve visuals and “storytelling” of data
Provide analysis and summarize data using strong SQL and Excel skills
Understand the importance of putting controls in place for data validation and consistently quality checking data
Create in depth analytical information on an ad-hoc basis as needed
Demonstrate productivity through the efficient use of time and a commitment to strong results


Bachelor’s Degree preferred or equivalent amount of work experience
Intermediate to advanced skills in Tableau (Use advanced features e.g. parameters, sets, filters, and forecasting to build a range of charts and to analyze a variety of data types. Create appealing dashboards that make it easy for users to explore data and gain i nsights.
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel (i.e. Pivot Tables, V Lookup, Macro creation)
Intermediate to advanced skills pulling and manipulating large and complex datasets using SQL required
Strong attention to detail, professionalism and presentation delivery
Experience working with stakeholders to understand objectives and turning that into meaningful analysis
Perform ad-hoc exploration of data to highlight business opportunities.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities and ability to work with abstract information
Excellent communication skills along with the ability to integrate with people across different teams within the organization in a remote environment
Strong time management and planning capabilities.

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
Job Summary:
The Business Analyst focuses on the use of information and analytics to improve healthcare delivery and optimize consumer and provider focused business processes. This position is responsible for the reporting, moving, and loading of data from vendors and business systems into internal networks and programs.
Daily work involved requires the creation and execution of queries against business systems, developing reports, dashboards, and other custom tools using said data. They will be responsible for the extraction and analysis of health care provider information, evaluating, writing, and presenting reports (compliance, inventory, progress). Support business operations for internal and external customers in an effort to facilitate compliance and improve the quality of services provided to members and providers. This individual is responsible for data research using multiple sources of data and analyzing algorithms. The individual will be required to work on projects with others within the department and within internal networks. Additionally, they will be responsible for using programming to pull out data and interpret it in a way that is meaningful and effective to the project or task at hand.


Minimum of 2 years of programming data analytics experience.
Must have strong experience in Excel, and Microsoft Access.
Python, R, SQL, M-Code, or low-code / no-code analytical and automation solutions.
Must possess strong organizational, problem solving and analytical skills
Strong, clear and concise written and oral communication skills
Ability to work and help promote change within the department and across networks effectively
10% or less travel required


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems, Business Administration, or equivalent is preferred
A web based, job ready portfolio of past data analyst work completed
Alteryx experience is a PLUS
Tableau experience is a PLUS
Python pandas, NumPy, JuPyter experience is a PLUS
Python visualization experience (MattPlotLib, FusionCharts, Seaborn, etc) is a PLUS
Experience setting up APIs (Application Programming Interface) a PLUS
SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) experience a PLUS
QNXT, FACETS or other healthcare payer system experience a PLUS
Microsoft SharePoint skills and experience a PLUS
SAS experience is a PLUS
Excel PowerQuery & PowerBI experience is a PLUS
DAX coding experience is a PLUS
C#, Visual Basic, or Java Script.
Experience developing custom software solutions to promote automation is a PLUS.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst-eviCore-Work from Home
Job_Description:
The Business Analytics Lead Analyst position will be a member of the Strategy and Tool Quality Enablement team. This position will compile and analyze data to support root cause analysis, identification and implementation of improvement opportunities, and validation of improvement results. As well as support automated solution development and implementation within multiple quality organizations by taking a technical processes and applying it to a business solution. Applying knowledge of business and the market place to advance the quality organization goals.

This role requires strong technical and analytic skills. Candidate should have demonstrated expertise in SQL development, data mining, predictive modeling, statistics, data correlation, regression analysis, and other advanced analytic techniques.

This is an individual contributor role which will require utilizing independent judgment and discretion within and across a large business organization and its matrix partners in an evolving environment. Actions have significant and direct impact on key Department objectives.

This role supports daily production operations and also partners with management to implement improvements that will drive future performance through optimization of processes.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintain and enhance an Automated SQL-based delivery system designed to get sufficient work on a daily basis to onshore and international Quality Reviewers:
Extract claims data (PCLM, PMHS, facets)
Augment data (ePro, eligibility, auth, etc.)
Delivery daily production sample of claims to be reviewed
Weekend/Holiday support, as needed.
Perform ongoing Analytics and Reporting, to monitor and improve quality results
Use descriptive and predictive analytics to identify claims with highest propensity for error
Partner with management to align on claim sample changes
Automate analytics and reporting
Special project support to developing Quality initiatives
Lead baseline data efforts for issues such as 3rd party audit readiness, NPS score improvements, etc…


Proven proficiency with SQL programing language
Ability to query Cigna databases (i.e. Proclaim, PMHS, Facets, CED, etc)
Experienced user of SQL Server Management Studio 2008
Exposure to healthcare end-to-end claim analytics
Experience with plan coverage, client contracts and data, claim systems
Knowledge of predictive modeling and/or descriptive analytics
Familiarity with data mining and management
Claim data expertise required - Auth data, Eligibility data, CBH, SANP, etc. a plus.


Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Finance, Business Information Systems, Informatics, Computer Science, or related field or applicable work experience
Medicare Advantage experience a plus
Experience creating and supporting Dashboards
Visual Studio and/or SSIS experience a plus
Connect-Direct and/or FTP experience a plus
Comfortable presenting findings to an engaged virtual group. Excel/PowerPoint experience a plus.
Other tools that facilitate Analytics, a plus (Python, SAS EM, etc.)
Process Improvement or Lean/Six Sigma Certification preferred

If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.
